name: RStats Workshop Series: Part II
description:
WHO is this for?
- If you are new to R & are short-budgeted on time!
- If you'd like to start working with data in R w/o learning all the programming details first!!
- If you have a neat data set you'd like to explore w/ basic statistics!
- If you are getting started with base R and want to learn more #rstats!

* If any of this is true, this workshop might be for you!
* Come EARLY (545p) for help with set-up, questions reg. tidyverse.

WHAT are we planning?
*RStats Workshop: Part II*
- Using Existing Data OR Loading Yours
- Viewing the Structure of your Data
- Transforming your Data: Basic transformations: z-score, log
- Intro to Probability Distributions: Skewness, Kurtosis
- Checking Normality of Distributions: Shapiro-Wilk vs Kolmogorov-Smirnov, Descriptive stats
- (Intro to) Association Tests: Correlations
- Excel/SAS/SPSS vs R?

* If time permits (if not, part III):
- Hypothesis testing using chi-square tests, t-tests, ANOVAs
- Power analyses
- Handling missing & duplicate data (see R packages ‘mixRasch’, ‘mice’, others)

- Parts III, IV of 'Learning Statistics with R' by Dani Navarro (https://learningstatisticswithr.com/book).
- Statistical exploration of the gapminder dataset w/ R

* For 'RStats Workshop: Part I' material, check out the material on Google Drive (http://bit.ly/rlel-meetup-presentations-gd), GitHub (http://bit.ly/rlel-meetup-presentations-gh) or our Slack channels (https://rladies-eastlansing.slack.com; #workshop-rstats #[masked]-rstats).

description:
____________________
*WHO is this for?*
____________________
- If you are new to R & are short-budgeted on time!

name: 2019 Women in Data Science East Lansing @MSU
description:
R-Ladies East Lansing invites you to join us for the inaugural *2019 Women in Data Science East Lansing Symposium* at Michigan State University!

____________________________________
**Connect. Discover. Inspire.**
____________________________________

When: April 12, 2019 from 11:30a - 5:00p
Where: Natural Sciences Building, Room 326
Our webpage: https://github.com/rladies-eastlansing/WiDS2019/wiki

**REGISTER HERE** http://bit.ly/rlel-wids2019
to attend, present a poster and/or give a ⚡️Lightning Talk!
* Lunch will be provided for registered attendees only.

______________________________
**What we are Planning**
______________________________
Agenda: //github.com/rladies-eastlansing/WiDS2019/wiki/Agenda
Confirmed Speakers: //github.com/rladies-eastlansing/WiDS2019/wiki/Confirmed-Speakers

*Keynote address*
Robin Buell, PLB, MSU
Jenny Bryan, virtually from University of British Columbia

*Technical Vision Talks*
Liz Munch (CMSE)
Julie Winkler (Geography)+

*Career Panel featuring*
Sonja Fritzsche (German Studies)
Yue Qi (CSE)
Ashley Shade (MMG)
Angela Wilson (Chemistry)+

*Posters and Lightning Talks*
You, if you register! http://bit.ly/rlel-wids2019
(see details below)
_________________________
**Who can present?**
_________________________
Poster/Lightning Talk: http://bit.ly/rlel-wids2019
In addition to attending, you have two other ways to participate via a lightning talk and/or poster presentation.
We invite women and underrepresented gender minorities to apply for poster/lightning talk presentations. The gender criterion applies only to presenting authors, not other co-authors. Faculty/staff, postdocs, graduate and undergraduate researchers are especially invited to apply.

See Poster/Lightning Talk guidelines here
https://github.com/rladies-eastlansing/WiDS2019/wiki/Poster-and-Lightning-Talk-Guidelines

_____________________________
**Who can participate?**
_____________________________
Everyone is invited to attend, make connections and contribute to the discussion, regardless of gender.
The WiDS Conference aims to inspire and educate data scientists worldwide, regardless of gender, and to support women in the field.
This technical conference provides an opportunity to hear about the latest data science-related research and applications in a number of domains, and connect with others in the field.

_______________________
**Event Sponsors**
_______________________
https://github.com/rladies-eastlansing/WiDS2019/wiki/Sponsors
College of Natural Sciences | BEACON Center | Microbiology and Molecular Genetics |
CMSE | Digital Humanities | Social Science Data Analytics | Business Analytics

_________________
**Organizers**
_______________________
https://github.com/rladies-eastlansing/WiDS2019/wiki/Organizers

Janani Ravi & Camille Archer
On behalf of R-Ladies East Lansing
Email: [masked] (for any questions, sponsorship interest)
Website: //rladies-eastlansing.github.io | www.rladies.org
Join us: //meetup.com/rladies-eastlansing | Tw: //twitter.com/RLadiesELansing | FB: //facebook.com/RLadiesEastLansing

~ WiDS East Lansing @MSU (https://github.com/rladies-eastlansing/WiDS2019/wiki/)

description:

- GitHub: https://github.com/rladies-eastlansing/meetup-presentations/blob/master/presentations/R_Rstudio_setup_instructions.md

Having trouble with installation & set-up?
Ping us on Slack! Or come 15min early!

USEFUL RESOURCES
- Past workshops: https://github.com/rladies-eastlansing

name: #HowTo Version Control/Git (virtual meeting)
description:
=====================================================
Topic: RLEL: #HowTo Version Control/Git
Time: Mar 23,[masked]:00 PM EST

Log into Slack: https://rladies-eastlansing.slack.com
(Channels: #howto-vc & #2020-git)
Join Zoom Meeting: https://msu.zoom.us/j/460485077
=====================================================

Learn how to use Git (version control software) to manage your R scripts and other collaborative coding projects.

###############
WHO is this for?
###############
- If you are new to Git & are short-budgeted on time!
- If you'd like to start using version control w/o learning all the command line details first!!
- If you've ever wished there was a way to "track changes" or collaborate on a single script just like you can for google docs.
* If any of this is true, this help session might be for you!

#####
PLAN
#####
Before the meetup:
- Go through the slides and the tutorial included (See MATERIALS section)
- Post your VC/Git questions in the Slack channels #howto-vc & #2020-git (https://rladies-eastlansing.slack.com)

During the meetup:
- We will answer the Qs via Slack
- Discuss widely applicable Qs via Zoom for everyone's benefit
- Moderators can demonstrate specific problem areas via screen-sharing

###########
MATERIALS
###########
GITHUB
Repo for this meetup w/ setup instructions, slides, and other useful preparatory material: https://github.com/rladies-eastlansing/2020-git

SLACK
Slack channels + Zoom for Q&A; live interaction
https://rladies-eastlansing.slack.com | #howto-vc & #2020-git | Free signup to Slack possible with msu.edu email ID.

ZOOM
https://msu.zoom.us/j/460485077 (Zoom desktop would be preferable)

SETUP INSTRUCTIONS (** Before the meetup)
*This is a hands-on co-work/Q&A session. Please join via Zoom + Slack with your laptops.
*Install or update R & RStudio.
*Create a GitHub account (if you don't already have one) & Git
*(Optional) Install GitHub Desktop -- the Git GUI version

Having trouble with installation & set-up? Ping us on Slack (https://rladies-eastlansing.slack.com) in the #howto-vc channel.

USEFUL REFERENCES:
*Git Novice from Software Carpentry: https://swcarpentry.github.io/git-novice/

name: R-Ladies-Boulder Kickoff Meeting!
description:
Hi Boulder useRs! We're excited to get the paRty started with our official kickoff meeting!

We plan to introduce the organizers of the group and, more importantly, get to know all of you, how you use R, and what'd you love to see from this group.

Each organizer (Courtney, Lisa, Marta, and Leigh) will also briefly present a fun and/or useful R package created by a women, so we can all learn something while getting to know each other. So bring your thoughts, ideas, and enthusiasm! You can bet we will.

5:45-6:00pm - Arrival and mingling
6:00-7:00pm - Introductions and presentations
7:00-7:30pm - Wrap up and more mingling

Venue and refreshments graciously provided by SomaLogic.

Can't wait to see you all soon!

name: R Ladies Boulder Meetup #2: TidyTuesday
description:
Hi Boulder UseRs! Join us for this month's R Ladies Meetup: TidyTuesday!

We plan to participate in TidyTuesday, which is a fun, low-stress coding challenge posted weekly by the R4DS online learning community.

** Please bring your laptops!**

The goal of TidyTuesday is to flex your tidyverse muscles for data wrangling and plotting. However, if you're new to tidyverse (or a die-hard base R useR), you are also more than welcome to join! This is a chance to learn from more experienced tidyverse useRs and make new connections at the same time.

For more information on TidyTuesday, see here: https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday

5:45-6:00pm - Arrival and mingling
6:00-6:15pm - Introductions & instructions
6:15-7:15pm - TidyTuesday group coding challenge!

Venue and refreshments graciously provided by SomaLogic.

Can't wait to see you all there!

name: R Ladies Boulder Meetup #4: Ugly Holiday Plot Contest!
description:
Hi Boulder UseRs! Join us for this holiday edition of R Ladies: Ugly Holiday Plot Contest!

This extRa special Meetup is a chance for you to let your holiday enthusiasm loose and share with us your ugliest holiday-themed plots. We will also be at a special location: North Boulder Upslope Brewing Company!

*****Please submit your ugly holiday plots to [masked] by December 9th to be included in the ugly plot contest!***** Those without ugly plot submissions are also welcome to attend! All are encouraged to wear ugly holiday attire. For inspiration: reddit.com/r/DataIsUgly/.

During the meeting we will be showing off all of the lovely ugly plot submissions with the option for submitters to say a few words about their plots if they want! Winners will be selected by categories (think: "most likely to make somebody lose their eyesight" or "most variables plotted at once").

Refreshments graciously provided by SomaLogic.

Can't wait to see you all there!

name: R Ladies Boulder Meetup #5: Introduction to Building R Packages
description:
Hi Boulder UseRs! Join us for this month's R Ladies Meetup: How to build a package!

** Please bring your laptops!**

This month our very own Leigh Alexander will be giving us a tutorial on how to build an R package from the ground up. Package ideas are not required, but are definitely encouraged. All skill levels are of course welcome.

5:45-6:00pm - Arrival and mingling
6:00-7:00pm - Package building with Leigh
7:00-7:15pm - Wrap up

Venue and refreshments graciously provided by SomaLogic. Beverages by donation.

Can't wait to see you all there!

name: R Ladies Boulder Meetup #6: Bring Your Own Code Coding Hour
description:
Hi Boulder UseRs! Join us for this month's R Ladies Meetup: Bring Your Own Code Open Coding Hour!

This month we are hosting an open coding night at The Rayback Collective. This is a casual meetup for people to bring their projects, practice skills, and just mingle and share tips, tricks, and expeRtise. Use this time to work through R tutorials, a TidyTuesday challenge, or your own project.

We'll be there by 5:45pm and people are welcome to hang out until Rayback closes.

Can't wait to see you all there!

name: R Ladies Boulder Meetup #7: Introduction to R Shiny
description:
**NOTE: The parking lot rules have changed at SomaLogic. Please park on the street or in the lot behind the building R Ladies is hosted in (2990 Wilderness Place) to avoid being booted or towed.**

Hi Boulder UseRs! Join us for this month's R Ladies Meetup: Introduction to R Shiny!

** Please bring your laptops & cash for beer donations!**

This month our very own Lisa Moller will be giving us a tutorial on how to build an R Shiny app from scratch. Lisa has been learning Shiny over the last few months and she's excited to share what she's learned with us!

If you've never used Shiny before or have only dabbled, this tutorial is for you! Experienced Shiny users are also encouraged to attend and share your knowledge with the group as we work through the tutorial.

5:45-6:00pm - Arrival and mingling
6:00-7:00pm - Intro to Shiny with Lisa
7:00-7:15pm - Wrap up

Venue and refreshments graciously provided by SomaLogic, **Beverages by donation.**

Can't wait to see you all there!

name: First Meet and Greet
description:
Happy Women's Day to all R-Ladies!
Let's meet, get to know each other, what we expect from the group, and collect ideas (what, where and how) for possible future meetups! :) :)

name: How to Teach R - Brainstorming
description:
Who is invited?
If you've ever tried learning or teaching R, or were curious but could never start off, we invite you to come share your thoughts with us. If you have resources you use to learn or teach R, you can bring these with you!

What we plan to do?
We hope to gather ideas and resources about (1) what one needs to use R effectively - at different stages of learning, (2) what the members of this group would like to learn, (3) what the members of this groups would like to teach, (4) what ways of learning/teaching R work and what don't.

What we plan to achieve?
By the end of these two hours, we hope to have a collection of resources and concrete monthly workshops that R-Ladies can offer over the next few sessions.

name: Starting off in R and R-Studio
description:
In Diesem Workshop würden wir die Basics von R unterrichten - wie fängt man mit unterschiedlichen Datensets an, was muss man über diese Daten wissen, und wie findet man das heraus. Wir würden basic programming und visualizations in R kennen lernen. Die Teilnehmer haben auch die Gelegenheit, potentielle Probleme zu diskutieren und Tips auszutauschen. Ziel ist die gemeinsame Erarbeitung von relevanten Werkzeugen für Einsteiger.

In this workshop we would teach the basics to R - how to start working with different datasets, what one should know about them, and how to evaluate these. We would familiarize ourselves with basic programming and visualizations. Participants would also have the opportunity to discuss potential problems and share tips with each other. The goal is to familiarise beginners to relevant tools

name: Data Transformation and Introduction to Tidyverse
description: We introduce some common data transformation tools and packages for exploring and pre-processing data. We will work through an example data set together, raising and answering a number of questions. Please carry laptops with R and R Studio already installed and running.

name: Data Transformation and Introduction to Tidyverse
description: We introduce some common data transformation tools and packages for exploring and pre-processing data. We will work through an example data set together, raising and answering a number of questions. Please carry laptops with R and R Studio already installed and running.

name: Data Wrangling, Transformation and Communication
description: This month we create an R markdown file!! We take a messy dataset, transform it to a tidy one, all while revising a number of commands from BaseR and Tidyverse. Once we have learnt to wrangle and transform this dataset, we will go a step further, making a simple interactive plot in plotly and using KnitR to create an html document of all that we have learnt.

name: Visualizing Geographical Data
description: This workshop focuses on techniques to visualize different kinds of geographical data and how to plot these on corresponding maps. Material will be provided with the help of a markdown file.

name: Thinking about and exploring data in R
description: We'll work together to think about and solve different data problems using a variety of tools for data wrangling, transformation and plotting.

name: Modeling in R - Part One
description: Regressions, general linear models, mixed models, with a touch of plotting and mapping. We'll cover it all!

name: Modeling in R - Part Two
description: This time we get into the world of GLMs and GLMMs! Please carry laptops with R and R-studio installed.

name: Modeling in R - Part Three
description: This workshop will give us an introduction to machine learning! Please carry laptops with R and R-studio installed.

name: Analysing Twitter Data
description: In this meetup we will learn the basics of accessing, cleaning, wrangling and visualizing Twitter data. If you'd like, you can install the following packages beforehand - "tidyverse", "tm", "rtweet", "wordcloud2" and "tidytext".

name: Tidy Tuesday - Come and practice your R skills
description:
Do you want to practice your R-skills? Do you want to improve your abilities to clean, analyse and plot data?

Then this event is what you need! We will use the data from Tidy Tuesday as an excuse to work with R. We will meet to work independently using the same data-set. Each one can choose which analysis to perform or which tools to use (you can already think what you want to practice or learn). We will do this together to have the opportunity to ask others and because coding together is fun!

This activity is for everyone, from beginners to experts. You will set your own goal. We will have a coffee (or what ever you prefer) while working together. This way we can have the opportunity to ask others, to share ideas and code!!

Tidy Tuesday a weekly data project aimed at the R ecosystem. Every week a new data set is uploaded and analysed by the community, then the plots can be shared! Las week data from the fires in Australia was analysed. Have a look at some of the community plots on Tweeter:

https://twitter.com/hashtag/tidytuesday

Bring your own laptop.

name: Tidy Tuesday - Come and practice your R skills
description:
LAST TIDY TUESDAY!!!

After one and half month of uninterrupted weekly meetups to analyze data we are approaching the end of the Tidy Tuesday Meetings, just before the first anniversary of R-Ladies!!!
If you have not participated yet, do not miss this event! It is a great opportunity to meet us in an informal environment and practice your R-Skills independently of your expertise (from totally beginners to experts). And if you have been regularly coming, do not miss this last Tidy Tuesday Evening!

Hope to see you there!

We will use the data from Tidy Tuesday as an excuse to work with R. We will meet to work independently using the same data-set. Each one can choose which analysis to perform or which tools to use (you can already think what you want to practice or learn). We will do this together to have the opportunity to ask others and because coding together is fun!

So far the R-Ladies Freiburg have been working really hard in producing super nice plots! The idea of this meeting is to share our knowledge. You can have a look at them on:

https://twitter.com/RLadiesFreiburg

This activity is for everyone, from beginners to experts. You will set your own goal. We will have a coffee (or what ever you prefer) while working together. This way we can have the opportunity to ask others, to share ideas and code!!

It is also a great opportunity to start doing analysis to add to your portfolio on line, so that others know what you can do! Have a look at:

https://github.com/kyla-mcconnell/tidy-tuesday

https://github.com/ichisa/TidyTuesday

IMPORTANT:

Bring your own laptop. Hopefully with enough battery.

name: R-Ladies for all! Networking event and Anniversary celebration
description:
We turn one! Come celebrate with us! :) There will be food, drinks and a whole lot of lovely people!

If you're new, come say hello, ask us your questions, tell us your ideas. If you're revisiting, tell us what you liked, what you didn't, brainstorm with us for the future and how we can improve our community!

name: First R-Ladies Event
description:
A first meeting for the Fayetteville Arkansas R Ladies.

Hopefully a time to meet, greet, and talk about some R basics.

The meeting location is in Memorial Hall of the UARK campus. The meeting will be in room 242

name: R Ladies Meeting # 2
description: Meet us in Memorial 314 on the University of Arkansas Campus

name: R Ladies Meet and Greet
description: Hello R enthusiasts! We are hosting a meet and greet for those interested at Puritan! Come whenever you want, leave whenever you want. Bring a project, a question, a friend! We can't wait to meet everyone.

name: Arkansas Center for Data Science Recruiter to Provide Webinar
description:
I’m so excited to announce that on Friday the 31st at 3PM, Katie Frazier, a recruiter for the Arkansas Center for Data Science (ACDS) will provide a **FREE** webinar to talk about the mission of ACDS.

She will discuss the following topics:

ACDS purpose
What is an apprenticeship?
Apprenticeships in Arkansas
What do we look for?
What is our interview process?
What companies do we work with?
Tips for applications/resumes

Please join this webinar by link : https://zoom.us/j/2089095106?pwd=Nk95MW9JeklBMjdLa3VMNE5lcjAwZz09

We hope to see many familiar names and hear some amazing questions for Katie! Please share this widely and freely if you know someone who might be interested in the opportunities that ACDS has.

name: Kayce Hyde talks through Data Imputation
description: In Memorial Hall 253

name: Cari Bogulski on Data Cleaning and Alt-Academic Career Paths
description:
THIS EVENT WILL NOW BE AN ONLINE EVENT FOLLOWING THE CLOSING OF THE BREWER HUB IN LIGHT OF COVID 19.

Here is the link to tomorrow's (3/17) R-ladies WebEx remote meeting at 12:15pm:
https://uark.webex.com/uark/j.php?MTID=mc1aaf5d59905560ee0e0bcb5b3c4f14f

We hope you all can join! When you join the meeting please mute your audio and ask questions via the chat box.

Cari is very happy to present on data cleaning and some of what she does. In particular, she will talk about program evaluation as an interesting alt-ac possibility that she hadn't heard of when she was in graduate school.

name: R-Ladies GYN: Analisando dados longitudinais e ML na Indústria Alimentícia com R
description:
​E no dia 12/12/2019, às 19h, o R-Ladies GYN juntamente com a comunidade Data Train oferecera nosso 1° meetup e a Data Train o seu 4° meetup. Neste dia iremos falar sobre como analisar dados longitudinais e como utilizar machine learning na indústria alimentícia utilizando o software R.

O encontro será realizado na Supera Tecnologia às 19hs do dia 12/12 e as inscrições devem ser feitas através do link: https://www.meetup.com/pt-BR/datatrain/events/266957130/.

Endereço: R. C-246, Qd 547 - Lt 02, 43 - Jardim America, Goiânia - GO

Para mais informações acesse https://www.meetup.com/pt-BR/datatrain/events/266957130/.

Nos encontramos lá :)))

Site - www.rladiesgyn.com
Instagram - @rladiesgyn
Linkedin - R-Ladies GYN

name: 2° Meetup: Code Ladies Day em parceria com PyLadies e AI Girls
description:
Somos mulheres. Também atuamos ou somos entusiastas da área de Ciência, Tecnologia e Inovação (CT&I). Lidamos com dados. Modelar, testar, validar, analisar, visualizar informações, buscar insights, gerar valor, faz parte do nosso dia a dia e propósito. Em comemoração ao Dia Internacional da Mulher, reunimos representantes das comunidades AI Girls, PyLadies e R-Ladies Goiânia, com o apoio do IPOG, para incentivar todxs a adentrarem nesse universo também, porque não há nada mais bonito e potente do que mulheres que se juntam numa causa.

Neste evento, contamos com três palestras e uma mesa redonda sensacional.

A comunidade PyLadies vem com uma palestra com pauta em mulheres na tecnologia. São muitas! Vem saber mais :))

Nós, R Ladies GYN, deixamos no ar um gostinho de dúvida. A nossa co-founder, Laís Franco, trás uma palestra intitulada por " É mais fácil do que você imagina! ". Vem descobrir!

A Thâmara, representante da comunidade AI Girls, chega chegando com a palestra "A Era da Inteligência Artificial". Não perca!

A mesa redonda é extraordinária! Com o tema Machine learning, Deep learning e Redes Neurais Artificiais esperamos ter muita conversa e aprendizado.

Venham bater um papo com a gente, estamos te esperando!

Link de inscrição: https://www.sympla.com.br/ai-girls-goiania---code-ladies-day-parceria-com-r-ladies-pyladies-e-ipog__800875

Ps.: Quando dizemos todxs, queremos dizer TODXS mesmo. Pensamos em organizar um espaço kids para que as mães também possam participar, com monitoras voltadas a interagir e cuidar das crianças durante o evento. Para isso, precisamos saber da demanda e da necessidade de vocês. Caso tenham interesse, por favor, preencham o formulário abaixo com algumas informações que facilitem na organização.

https://forms.gle/EDf2TXEd5kikVFpJA

name: R-Ladies Athens - September meeting
description: This month's meeting is dedicated to your own work! Join us on Friday, September 27th, to share the details and look for solutions to your R-related project.

name: R-Ladies December meeting
description: Join us for the last R-Ladies meeting of the semester! Natália Araújo, who recently finished her PhD in Statistics at the University of Georgia, will give us an introduction to library(dplyr). EveRybody is welcome!

name: R-Ladies Santa Barbara Chapter Kick-Off Meeting
venue_name: National Center for Ecological Analysis and Synthesis (NCEAS)
description:
Join us for the first ever meeting of the Santa Barbara chapter of R-Ladies!

R-Ladies (https://rladies.org/) is a world-wide organization to promote gender diversity in the R community. At the kick-off meeting we'll introduce the group and organizers, welcome new members, and discuss future events & activities. You'll also get to check out the cool space and new artwork at the National Center for Ecological Analysis and Synthesis (https://www.nceas.ucsb.edu/).

We're looking forward to meeting many R-Ladies and allies in April!

Follow us on twitter: @RLadiesSB

CODE OF CONDUCT

This group was created so those who identify as women (including trans women, genderqueer women, and non-binary people who identify as women or female in a way that is meaningful to them) have a comfortable place to learn. Anyone who violates or has previously violated this community's Code of Conduct will be refused entry, expelled, and/or any other action deemed appropriate by the Organizer, regardless of event registration, meetup membership or other condition.

name: "How I use R in my work" - Demos & Lightning talks
venue_name: National Center for Ecological Analysis and Synthesis (NCEAS)
description:
Our next event will feature 5-6 lightning talks from local R-Ladies about how they use R in their work. We will have time before and after for mingling.

We are looking for volunteers to give talks! Talks should be between 5-8 minutes. If we get more than 6 talks, we will select a diverse group for this meetup and will make sure to host a similar type of event in the future.

Please sign up here:
https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1udhcKddnmEKmGhuVkSw8FCtIiHINVS4zhiAbOiGDiFA/edit?usp=sharing

name: Mob Programming: coding in small teams
venue_name: National Center for Ecological Analysis and Synthesis (NCEAS)
description:
Hi R-Ladies! For this meetup, we will be Mob Programming, where we code together in small mixed-skill-level teams with just one computer that is rotated between participants. This will give everyone a chance to practice brainstorming, hands-on coding, and communicating with diverse teams.

We will have a brief introduction the data and setup, with the maximum time devoted to coding together. The focus will be on making visualizations with `ggplot2`.

Tentative schedule:

- 5:30 drinks and networking
- 5:45 brief intro to data and setup
- 6:00 mob programming!
- 6:45 sharing and wrap-up

Looking forward to seeing you!

name: Level up your R skills & build confidence through small examples w/ Jenny Bryan
venue_name: National Center for Ecological Analysis and Synthesis (NCEAS)
description:
We are so lucky to have Jenny Bryan as a special guest for our next R-Ladies event! Jenny is a Software Engineer at RStudio, Professor at UBC, R-Lady and creator of humane R packages including googlesheets and usethis.

Jenny's description for her talk:

"We'll learn a bit about specific packages (reprex, datapasta) and the role small examples can play in sharpening your R chops. We'll hopefully also try something completely new (to me!) as a way to explore productive habits and mindset for self-taught coders."

This will be a popular event so please only RSVP if you can attend.

As always we welcome people regardless of gender, but our group is intended for those who identify with a gender minority (trans women, cis women, trans men, non-binary, other). We expect all attendees to abide by our Code of Conduct.

name: Santa Barbara R-Ladies 2019 Kick-Off Meetup
description:
Join us for our first Santa Barbara R-Ladies meetup of 2019!

SB R-Ladies is growing quickly, and we're excited to see (and meet) you at our 2019 Kick-Off meetup on January 24th. We'll give a brief introduction to the group, get your ideas for events/topics you'd like to see in the new year, and mingle to continue building our growing coding community. Small snacks, refreshments, and hex stickers will be provided!

Please RSVP for this event so we can plan accordingly.

We'll look forward to seeing you on Decker's Deck (2nd floor, Bren Hall) on January 24th. *If it's raining, we have a backup room reserved at Bren (so the event will happen rain or shine).*

Anyone with an interest in R is encouraged to participate. It doesn't matter if you never used R or if you are an R expert. The goal is to promote R, exchange knowledge and foster a supportive community for those who identify with a gender minority (trans women, cis women, trans men, non-binary, other). We expect all attendees to abide by our Code of Conduct.

Parking: for those of you joining us from off-campus, you can park in Lot 10 (near the roundabout where Hwy 217 meets UCSB) after 5pm with a Visitor's Permit.

name: Streamlined workflows in R (tips from usethis, here, and more)
venue_name: National Center for Ecological Analysis and Synthesis
description:
Hi R-Ladies!

This meetup will be a presentation with examples you can also do hands-on on your own computer. The focus will be on efficiencies you can bring into your workflow that will streamline your R experience and make it easier to collaborate with others and to ask for help.

We will learn things from the `usethis` and `here` packages, and draw from Jenny Bryan and Jim Hester's "What they forgot to teach you about R" lessons (https://jennybc.github.io/wtf-2019-rsc/).

Tentative schedule:

- 5:30 drinks and networking
- 5:45 presentation & hands-on
- 6:45 drinks and networking

Looking forward to seeing you!

name: Intro to the tidyverse!
venue_name: National Center for Ecological Analysis and Synthesis (NCEAS)
description:
Join us for an "Introduction to the tidyverse" led by Santa Barbara R-Ladies An Bui and Sam Csik from UCSB's Ecology, Evolution & Marine Biology department!

An and Sam will teach useful functions for data tidying, wrangling and visualization using tidyverse packages & functions (e.g. dplyr, tidyr, ggplot2, forcats, etc.). This session will be great for R users at any level, whether it's your first time exploring the tidyverse or if you're refreshing your wrangling skills!

There are opportunities for active coding in this session, so bring your computer with R and RStudio installed, and (if you don't have them already) install packages tidyverse, janitor, and here:

install.packages("tidyverse")
install.packages("janitor")
install.packages("here")

-------------------------------------------
Get materials to follow along with live-coding examples using Option 1 (with GitHub) or Option 2 (without GitHub)
-------------------------------------------
OPTION 1: Get materials from GitHub

Materials to fork/clone from GitHub (directions below if you need help): https://github.com/samanthacsik/Intro-to-the-Tidyverse

Directions for getting set up if using GitHub, prepared by An and Sam: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1zpJEWzhvBzTh34h0lvly_x84fxpjurCY/view?usp=sharing
-------------------------------------------
OPTION 2: Get materials from Google Drive

Materials available to download from Google drive:
https://drive.google.com/drive/u/0/folders/1kRcdYGUaZvmNygygrz1njV5DVfQ7Gyjd

Directions for getting set up if using files from Google drive, prepared by Sam and An:
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1MgYykFylBzpCL3d_LFtQ6bqSFuYHvteT/view?usp=sharing
--------------------------------------------

Come get your tidyverse hex sticker! We look forward to seeing you on May 15th.

**Note: We'll be there 15 minutes early to help people get started. Please bring your computers if you need some support with any of the steps above!

name: Basics of building Shiny apps in R
venue_name: National Center for Ecological Analysis and Synthesis (NCEAS)
description:
Come learn some basics of building a Shiny app in R with a Halloween-themed dataset for our session on Wednesday, October 30th from 5:30pm - 7:00pm at NCEAS!

In this session we'll introduce:

- General app structure
- Adding widgets for user selection & input
- Intro to reactive expressions

To code along, bring your computer with R, RStudio and the tidyverse package installed. Attendees will receive another message close to the meetup date with data & other materials.

Make sure to RSVP, as space is limited.

See you at NCEAS on October 30th!

name: RStudio::conf(2020) highlights
venue_name: National Center for Ecological Analysis and Synthesis (NCEAS)
description:
Join us for an evening of highlights from the 2020 RStudio Conference that just happened in San Francisco Jan 29-30.

Agenda:

- Share a few highlights (all that attended and watched live are welcome to share!)
- Watch video recordings of several RLadies' talks at RStudio::conf
- Discuss change of RLadiesSB leadership; would you like to participate?
- Meet and hang out with other RLadiesSB

Don't forget:

- Space is limited, so please RSVP and if you are no longer able to join please un-RSVP so other RLadies can join
- Please bring snacks or drinks to share, and don't forget your own cup!
- Please bring a name tag if you have one from a previous conference/event!

name: What R we doing in cancer research?*
description:
*This event is a collaboration of Lyon Data Science (https://www.meetup.com/Lyon-Data-Science/) with R-Ladies Lyon. Please register for this event at https://www.meetup.com/Lyon-Data-Science/events/259188960/

For this new session of Lyon Data Science, three cancer researchers from the International Agency for Research on Cancer (IARC) will discuss diverse approaches in studying cancer with applications in R.

First, Dr. Virani will present a surveillance method focused on predictions of cancer incidence trends into the future to determine magnitude and burden over time. Next, Dr. Mariosa will discuss how to use genetic information to identify cancer risk factors using Mendelian randomization. Finally, Dr. Lennon will present examples of determining how different weight trajectories throughout lifetime relate to cancer risk.

name: Reflections from an R Lady in the Untidyverse of Cancer Research
description:
Welcome to our first event! It's free!

R-Ladies Lyon is pleased to welcome Dr. Hilary Robbins, scientist at the International Agency for Research on Cancer (IARC/WHO) in Lyon, France.

Her research develops and applies risk-based approaches to cancer screening, with a current focus on lung cancer screening.

Dr. Robbins will give a brief overview of her career thus far in cancer research, including how R fits into her profile as a researcher. She will discuss how she came to use R, an application from her current research (predicting risk of lung cancer during CT screening), some tips and tricks with her favorite tidyverse packages, and a few reflections about being an R lady in a male-dominated field.

Presenter: Dr. Hilary Robbins
Title: Reflections from an R Lady in the Untidyverse of Cancer Research
Twitter: @hilaryarobbins
https://www.linkedin.com/in/hilary-robbins-6a840223/
https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=ehL9SRcAAAAJ&hl=en

The talk will be held in English but you can ask your questions in French and we will help you translate. R-Ladies offers a platform for women to present their work and everyone is welcome to attend! Pizza and drinks will be provided after the presentation.

Follow us on twitter! @RLadiesLyon

name: *Pre-event*co-learning: dplyr, what happened so far up to episode 8?!
description:
On Monday, RLadies-Lyon are welcoming Romain François, creator of dplyr to Lyon where will be introducing new functions in the soon to be released dplyr 0.9.0 R package.

Us RLadies-Lyon are planning an informal pre-event on a rainy weekend in a warm coffee shop with a co-learning twist, with the aim to catch up on what we may have missed up to episode 8 :-)

This plans to be an informal event on a long rainy weekend which uses Monday's event to motivate us to work our way through the online Advanced R textbook,
Found here:
https://adv-r.hadley.nz/foundations-intro.html

In particular, Chapter 13 on S3 objects, and the vctrs package, because this paragraph is gobbledegook to me right now!!

<<13.1 Introduction
S3 is R’s first and simplest OO system. S3 is informal and ad hoc, but there is a certain elegance in its minimalism: you can’t take away any part of it and still have a useful OO system. For these reasons, you should use it, unless you have a compelling reason to do otherwise. S3 is the only OO system used in the base and stats packages, and it’s the most commonly used system in CRAN packages.>>

Ladies, come and join us for a relaxed Sunday afternoon of coding fun.

Anyone with experience is HIGHLY ENCOURAGED TO ATTEND <3

À dimanche

name: dplyr: episode 9, the rise of the vctrs
description:
RLadies-Lyon would like to welcome Romain François, creator of dplyr to Lyon! He will be introducing new functions in the soon to be released dplyr 0.9 R package.

The event will start promptly at 7pm and will be followed with a round table of informal questions until 9pm.

!!! AN EVENT NOT TO BE MISSED !!!

Find out more about about open-source software and come and ask all of your questions !! https://purrple.cat/blog/2018/03/22/i-m-not-looking-for-a-job

The talk will be in english. Questions can be asked in french also.

Summary
The future dplyr 0.9.0 has been in development for a few months. It brings
exciting new developments largely thanks to the vision and implementation
of underlying packages rlang and vctrs. dplyr is more robust and stable
because of that.

One of the most important changes is that expressions in mutate() and
summarise() can now return tibbles that are either packed or unpacked.

We'll go through the new proposed functions pick() and across() and how they fit together with other functions from dplyr, i.e. mutate() and summarise(), and beyond, e.g. pack() and unpack() from the newest version of tidyr.

name: Kickoff meeting R-ladies Lausanne
description:
Please register on eventbrite here (not on meetup): https://www.eventbrite.com/e/r-ladies-lausanne-tickets-40902966875

• What we'll do

Hello R-Ladies community!
We are ready to kick-start our Lausanne chapter of the R-Ladies!
Come along to this introductory event where we will discuss the mission of R-Ladies, goals of our chapter and get to know each other. This event is hosted at University of Lausanne!
Space is limited so please make sure you RSVP to get your spot.

name: Creating reproducible analyses and reports with R Markdown
venue_address_1: EPFL Innovation Park, Building F, 3rd Floor
description:
• Title of talk •
Creating reproducible analyses and reports with R Markdown

• Speaker •
Claudia Kasper (https://twitter.com/claudia_kasper)

• Requirements •
+ A laptop with R and RStudio installed.
+ R-package RMarkdown (install.packages('rmarkdown’)) and ggplot2 (install.packages(‘ggplot2’) installed.
+ This is a beginner course. Having used basic commands in R before is sufficient, but no knowledge of markdown, latex or anything similar is required.

There will be internet access provided by the host.

• Who is Claudia Kasper •
I am an animal geneticist currently working as a researcher at Agroscope in Posieux, FR, where I work on breeding sustainable pigs. I started my career as an evolutionary biologist, first working on primates, then switching to humans and finally fish and house mice. In all of those systems I was interested in finding out more about cooperation, the social structure enabling it and the genetic basis of this fascinating biological phenomenon. My research is strongly centred on statistics for which I am using R. Having used Mathematica in the beginning, I was missing a neat way to organise my R scripts and to make reports of my findings. After a lot of frustration and literally days of copy-pasting R output into Word documents I discovered RMarkdown a few years ago and I have been using it ever since. Apart from having neater scripts, I ‘knit’ reports of my results as Word or PDF documents, but also presentations and I am trying to do a webpage with RMarkdown. In my free time I play improvisational theatre in Bern in a group which I co-founded.

name: Using R to assess Eye-tracking data when investigating Psychological Processes
venue_address_1: EPFL Innovation Park, Building F, 3rd Floor
description:
• Title of the talk •
Using R to assess Eye-tracking data when investigating Psychological Processes

• Speaker •
Suzannah Stuijfzand ( https://twitter.com/stuijfzandsooz )

• Schedule •
18h00 Arrival
18h15 Presentation
19h30 - 20h30 Apéro + networking

• Who is Suzannah Stuijfzand •
I am a research psychologist currently working as a post doc within the Lausanne Perinatal Research group led by Prof. Antje Horsch. The group investigates perinatal mental health, specifically we investigate the impact of stress and trauma in the perinatal period (the time before, during and after birth) on mothers and their families.
My background is firmly routine in developmental psychology. My research masters in development and socialization in childhood and adolescence and my PhD was on Cognitive processes and their association to Anxiety in young children. My career so far has led me from the UK to the Netherlands for my masters, back to the UK for my PhD and finally my post-doc has brought me here to Lausanne.
My research has necessitated an interest in diverse methodologies in an attempt to overcome the limitations in standard measures (i.e. reaction times) when studying children. I have also has to become accustomed to longitudinal data in order to study development. It is through these elements of my research that have brought me into contact with R in an attempt to make the best use of my data to answer my research questions.

description:

Elise Tancoigne is a post-doctoral fellow at the University of Geneva, where she studies the sociology and history of science volunteering ("citizen sciences"). She likes to experiment with, and also criticize, digital humanities methods.

More about Elise: http://citizensciences.net/elise-tancoigne/

name: Statistical inference in the tidyverse framework: the Infer package.
description:
• Description •
This talk will be about the infer package which aim is both to perform statistical inference using a syntax coherent with the tidyverse framework and to make the common logic behind statistical inference more apparent and intuitive.

• Speaker •
Elise Dupuis Lozeron

• Agenda •
18h00 Arrival
18h15 Presentation
19h15 Apéro

• Elise Dupuis Lozeron •

Statistician, Division of Clinical Epidemiology and Methodological Support Unit, Clinical Research Center (CRC), University Hospitals of Geneva and University of Geneva, Geneva (CH).
Elise Dupuis Lozeron has a PhD in statistics from the University of Geneva. Before joining her current position she has worked for 5 years as a statistician for the Swiss study on Air Pollution And Lung Disease in Adults (SAPALDIA) and for the Department of Adult Intensive Care Medicine, University Hospital of Lausanne (CHUV). Her own research is related to the statistical estimation of complex models using simulation based bias-correction methods.

name: Tidy up your data science workflow with the tidyverse
description:
• Description •
The tidyverse is a coherent system of packages for data manipulation, exploration and visualization that share a common design philosophy.
There are core tidyverse packages that you're likely to use in everyday data analyses, and these include:
- ggplot2
- dplyr
- tidyr
- readr
- purrr
- tibble
- stringr
- forecats
We'll be learning a bit about each of these core packages while demonstrating their functionalities!

• Speaker •
Mine Çetinkaya-Rundel
Mine is a Senior Lecturer in the School of Mathematics at University of Edinburgh and Data Scientist and Professional Educator at RStudio. Mine’s work focuses on innovation in statistics and data science pedagogy, with an emphasis on computing, reproducible research, student-centered learning, and open-source education as well as pedagogical approaches for enhancing retention of women and under-represented minorities in STEM. Mine works on integrating computation into the undergraduate statistics curriculum, using reproducible research methodologies and analysis of real and complex datasets. She is a former R-Ladies RTP and a current R-Ladies Edinburgh organizer.

• Agenda •
18h15 - 18h30 Arrival (+ bring any questions/problems you might have)
18h30 Presentation
19h30 Apéro + Networking

• Prerequisite •
Basic knowledge in R, beginners are welcome!

name: R-Ladies et Tidyverse
description:
Bonjour à tous,
Ça y est nous avons une salle pour le premier meetup R-Ladies. Nous avons hâte de vous recevoir dans les locaux du CNRS de Montpellier, nous enverrons le plan d'accès détaillé aux inscrits.
Nous vous présenterons l'organisation R-Ladies ainsi que le Tidyverse.
Puis nous discuterons ensemble des prochains thèmes que vous voudriez aborder lors de ces meetups.
Les inscriptions seront cloturées 2 jours avant le meetup car nous devons fournir la liste des invités au CNRS la veille pour que vous puissiez rentrer sur le campus.

Cécile et Criscely

name: Let's talk togetheR
description:
(Message in English below)

Bonjour à tous !
Nous préparons l'organisation de notre quatrième meeting R-Ladies Montpellier!
À cette occasion, nous souhaiterions faire une sorte de table ronde où l'on présenterait chacun notre tour de ce qu'on fait avec R.
Cela pourra nous aider à mieux nous connaître et créer plus de collaboration entre nous pour les rencontres suivantes.
Cela nous aidera également à savoir quelles personnes inviter avec des sujets qui pourraient intéresser le plus de monde.
Lors de cette table ronde, si vous souhaitez présenter un ppt, vos principaux packages, vos axes de recherche, tout ce qui nous aide à en savoir plus sur vous est le bienvenu!

Nous vous attendons et nous sommes très heureux de continuer à avancer petit à petit en groupe!

La date prévue pour cette rencontre est le 30 avril, et le lieu sera bientôt annoncé.

Cécile et Criscely

###################################################################

Hello everyone!
We are organizing our fourth meeting R-Ladies Montpellier!
In this opportunity, we would like to have a kind of round table where each of us would present we are doing with R.
This will help us to know each other better and create more collaboration between us for future meetings.
It will also help us to know which people to invite with topics that could interest the most people.
During this round table, feel free to present a ppt, with information about your main packages, your research axes, everything that helps us to know more about you is welcome!

We are waiting for you and we are very happy to continue advancing little by little in a group!

The date for this meeting is April 30, and the place will be announced shortly.

Cécile and Criscely

name: L'Analyse des données hétérogènes avec R, by Susan Holmes
description:
Salut à tous !
Pour ce prochain meetup nous avons l'honneur d'accueillir une invitée EXCEPTIONNELLE, Susan Holmes, qui viendra nous parler de l'analyse des données hétérogènes avec R, appliquée à la santé et au microbiome.

Hi everybody !
For this next meeting we are honored to welcome an EXCEPTIONAL guest, Susan Holmes, who will talk to us about the analysis of heterogeneous data with R, applied to health and microbiome.

name: Gold star reproducibility by Saras Windecker
description:
We are very happy to welcome Saras, comming from Melbourne, for the next meeting. She will talk to us about reproducibility.
Please remember to fill in your real first and last name so that we can make prior authorization requests to enter the CNRS 2 days before the meetup.

See you soon :)

Abstract: Research using R underpins a wide array of applied decision-making. Growing recognition of irreproducibility of results produced using R raises concerns about the credibility of research and the reliability of decisions they inform. Although there are many aspects to reproducible research, one major problem is the basic lack of computational reproducibility of published work – or the ability to rerun an analysis and reproduce the same results. There are many strategies for improving computational reproducibility, such as clear code structure, functional programming, and version control. Besides these tactics, however, we often find that analyses that reproduce on one machine or in one environment do not run in another, or do not run in the future. This problem is related to changing computing environments and software versions, and can be addressed using containerisation. In this talk, I will introduce containerisation and its implementation using an open-access R package. This introduction should be accessible to those who have never heard of or used containerisation before, as well as those who already actively use services such as Docker for containerisation.

name: How to transfigure your code into an R package ?
description:
Premier meetup de l'année !
Venez apprendre comment faire un package avec Nina :-)
Comme d'habitude nous aurons besoin des noms et prénoms des participants afin de fournir la liste au CEFE au moins 24h à l'avance pour que vous puissiez entrer dans les locaux du CNRS, donc ceux qui ont des pseudos, pensez à nous fournir vos noms et prénoms, et à emmener une carte d'identité (ou passeport ou permis de conduire) le jour du meetup.

name: #1: Hands-on data visualisation with ggplot2 & Guest R-Lady Taipei Mia
description:
Welcome!

R-Ladies Berlin would like to welcome you to our first R-Ladies Berlin session kindly hosted by Babbel, the famous language learning app. We would like to introduce R-Ladies global and ourselves and looking forward to meet up with you.

The #1 R-Ladies Berlin tutorial is focussing on data visualisation with ggplot2. R-Lady Mia from Taipei, an expert of Azure Machine Learning Studio and its integration with R, joins us and introduces to us basic principles of data visualisation.  

Please bring your laptop to actively participate in a hands-on session afterwards. Additional material and further instructions are send around prior the meet-up. 

IMPORTANT: Starting time: 6:30 pm. Let's start with mingling and enjoying drinks and little snacks kindly provided by Babbel. The actual program starts at 7:15 pm and ends including another round of mingling around 10 pm.

We're looking forward to meet up with you and get Berlin chapter of R-Ladies global started! 

In case of questions do not hesitate to send us an e-mail: [masked]

Best

Noa, Hanna, Ulrike & Christin

Organizer of R-Ladies Berlin

name: #2 Hands-on Data Manipulation with dplyr & Intro to DRY Functional Programming
description:
Welcome!

R-Ladies Berlin would like to welcome you to our second R-Ladies Berlin session, kindly hosted by Babbel, the famous language learning app. 

The #2 R-Ladies Berlin tutorial is focussing on data manipulation with dplyr. But before we start coding, Noa will introduce the DRY principle and discuss why and how you can start applying it with R.

Please bring your laptop to actively participate in the hands-on tutorial. Additional material and further instructions will be sent around prior the meet-up. 

IMPORTANT: Starting time: 6:30 pm. We'll start with mingling and enjoying drinks and snacks generously provided by Babbel. The actual program starts at 7:15 pm and ends around 10 pm, after another round of mingling.

We are looking forward to meeting you again!

If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to e-mail us: [masked]

Best,
Christin, Hanna, Ulrike & Noa
R-Ladies Berlin Organisers

description:
Dear R-Ladies Berlin members,

we are happy to announce our 3rd Meet-up on Tuesday, 20th June. Babbel, the famous language app, supports us another time providing snacks, drinks and a great location. 

Join us for an exciting session where Journocode-founder Marie-Louise Timcke introduces us to data journalism and journocode itself. 

A tutorial about R markdown and the integration of journocode is going to complement our session prepared by Marie-Louise and R-Lady Chrissy.

We'll keep you updated here and looking forward to meet up with you soon. 

R-Ladies Berlin organizer

Hanna, Noa & Chrissy

name: open data, ok lab and nice summer night
description:
Dear R-Ladies Berlin members,

our next Meet-Up ist going to be on Tuesday, 23rd August. Again we have the honor to be hosted be Babbel, the famous language app, providing snacks, drinks and a great location. 

In the first part, Ulrike will tell us what you can do with Open Data by showing some examples of the Code for Germany community and explaining what Open Data is about. Ulrike is a volunteer lab lead at the Berlin OK Lab (codefor.de/berlin).

Later we will gather in the Volksbar (Rosa-Luxemburg-Straße 39, https://goo.gl/maps/yZ4TUEmSaEv) and enjoy a (hopefully) warm Berlin summer night with drinks and good talks.
