name: Reducing Bias in Algorithms! R-Ladies January meetup
venue_name: Geffen Hall, UCLA David Geffen School of Medicine
description:
Hi Los Angeles R-Ladies!

We'll be having our next meetup on January 26th at 10am (note earlier time!) on campus at UCLA. In addition to an earlier time, we'll also be in a different location! However, it is very close to the previous one.

We’ll be welcoming a guest speaker, RLady Gwynn Sturdevant, to talk about reducing bias in algorithms. This talk will give some examples of algorithms that are biased and the consequences that ensue. Unfortunately, developing equitable algorithms is mathematically complex, and there is no simple way to do so. We will discuss two suggested methods and their drawbacks and conclude with a discussion of ethical matrices.

As always we welcome people regardless of gender, but our group is intended for those who identify with a gender minority (trans women, cis women, trans men, non-binary, other). We expect all attendees to abide by our Code of Conduct.

See you there!
Katie Leap
[masked]

The closest visitor parking is parking structure 18 (and it is much closer than parking structure 2 is to our regular meeting spot) and it is $3 per hour. name: Advanced R Book Club Part 1: Foundations
description:
The LA West R Users Group and RLadies LA are teaming up for a book club series focused on Hadley Wickham’s ‘Advanced R’!

Where: Literati Cafe, 12081 Wilshire Blvd., Los Angeles, 90025
When: 10am, Saturday, August 3rd
Why: "The book is designed primarily for R users who want to improve their programming skills and understanding of the language. It should also be useful for programmers coming to R from other languages, as help you to understand why R works the way it does." - Hadley Wickham

Come join us for coffee and #rstats as we tackle the book’s sections one at a time. Each book club session will have a leader to guide the discussion, and we encourage everyone to take a look at the material beforehand. The full text of the book is online for free at https://adv-r.hadley.nz/.

Here’s the schedule:
• Foundations - August 3, session leader will be Amanda Tilot
• Functional Programming - August 10, session leader will be Amy Chen
• OO Programming - split over August 24 and September 7, session leaders TBD!
• Metaprogramming - split over September 21 and October 5, session leaders TBD!
• Techniques - split over October 19 and November 2, session leaders TBD!

Advanced R dives deep into how R works as a language, and we highly recommend joining us for the first two sessions if you’re relatively new to R. We’re also looking for discussion leaders for the later sections of the book, so please reach out to Amy or Amanda if interested!

This is a buy-your-own-coffee event, so let's support Literati Cafe. As we're cohosting with the LA West RUG, all R users are welcome! Lastly, we expect all attendees to abide by the RLadies Code of Conduct, available here: https://www.meetup.com/rladies-la.

See you there!
Amanda

"This is the perfect book for someone who wants to understand R at a level slightly deeper than necessary for an analyst and less than a base R contributor. If you're interested in programming language design or at looking under the hood of R, this book rocks. " - Goodreads review

Each book club session will have a leader to guide the discussion, and we encourage everyone to take a look at the material beforehand. The full text of the book is online for free at https://adv-r.hadley.nz/, and there's an exercise answer guide at https://advanced-r-solutions.rbind.io/.

Here’s the schedule:
• Foundations - August 3, session leader was Amanda Tilot
• Functional Programming - August 10, session leader was Amy Tzu-Yu Chen
• OO Programming - split over August 24 (Base Types, S3, and R6) and September 7 (S4 and Trade-offs), session leader was Daniel Jacobs
• **Metaprogramming - split over September 21 (Ch 17, 18, 19) and October 5 (Ch 20, 21), session leader will be Emil Hvitfeldt!**
• Techniques - split over October 19 (Ch 22, 23) and November 2 (Ch 24, 25), session leaders will be Jake Kramer and Malcolm Barrett respectively!

Advanced R dives deep into how R works as a language, and we highly recommend joining us for the first two sessions if you’re relatively new to R. We’re also looking for discussion leaders for the later sections of the book, so please reach out to Amy or Amanda if interested!

This is a bring-your-own-coffee series, but we'll try to provide something sweet. As we're cohosting with the LA West RUG, all R users are welcome! Lastly, we expect all attendees to abide by the RLadies Code of Conduct, available here: https://www.meetup.com/rladies-la.

See you there!
Amanda & Amy

"This is the perfect book for someone who wants to understand R at a level slightly deeper than necessary for an analyst and less than a base R contributor. If you're interested in programming language design or at looking under the hood of R, this book rocks. " - Goodreads review

**To become more involved**
Invite yourself to our SoCal R Users Slack group and join #adv-r-bookclub for discussions: http://bit.ly/laerug
Check out more events: laocr.org/

name: End of year shindig! R-Ladies December meetup
venue_name: Geffen Hall, UCLA David Geffen School of Medicine
description:
Hi Los Angeles R-Ladies!

We'll be having our next meetup on December 7th at 11 am on campus at UCLA. This event will be a social one, but please bring your ideas for future meetups!

Update: The wonderful folks at RStudio sent us a big bag of package hex stickers! Bring your laptop/water bottle/whatever and let's decorate! Also, we're going to try out a tidyverse-based murder mystery game put together by fellow RLady Vebashini Naidoo! You can check it out in advance here: https://github.com/sciencificity/reclues.

As always we welcome people regardless of gender, but our group is intended for those who identify with a gender minority (trans women, cis women, trans men, non-binary, other). We expect all attendees to abide by our Code of Conduct.

See you there!
Katie Leap
[masked]

Location details:

The closest visitor parking is parking structure 18 and it is $3 per hour. There is also street parking on Hilgard Ave and the surrounding neighborhood. https://main.transportation.ucla.edu/campus-parking/visitors/pay-station-rates-and-locations

name: RLadies January Study Group
description: Join us at Literati Cafe on Wilshire Blvd. for dedicated time to get help with R or work on a coding project! Amy and Amanda will be there for help and support, so feel free to drop by with a question or stay and work!

name: RLadies February Study Group
description:
Join us at Literati Cafe on Wilshire Blvd. for dedicated time to get help with R or work on a coding project! Katie and Amanda will be there for help and support, so feel free to drop by with a question or stay and work!

No need to come right at 6:30 or stay until 9:00, we'll be there the whole time.

name: RLadies LA RMarkdown Virtual Meetup!
description:
Hello RLadies!

Due to the coronavirus situation in LA County, RLadies LA and our other local R users groups are moving our usual meetups online for the next few months. Our first virtual meetup will be Saturday, March 28, at 10am. Amanda Tilot will give a tutorial on using RMarkdown for data analysis and reporting.

"Better data communication & organization with RMarkdown"

What do a static PDF, an interactive HTML document, a personal website, and a slide deck all have in common? You can build them in R with RMarkdown! In this tutorial, we'll work through some common scenarios where RMarkdown can help improve your data communication and organization.

* Shifting from R script files + lots of #comments to RMarkdown notebooks
* Turning your R code into HTML, PDFs, and Word docs with knitr
* Enhancing your RMarkdown files with text formatting and presentation options
* Doing more with code chunks: SQL queries & background jobs

**Schedule**
10:00a - 10:15a Open Zoom, come say hi!
10:15a - 11:00 RMarkdown tutorial
11:00 - 11:15 Extra Q&A, planning future sessions

Have a question about using RMarkdown that you'd like Amanda to cover? Post a comment on the event page!

We'll send out a Zoom link to all attendees closer to the 28th, and include instructions for joining the meetup. All materials from the tutorial will be available on Github afterward.

As always we welcome people regardless of gender, but our group is intended for those who identify with a gender minority (trans women, cis women, trans men, non-binary, other). We expect all attendees to abide by our Code of Conduct.

See you there!
Amanda Tilot
@aktilot

PS: We're always looking for presenters! If you're interested, please reach out to Amanda ([masked]) or Katie ([masked]).

name: Planning meeting
description: Gathering to plan the actual kick-off meetup and the future events.

name: R-Ladies Helsinki Kickoff!
description:
What is R? What is R-Ladies? How to use R in practice? Welcome to the first ever R-Ladies Helsinki Meet-up to hear about these topics and mingle with fellow enthusiasts.

Schedule
18.00 Welcome
18.10 Intro to R-Ladies and community
18.30 Data Science & R in Omnichannel customer experience creation
19.15 Introducing and discussing the future of R-Ladies Helsinki and program
19.30 Networking

name: DevOps for Data Science
description:
DevOps for Data Science or
How to build a data pipeline that is not a giant house of cards built from random scripts that will all completely collapse the moment any input does anything weird (see https://xkcd.com/2054/)

We’ve all heard the saying about the 80-20 rule in data science, that most of the project time is spent on wrangling the data in to correct format and only a fraction on the actual model building. The truth is actually even worse: there’s also the effort needed to make sure your model will not explode when left to run on its own in production – or to make sure you will notice when it does.

That’s where DevOps comes in. In this talk Seija Sirkiä will introduce basic concepts like version control and CI/CD (continuous integration, continuous development) and attempt to do this from the perspective and to an audience of data scientists (maybe particularly those who use R and RStudio). This is not a lesson in exact tools but more a plea for a change in attitude. It is true that we are not software engineers and we don’t exactly produce software but a big part of our daily troubles are the same.

Program:
18.00 Welcome !
18.10 Seija Sirkiä and DevOps for Data Science
19.10 Mingle and questions
20.00 Closing the event

Place: Houston Analytics, Konepajankuja 1

name: Genomic data science
description:
Where did my ancestors live? What is my risk for coronary heart disease? Genomic data science involves analysing and interpreting the information in genome sequences by applying statistics and computer science. Genomics plays an important role in many endeavors towards personalized medicine and although consumer DNA testing is becoming a mainstream phenomenon, many questions still need to be answered before genome data can be widely applied in clinical care. Genomics produces huge volumes of data, and this meeting will dive into the different aspects and challenges of analysing it.

Program:
18.00 Welcome
18.10 Nina Mars, Genomic data science
19.10 Questions and mingle
20.00 Closing the event

name: Writing sharable (R) code. Oh… and sharing it!
description:
Join this session where we will build an R package, write unit tests for it, push it in a GitHub repository and integrate Travis CI with it!
If time permits, we can discuss briefly at the end how to build a drat repository — aimed to host multiple R packages — using GitHub as a Web Server, and how to use Travis CI to automatically push updates of your packages into the drat repo.

If you have never created an R package before, you may feel like this is too much information in a just short while. But don’t let this overwhelm you! The aim of this session is to introduce you to the relevant concepts, as we will touch upon the most important of them rather than diving into details. Even if you don’t fully understand what you are doing during the session, you will hopefully leave with a different perspective on how you can organise your code (for yourself or others) and gear up with the needed resources for the next time you want to reproduce these steps more seriously.

Prerequisites:
- Bring your own laptop!
- (Optional) Rstudio installed; this is not necessary to produce R packages but it does make your life easier as the main package for R package development, devtools, is well integrated with RStudio.
- The following R packages:
- devtools, usethis and roxygen2
- tidyverse, rlang
- (optional) drat
- ... if I have forgotten something, we will install it on the spot.
- A GitHub account. I could list this also as optional, but if you want the full experience from this second half of the session, it’s good to reproduce the steps yourself. You are of course welcome either way.
- A travis account (go to travis-ci.com and sign up with GitHub; this prerequisite assumes you already have a GitHub account)

Program:
18.00 Welcome
18.10 Maria Kalimeri, "Writing sharable R code."
19.30 Questions and mingle
20.00 Closing the event

name: Intro to Tidyverse
description:
This workshop is designed for those who have some experience with R.
We will be using Tidyverse to introduce importing, manipulating and visualizing data. The objective of the workshop is to teach the basic knowledge of Tidyverse packages such as dplyr, ggplot2.

The Only requirement is that R and RStudio should be installed on your laptops.

We’d like to thank Seriously Digital Entertainment to sponsor of June event of R-Ladies Helsinki.

name: R-Ladies summer afterwork/mingle
description:
Come and join R-Ladies community for drinks and chill hangout. BYOB!

In case of bad weather, we have a contingency plan.

name: NLP with R
description:
Welcome to learn how to NLP with R (partly) hands on!

We'll go through
- Basic text wrangling
- Visualisation eg. wordclouds
- Predictive model(s) (focus on Starspace)
- How to actually use the model
- Some examples

You'll need your laptop, R and preferably RStudio installed if you want to follow hands on. Bring also your curious self!

name: ggplot2 for data visualisation
description:
During the workshop, we'll focus on thinking behind the ggplot2 package and its chart-making power. We will also focus on how to make visualisations that are easily digestible for various stakeholders and we'll cover a few tips & tricks for quick "good" look of charts.

Prerequisites:
- RStudio and R installed on your machine
- tidyverse, or at least ggplot2 installed (instructions can be found here: https://tidyverse.tidyverse.org/, you don't need the absolute latest version for this workshop).
- have some basic knowledge of R (it's enough if you for example attended one of the R workshops with R Ladies or Mimmit Kodaa)

We will aim to start at 6pm sharp, so please make sure to arrive on time!

name: Building Dasboards with R Shiny
description:
During this workshop you will learn how to create interactive dashboards with Shiny. Dashboards are great to communicate and present your analysis and results.

We will go through following subjects:
- Overview and structure of a Shiny Dashboard
- Adding dynamic content for your dashboard
- Customize your dashboard with skin

Prerequisites if you want to code by yourself:
- R and RStudio installed on your machine
- Packages shiny, shinydashboard, ggplot and tidyverse installed

If you want to get familiar with the subject beforehand, check this tutorial:
https://rstudio.github.io/shinydashboard/index.html

SPECIAL GUEST: Amanda Tilot from R-Ladies LA will be talking about academic figure making, how to reduce the time spent fussing with individual graph panels.

name: Reproducible research and how to do it with RMarkdown
description:
During this workshop, you will learn how to create reproducible research files with RMarkdown and how to share them.

We will go through the following subjects:
- Overview and structure of rmarkdown files
- Adding charts and tables to documents (PDF, HTML, etc.)
- Customize your document

Prerequisites if you want to code by yourself:
- R and RStudio installed on your machine
- Packages knitr, kable, tidyverse installed

If you want PDF documents with LaTeX you need to download:
- Windows user: MikTex (https://miktex.org/download)
- MacOS user: MacTex (https://www.tug.org/mactex/mactex-download.html)
- Linux user: Use package manager

If you want to get familiar with the subject beforehand, check this cheatsheet:
https://rstudio.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rmarkdown-cheatsheet.pdf

See you on Monday!

name: Data Talks: Happy IWD 2020!
description:
We are celebrating Women's Day at our Data Talks event!
At Data Talks you'll get to hear the most fascinating speeches from data professionals, enjoy good food and meet interesting new people.

We'll be at Wunderdog's office!
Address: Kaisaniemenkatu 1c, 4th floor

***

Program:

17:30 Networking
18:00 Welcome
18:20 Data talks (we'll release speakers and topics soon)
20:00 Closure

***

See you in March!

name: R-Ladies Lancaster Launch!
description:
R-Ladies Lancaster is ready to announce our first event!

Our launch event will include a number of talks about R, and there will also be plenty of time for networking over pizza! (Big thank you to H20.ai for sponsoring the pizza at our launch event).

Schedule:

18:00 - 18:20: Registration
18:20 - 18:30: Introduction to R-Ladies and the local groups
18:30 - 18:50: Nic Crane: Ten Steps to Becoming a Tidyverse Contributor
18:50 - 19:20: Pizza break/networking
19:20 - 19:40: Rhian Davies: A day in the life with R. A whirlwind tour.
19:40 - 20:00: Lucy Morgan: The rocky road to building my first R package
20:00 - 20:30 Networking/close

Nic Crane (Elucidata): 10 Steps to Becoming a Tidyverse Contributor
In 2018 I became a contributor to the tidyverse and realised that you don't have to be an R expert to get involved. In this talk, I will discuss why I was originally hesitant to contribute to open source, but how the R community made me realise my doubts were unfounded. I'll walk you through the stages of making a pull request to a tidyverse package and discuss my experiences of doing so. Whilst the focus of this talk is on contributing code, I conclude with the other valuable ways you can get involved, whether you've been using R for 2 weeks or 20 years. I'd love to make this talk interactive, so please bring any questions you have!

Rhian Davies (Jumping Rivers): A day in the life with R.
I've been using R for many years and at the moment it feels like I basically run my life in the medium of R. I'll give an whirlwind tour of a day in my life as an analyst and all the weird and wonderful ways R helps - and hinders.

Lucy Morgan (Lancaster University): The rocky road to building my first R package
I heard that putting an R package together was simple once you had functions that worked. I must have heard wrong. In this talk I’ll discuss a few of the difficulties I had in starting to build my first R package (you can then avoid these). I’ll also add a few tips from the package building process and demonstrate building a very simple package in R.

*** Venue ***

We're meeting in Room A076 of the Science & Technology building. This might be tricky to find, but there will be plenty of signs up. You can download a campus map:

https://github.com/rladies/meetup-presentations_lancaster/blob/master/admin/campus-map.pdf.

The star represents the room we will be in, and I have highlighted the main entrances to the building. Note that building is locked after 6pm. We will be around the main entrances from 6:00pm - 6:20pm to greet you and let you in, so please try to arrive promptly! If you are running late, please ring me [masked]) and we'll come and let you in.

If you need more or advice help finding the location, please get in touch.

Parking:
Parking is free on the University campus after 6pm. The closest place to park is Fylde Avenue or George Fox Avenue.

There are also very frequent buses to the University and an excellent cycle route.

---

R-Ladies Lancaster is part of a global initiative, R-Ladies Global, designed to improve the gender diversity of R users worldwide and in particular, to improve the participation and experience of women in the R community. As part of the initiative, R-Ladies Lancaster will host a number of talks and workshops about the use of R. It doesn't matter if you never used R or if you are an R expert, R-Ladies Lancaster welcomes anyone with an interest in R.

Questions? E-mail: [masked]

name: Data Transformation with Tidyverse
description:
This will a beginner friendly session where we will learn how to access and transform data. Even if you've never used R before, you'll be able to take part and do some coding.

We'll be working through Chapter 5 of the R for Data Science book. This is available freely online at http://r4ds.had.co.nz . There will be a short presentation and then we'll work through some exercises together.

If you're already familiar and comfortable with manipulating data in R, please still come along. It would be great to have some extra helpers, and we can also work through the latest TidyTuesday data set as a challenge.

This will be an interactive session so please bring your laptop. Ideally this should have R and Rstudio installed. If you have trouble downloading these. You can use https://rstudio.cloud/. You will also need to tidyverse R package. You might want to install this before coming along to the session. You can do this by running install.packages("tidyverse") in R.

The session will run from 6pm - 8pm with a short break in the middle. Snacks and soft drinks will be provided. Please bring a reusable cup if possible!

name: Tidy Data
description:
This is a beginner friendly session. We'll be working through Chapter 12 of the R for Data Science book. This is available freely online at http://r4ds.had.co.nz . There will be a short presentation and then we'll work through some exercises together. This will involve learning about the functions: (spread(), gather(), separate(), unite(), inner_join()).

Afterwards, we will try these out on our own data. So please, if you can, bring along some of your own data. You could be working on this data at the moment, or it could be something you have used in the past. If you don't have any data, this would be a good learning opportunity to try and find some open source data from the internet.

This will be an interactive session so please bring your laptop. Ideally this should have R and RStudio installed. If you have trouble downloading these, you can use https://rstudio.cloud/. You will also need the tidyverse R package. You might want to install this before coming along to the session. You can do this by running install.packages("tidyverse") in R.

We are in Lancaster University Library - Room C135 and the session will run from 6pm - 8pm with a short break in the middle. Snacks and soft drinks will be provided.

name: Strings
description:
This is a beginner friendly session. We'll be working through Chapter 14 of the R for Data Science book, which deals with manipulating strings (text). This is available freely online at http://r4ds.had.co.nz . There will be a short presentation and then we'll work through some exercises together.

Afterwards, we will try these out on our own data. So please, if you can, bring along some of your own data. You could be working on this data at the moment, or it could be something you have used in the past. If you don't have any data, this would be a good learning opportunity to try and find some open source data from the internet.

This will be an interactive session so please bring your laptop. Ideally this should have R and RStudio installed. If you have trouble downloading these, you can use https://rstudio.cloud/. You will also need the stringr R package. You might want to install this before coming along to the session. You can do this by running install.packages("stringr") in R.

We will be in Lancaster University Library - Room C130. The session will run from 6pm - 8pm with a short break in the middle. Snacks and soft drinks will be provided.

name: Dates & times with lubridate
description:
This is a beginner friendly session. We'll be working through Chapter 16 of the R for Data Science book, which deals with manipulating dates and times. This is available freely online at http://r4ds.had.co.nz . There will be a short presentation and then we'll work through some exercises together.

Afterwards, we will try these out on our own data. So please, if you can, bring along some of your own data. You could be working on this data at the moment, or it could be something you have used in the past. If you don't have any data, this would be a good learning opportunity to try and find some open source data from the internet.

This will be an interactive session so please bring your laptop. Ideally this should have R and RStudio installed. If you have trouble downloading these, you can use https://rstudio.cloud/. You will also need the lubridate R package. You might want to install this before coming along to the session. You can do this by running install.packages("lubridate") in R.

We will be in Lancaster University Library - Room C135. The session will run from 6pm - 8pm with a short break in the middle. Snacks and soft drinks will be provided.

name: R Markdown and tips from the RStudio Conference
description:
For our first meeting of 2020 we have two talks lined up:

Rebecca Killick (Lancaster University): R Markdown and why I love it (workshop)

R Markdown is a fantastic tool allowing users to write a huge variety of documents with R code embedded. Rebecca will introduce R Markdown and explain why she loves using it. She'll also teach us how to create a simple R Markdown document. If you want to to participate in the interactive element, please bring a laptop with RStudio and R installed. If you have chance also install the knitr package by running the following command.

install.packages("knitr")

---

Rhian Davies (Jumping Rivers) : What I learnt at RStudio Conference

I'm lucky to be attending the RStudio Conference this year. I'll give a talk summarising some of the new and exciting things I learnt at the conference to share with you all!

---
We will be in Lancaster University Library - Room C135. The session will run from 6pm - 8pm with a short break in the middle. Snacks and soft drinks will be provided.

---

R-Ladies Lancaster is part of a global initiative, R-Ladies Global, designed to improve the gender diversity of R users worldwide and in particular, to improve the participation and experience of women in the R community. As part of the initiative, R-Ladies Lancaster will host a number of talks and workshops about the use of R. It doesn't matter if you never used R or if you are an R expert, R-Ladies Lancaster welcomes anyone with an interest in R.

Questions? E-mail: [masked]

name: Introduction to Shiny
description:
Shiny is an R package that makes it easy to build interactive web apps straight from R. In this beginner-friendly session, we'll be working through part one of the RStudio shiny tutorial.

https://shiny.rstudio.com/tutorial/

This will be an interactive session so please bring your laptop. Ideally, this should have R and RStudio installed. If you have trouble downloading these, you can use https://rstudio.cloud/. You will also need the shiny R package. Please, install this before coming along to the session. You can do this by running install.packages("shiny") in R.

We will be in Lancaster University Library - Room C135. The session will run from 6pm - 8pm with a short break in the middle. Snacks and soft drinks will be provided.

name: First R-ladies MeetUp!
description:
Dear Members,

On behalf of R-Ladies Munich, we thank you for joining our group. Now, we are excited to announce our first MeetUp event !

We will be meeting at the library of Munich University Hospital at Sendlinger Tor, below are the details:
Date : 26th April, 2017 (Wednesday)
Time : 18:30 - 21:30
Address : Bibliothek, 3 OG
                  Institut für Arbeits-, Sozial- und Umweltmedizin
                  Klinikum der Universität München               
                  Ziemssenstraße 1, 80336 München (please find the map above)

During the MeetUp, our co-organizer, Dahola Rodríguez-Molina, would like to demonstrate and introduce you to Git, GitHub, and Rmarkdown. Therefore, we highly encourage you to bring your own Laptop, such that you could practice with us!

Whether you are new to R or an expert user, work in academics or industry, this is a laid back event to further connect the R-Ladies community in Munich. During the MeetUp, you will have the opportunity to make new friends, freely discuss and practice R together while enjoying snacks and drinks we provide (but of course, we welcome if you would like to bring something to share). Also, you are always welcomed to bring your friends who are interested in R.

In order to better understand your preferences on our topics and arrangements, please kindly take a few minutes to fill in our questionnaire so that we could improve our MeetUp!

https://rladiesmunich.typeform.com/to/c46YCG

Should you have any enquires, please feel free to contact us at <a>[masked]</a>. We look forward to seeing you all on 26th April !

Best regards,

Maggie Chak

Co-organizer,R-Ladies Munich

name: Second R-ladies MeetUp!
description:
Hello everyone!

How are you all doing? To begin with, on behalf of R-ladies Munich, we thank you for your kind support in our previous MeetUp event held in April. We were very happy to meet you and we hoped you enjoyed the evening. Now, we are excited to announce our second MeetUp event that will be held at a much bigger venue in the CITY CENTER !

We will be meeting at Wayra in Marienplatz, below are the details:

Date : 21st June, 2017 (Wednesday)

Time : 19:15 - 21:30

Address : Kaufingerstraße 15, 80331 München  (please find the map above)

During the MeetUp, our co-organizer, Daloha Rodríguez-Molina, would bring you some good news regarding to R-ladies, and introduce you to our new R-Ladies Munich Slack group — which is an awesome networking platform for us to communicate, discuss, and exchange ideas and knowledge within our group. Then, she would brief you on a super useful (and fun) interactive R-learning package called swirl. What is more, we are glad to have our co-organizer, Pamela Matias, introduce a powerful visualizing tool in R — ggplot2 to you. After all, who doesn’t like presenting data with good-looking and clear graphs?

Therefore, we highly encourage you to bring your own Laptop, such that you could practice with us right away !

Whether you are new to R or an expert user, work in academics or industry, this is a laid back event to further connect the R-Ladies community in Munich. During the MeetUp, you will have the opportunity to make new friends, freely discuss and practice R together while enjoying snacks and drinks we provide (but of course, we welcome if you would like to bring something to share). We always welcome you to bring your friends who are interested in R with you !

Should you have any questions, please feel free to contact us at <a>[masked]</a>. We look forward to seeing you all on 21st June.

Best regards,

Maggie Chak  

Co-organizer, R-Ladies Munich

name: Third R-ladies MeetUp!
description:
Hi there!

For the new members, welcome! We're so happy our RLadies community keeps growing. And for the members who've been here for longer, thanks for taking part in this adventure with us and for your support in past events!

Now, the topics of this MeetUp are still being organised and set up, but for sure we will hear a bit about what went down at the useR! Conference in Brussels - this is mostly a "save the date" post. We'll update you by the beginning of next week on  the final agenda. 

Also, we will be meeting again at the very cool venue provided by Wayra.

Here's what you need to know:

Date: 25th July, 2017 (Wednesday) 

Time: 19:00 - 21:30h 

Whether you are new to R or an expert user, work in academics or industry, this is a laid back event to further connect the R-Ladies community in Munich. During the MeetUp, you will have the opportunity to make new friends, freely discuss and practice R together while enjoying some snacks and drinks we provide (but if you feel like bringing something to share, that's great too). 

Anyone who's interested in R is more than welcome - that means this is not a "women only" event. Feel free to invite your friends and join us on this 3rd MeetUp!

Should you have any questions, please feel free to contact us at munich[at]rladies[dot]org. 

Cheers,

Pamela Matías

Co-organizer, R-Ladies Munich

name: R-Ladies: OktobeRfest + Shiny
description:
Let's meet up and have some fun with Oktoberfest data while learning how to build a web app with the Shiny package!

And you've guessed it right, we count with the support of Wayra for the venue once more. In case you haven't been there, it is a very comfy and cool place to hold workshops and talks. 

So here are the details:

Date: October 4th, 2017 (Wednesday) 

Time: 19:00 - 21:30h 

Whether you are new to R or an expert user, work in academics or industry, this is a laid back event to further connect the R-Ladies community in Munich. During the MeetUp, you will have the opportunity to make new friends, freely discuss and practice R together while enjoying some snacks and drinks we provide (but if you feel like bringing something to share, that's great too). 

Anyone who's interested in R is more than welcome - that means this is not a "women only" event. Feel free to invite your friends and join us on this 4th MeetUp!

Should you have any questions, please feel free to contact us at munich[at]rladies[dot]org.

Welcome on board, new RLadies members,

             and cheers to all!

            
               R-Ladies Munich

name: 5 - SpeakeRs Unite! - Round 1
description:
• What we'll do
As said before, we are kick-starting this year with a series of talks in which fellow R-Ladies members have the chance to share with us what they are doing with R. And this time, we're all about Building R packages.

We are really happy to announce our first round of speakers from the R-Ladies community:

1: Beibei Jiang's "SimPhe".
Beibei is a PhD student at the Max Planck Institute of Psychiatry, Munich. She developed a package called SimPhe (available on CRAN) to simulate phenotypes with epistatic interactions, and presented it at a lightning talk at useR!2017 in Brussels.

2: Sophie Molnos' "pulver".
She studied Bioinformatics in Berlin and I did her PhD at the Helmholtz Center Munich. She is now working in the field of Genetic Epidemiology, analyzing mitochondrial DNA and its association with human traits. She developed a package called "pulver" to handle significant interaction terms from linear regression models based on big data. Having had these experiences, they will share some insights on building R packages.

Save the date, as further speakers for this session might be coming up soon!

• What to bring
Something to take notes with - everything else will be(er) provided. (See what we did there?)

• Important to know
This event is NOT exclusively for women, but in case we run out of places, they would be preferentially assigned. So feel free to join and bring friends along!

name: 6 - RLadies Stammtisch
description:
• What we'll do
Time to relax, get a drink and just get to know each other. What is the use of being part of such a cool organization if we do not really know what everyone is up to? This is the perfect occasion to sit back, take a sip of your favorite beer/soft drink and talk about how shared love for R - kidding, we do love R, but we're excited to have some off-time to actually talk and network. Of course, feel free to bring your friends/work colleagues/R-interested-neighbors (could happen,just saying) - a ton of experience with R is by no means a requirement to join this Stammtisch. Also, if this would be your first time attending an R-Ladies event, that's great! We're looking forward to seeing new faces :)

• What to bring
RSVP necessary!

• Important to know
As we will be meeting in a restaurant, we will do a reservation for 20 people.

Please RSVP as soon as you know if you're joining, first-come-first-served sort of. If you already RSVPed and for some reason won't be able to attend, cancel your participation and let someone else take your spot (we'll be taking names and setting up a waiting list).

name: 7 - Data Journalism with R: Experiences from the Süddeutsche Zeitung
description:
Summer is here and it's time for another R-Ladies Meetup!

This time it will be Katharina Brunner (Twitter handle @cutterkom), a fellow R-Lady, will tell us about some exciting projects her and her team have been working on at the Süddeutsche Zeitung (SZ), one of the largest and most important newspaper in the South of Germany.

Come join us if you are interested in data journalism or are curious about the following questions...
* Does social media influence elections? If so, how? A case study from last year's elections in Germany.
* How has the German Parliament changed ever since the AfD entered the scene? How do they shape the climate and the processes there? An analysis from the Parliament meetings from the past six months.
* Election trend polls: how reliable are they when predicting election outcomes? A method to summarize results from polls and offer some insights into their estimations and its natural uncertainty.

Whether you are new to R or an expert user, work in academics or industry, this is a laid back event to further connect the R-Ladies community in Munich. During the MeetUp, you will have the opportunity to make new friends, freely discuss and practice R together while enjoying some snacks and drinks we provide (but if you feel like bringing something to share, that's great too).

Anyone who's interested in R is more than welcome - that means this is not a "women only" event. Feel free to invite your friends and join us on this MeetUp!

Should you have any questions, please feel free to contact us at munich[at]rladies[dot]org.

PS. Picture taken from one of Katharina's project, "The Facebook Factor" (https://gfx.sueddeutsche.de/apps/e502288/www/).

name: Accueil des nouveaux membres, présentation de R-Ladies et networking
venue_name: Laboratoire de Biomathématiques et d'Estimations Forestières (LABEF)
description:
R-Ladies Cotonou invite ses nouveaux membres à une rencontre conviviale.
L’agenda de cette rencontre se compose de trois grands points essentiels. Nous commencerons par présenter R-Ladies de façon globale puis plus spécifiquement notre groupe. Ensuite, nous aurons une petite session de questions-réponses. Le second point concernera le développement du groupe (planning, formations, système de mentorship, autres contributions et recherche de sponsors), les attentes des membres et l’initiation du networking parmi les membres. Pour finir, nous aborderons la planification des formations ou workshops des prochains mois à venir.
La rencontre se terminera par un petit buffet à partager ensemble, confirmez votre presence s'il vous plait !
Nous serons ravis de vous compter parmi les participants de ce meetup !!!

Prenez RDV !!

description:

* Ing. Ana Laura Diedrichs - Presentación de R-Ladies Mendoza y aplicaciones R en general. Twitter @anadiedrichs

name: R-Ladies en FLISOL - workshop - charlas
venue_name: Universidad Tecnológica Nacional, Facultad Regional Mendoza
description:
Vamos a realizar un workshop de R-Ladies Mendoza en el marco del FLISOL (Festival Latinoamericano de instalación de software libre), que se realizará en la UTN Mendoza.

Las charlas tratas de diferentes casos de uso y aplicaciones de R y Rstudio.

Cronograma general (podrían surgir pequeñas modificaciones):

10:00 - 10:30 hs - Bienvenida FLISOL en Salón de actos, registración

10:30 - 10:45 hs - Presentación de iniciativa R-Ladies
Disertantes: Jan Strappa (Ing. en Sistemas de Información, becarie Doctoral CONICET, twitter @superXponential), Brenda Canizo (Lic. en Bromatología, twitter: twitter.com/Brenda_Canizo)

10:45 - 11:30 - Presentaciones con Rmarkdown.
Disertante: Amalia Susana Haye, twitter: @amaliamdz
Breve bio: Profesora en Matemáticas, área de interés: Estadística
Contenido de la exposición: Rmarkdown es una herramienta para escribir documentos juntamente con código R. Permite la ejecución de código con la posibilidad de realizar presentaciones y documentación de calidad.

11:30 - 12:05 - Estimación de la evapotranspiración real de vid mediante Modelos de Balance de Energía. El paquete “water” (CRAN).
Disertante: María Victoria Munafó
Breve bio: Ingeniera agrónoma, investigadora, geomática y agricultura de precisión, "water" package's contributor.
Contenido de la exposición:
En regiones semiáridas, las precipitaciones no son suficientes para cubrir los requerimientos hídricos de los cultivos. Saber cuánto hay que regar es la clave del riego. Se conoce como evapotranspiración (ET) a la combinación de procesos separados por los que el agua se pierde a través de la superficie del suelo (evaporación) y por la transpiración del cultivo.
Se presenta el paquete "water" disponible en el repositorio CRAN desde el año 2016. Provee muchas funciones para estimar los parámetros de la ecuaciones de ET desde imágenes satelitales. Propone una nueva clase de objeto para manipular los datos de estaciones meteorológicas (waterWeatherStation) y resuelve mediante un método automático, uno de los puntos críticos del modelo METRIC (Mapping EvapoTranspiration at high Resolution with Internalized Calibration).

12:05 - 12:25 - Optimización de la selección de sitios de muestreo en la vitivinicultura mediante análisis multiescalar de imágenes satelitales de NDVI.
Disertante: Julieta Dalmasso
Breve bio: Ingeniera agrónoma con interés en recursos hídricos y geomática.
Contenido de la exposición: Se presenta un caso de estudio de analizar imágenes satelitales de una finca de vid en espaldero (Vitis vinifera cv. Cabernet sauvignon), ubicado en la localidad de Ugarteche, Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza. Se aplicó un análisis multiescalar, mediante la utilización de imágenes satelitales Lansat 8 y Sentinel 2 de alta resolución espacial. El trabajo permitió aplicar una metodología para identificar áreas homogéneas según el índice de vegetación (NVDI) presentes en el predio. La incorporación de esta metodología para la selección de sitios de muestreo análogos en predios de grandes superficies, hacen de esta herramienta informática un producto viable, accesible, de bajo costo y reproducible en cualquier ámbito.

12:25 - 13:00 - R en genética - Clusterización de haplotipos
Disertante: Tatiana Sofía Parlanti
Breve bio: Estudiante avanzada de la carrera Licenciatura en Ciencias Básicas con orientación en Matemática, de la FCEN-UNCUYO.
Contenido de la exposición:
En los últimos años se ha incrementado el uso del mapeo asociativo, herramienta estadística que permite identificar regiones específicas del genoma relacionadas con la variación de un carácter fenotípico de interés, como estrategia para identificar QTL. El objetivo de este proyecto fue mejorar técnicas computacionales aplicadas a las matrices asociadas a distintas poblaciones de mapeo vinculadas con los programas de mejoramiento de arroz y soja. Se usó el paquete clusterhap para el análisis.

Sponsors

Rconsortium
FLISOL - SAE - UTN Mendoza

name: R-Ladies en FLISOL - taller
venue_name: Universidad Tecnológica Nacional, Facultad Regional Mendoza
description:
Vamos a realizar un workshop de R-Ladies Mendoza en el marco del FLISOL (Festival Latinoamericano de instalación de software libre), que se realizará en la UTN Mendoza.

Trae tu notebook, tu cargador y una zapatilla para que puedas trabajar de forma cómoda.

El taller tiene cupo para asegurar una buena atención a todo asistente y que podamos interactuar de forma ordenada. Si no vas a asistir, libera tu lugar para que otra persona pueda anotarse. Aclaramos que el taller no es un curso de R ni tampoco entregamos certificación. Es un taller informal o meetup para compartir experiencias en R y se impartirán actividades o ejercicios.

Recomendamos que ya tengas instalado R + RStudio para sacarle más provecho al taller. No es problema si lo instalas durante el taller, estamos para asesorarte y acompañarte en el proceso, pero pueden que surjan demoras y no puedas realizar todas las actividades. De ser así, no hay problemas, publicamos todo nuestro material en el repositorio de R-Ladies Mendoza.

Si ya tenías instalado R + Rstudio, o lograste instalarlo para el taller y ya tienes una base de R, entonces recomendamos que instales los siguientes paquetes: ggplot2, knitr, tidyverse.

¿Ya tenés experiencia en R y querés ayudarnos en el taller? Podés ayudarnos asistiendo a principiantes, compartiendo tus scripts, etc. Escribinos a [masked] y animate a acompañarnos y ayudarnos en la iniciativa de compartir R con quienes dan sus primeros pasos.

El taller será dictado por Ing. Ana Laura Diedrichs - Twitter @anadiedrichs

Asistentes / helpers
* Ing. Jan Strappa - Twitter @superXponential
* Lic. Brenda Canizo - Twitter: @Brenda_Canizo

Sponsors

Rconsortium
FLISOL - SAE - UTN Mendoza

name: La desigualdad de género se puede medir ¡con R!
venue_name: Universidad Tecnológica Nacional, Facultad Regional Mendoza
description:
Charla: "La desigualdad de género se puede medir ¡con R!"

Exponen:

La Lic. Natsumi Shokida es integrante de la organización EcoFeminita y R-Ladies Buenos Aires. Trabaja en el INDEC en la Encuesta Permanente de Hogares. Pueden acceder a los análisis de brecha de género realizado por la licenciada desde este enlace: http://rpubs.com/natsumi_shokida/

La Ing. Ana Laura Diedrichs, fundadora y co-organizadora de R-Ladies Mendoza, Ing. en Sistemas de Información, quien introducirá sobre los objetivos de la comunidad R-Ladies Mendoza.

Objetivos:

* Presentar iniciativas de R-Ladies en Mendoza
* Introducir a indicadores analizados en la Encuesta Permanente de Hogares del INDEC.
* Analizando la brecha de género con indicadores económicos
* Motivar el uso de software libre para aplicaciones de ciencia de datos.

¿Quieres ayudarnos en próximos meetups? :-)

La comunidad R-Ladies Mendoza realiza es organizada de forma voluntaria, sin ánimo de lucro. Valoramos quienes puedan aportar su tiempo ofreciendo charlas, ayudarnos en talleres o brindando un taller. Escribinos un mail a [masked] y animate a acompañarnos.

Código de Conducta

Todos nuestros eventos adhrieren al código de conducta de R-Ladies ( https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct#spanish ) y Rconsortium ( https://wiki.r-consortium.org/view/R_Consortium_and_the_R_Community_Code_of_Conduct ). Estos CdC son compatibles con el “Protocolo de acción institucional para la prevención e intervención ante situaciones de violencia o discriminación de género u orientación sexual” (res. 1638/2018 CS) de la UTN y se procederá conforme al mismo.

Sponsors

* Rconsortium
* Dpto Ing. en Sistemas de Información - UTN Mendoza

name: Taller de Rmarkdown - comunicación en ciencia de datos
description:
Vamos a realizar desde el espacio R-Ladies Mendoza un taller sobre Rmarkdown (https://rmarkdown.rstudio.com/). Rmarkdown nos permite vincular nuestro código, sean scripts en R u otro lenguaje, con su salida o resultado, gráficos, texto, con todo junto puedas crear un reporte donde expliques el análisis de tus datos y resultados de tus modelos. Estos reportes pueden ser exportados en diversos formatos como pdf, .doc, html entre otros.

La idea de este taller es brindarte tips y herramientas mediante una actividad 100% práctica para que puedas crear tus propios reportes y publicarlos, por ejemplo en rpubs, con un formato lindo de presentación.

Se llevará a cabo en la Facultad de Ingeniería, edificio de gobierno, laboratorio de informática "A", UNCuyo. El laboratorio de informática cuenta ya con computadoras con el software instalado para que puedas aprovechar el taller al máximo.

Si prefieres usar tu notebook, por favor trae tu cargador. Recomendamos que ya tengas instalado R + RStudio y los paquetes tidyverse, knitr y rmarkdown para sacarle más provecho al taller.

El taller cuenta con una capacidad máxima de personas dado el tamaño de la sala y los recursos disponibles. Agradecemos que confirmen si vienen mediante este evento. Si desistes de ir, por favor libera tu lugar para que otra persona pueda participar. Gracias.

El taller será dictado por:

* Lic Amalia Haye
* Ing. Ana Laura Diedrichs - Twitter @anadiedrichs
* Ing. Jan Strappa - Twitter @superXponential
* Lic. Brenda Canizo - Twitter: @Brenda_Canizo

Temario

* Presentación de R-Ladies Mendoza y novedades de la comunidad.
* Introducción a Rmarkdown como herramienta de ciencia de datos reproducible.
* Publicando mis reportes.
* Presentaciones en Rmarkdown.
* Ejemplos de
1) formatos de documentos
2) un "ciclo básico " de análisis de datos o documento plantilla.
* Añadiendo fórmulas y otros tricks de latex.
* Rmarkdown parametrizable.
* Creando dashboards con Rmarkdown: introducción
* Otros formatos de Rmarkdown (publicaciones de papers)

Sponsors, hacen posible este evento:

* RConsortium
* UNCUYO

name: R-Ladies Ames Launch Party
description: During this Meetup we will meet each other, enjoy some refreshments, and talk about the future of R-Ladies Ames. If you have a project you're working on in R, come ready with your elevator pitch! If you have something you want to learn in R, come ready with ideas and questions! If you feel like you have no idea, come with an open mind! We will pick a topic for our first R-Ladies workshop/lecture/etc of 2017 at this party.

name: Webscraping using 'tidyverse' packages.
description: We will be discussing webscraping using 'tidyverse' packages. The first hour will be lecture style and the second hour will be interactive practice and questions. Feel free to bring your own laptop or use the computers provided. We look forward to seeing you there!

name: LunchinatoRs
description:
Hosted by the Department of Ecology, Evolution, and Organismal Biology. 

This is a weekly meeting hosted by R-Lady Audrey McCombs and Haldre Rogers in EEOB for folks interested in learning R and eating lunch together. Thanks to Audrey for extending this invitation to all of R-Ladies Ames! 

Email Audrey at [masked] for more information. If you're looking to present some cool R packages, how to wrestle with analysis issues, good coding practices, data management techniques, or anything else that you find interesting and helpful when working in R, let Audrey know! They'd love to host your presentation!

name: International Women's Day Potluck
description:
For International Women's Day, we will be hosting a potluck to get to know each other better! Bring your favorite dish to share! If you're not sure what to bring, follow our suggestions based on your last name: 

If your last name starts with:

A – F bring a main course (cooked chicken, casserole, etc.)

G – K bring a side dish (salad, rolls, etc.)

L – Q bring dessert (cookies, brownies, etc.)

R – Z  bring drinks (soda pop, bottled water, etc.)

The organizers will provided plates, utensils, napkins, and cups, but please bring your own serving utensils!

name: Let's get Git-ting!
description:
Does this image accurately portray your workflow?

If so, this workshop is for you! 

In this workshop we will learn how to use git, a collaborative version control software, and avoid the above situation. 

Version control is a system that records changes to a file or set of files over time so that you can recall specific versions later. We will start from the very basics of version control (collaborating with your past self) and work up to the skills necessary to contribute to an existing open source project (collaborating with other people). Effective collaboration and version control are essential for researchers to easily recover from the nasty snafus that we (or our collaborators) can get ourselves into through better file management. So, what are you waiting for? Let's get git-ting!

Pre-workshop Homework:

If you plan on attending this workshop, please do the following two things ahead of time: 

• Sign up for GitHub (http://github.com)

• Install SourceTree client for Git (https://www.sourcetreeapp.com/)

name: R-Ladies Ames Welcome (Back) Potluck!
description:
Welcome back R-Ladies Ames! 

We hope you are having a good start to your semester! We will be having a potluck as our first event this year to catch up and to meet new R-Ladies in the Ames area! We will provide the meat and everyone will bring a dish to pass or beverages according to how long they've been using R:

• 1 year or less? Bring crunchy snacks like trail mix or pretzels

• 1-2 years? Bring desserts like cookies or brownies

• 3-4 years? Bring salad of any variety: pasta, fruit, jello (we're in the Midwest, after all), actual salad, etc. 

• 5+ years? Bring beverages like soda/pop, water, juice, etc. 

Please RSVP at this link no later than September 25th: http://bit.ly/RLadiesAmesFall17 

See you then! 

Sam, Jacqueline, Tesia, and Jing

description:
Hosted by the Department of Ecology, Evolution, and Organismal Biology. 

This is a weekly meeting hosted by R-Lady Audrey McCombs and Haldre Rogers in EEOB for folks interested in learning R and eating lunch together. Thanks to Audrey for extending this invitation to all of R-Ladies Ames! They meet from 12-1pm every Friday in Bessey Hall, room 334. 

Email Audrey at [masked] for more information. If you're looking to present some cool R packages, how to wrestle with analysis issues, good coding practices, data management techniques, or anything else that you find interesting and helpful when working in R, let Audrey know! They'd love to host your presentation!

name: The Life-Changing Magic of Tidying Data
description:
At this meetup, Sam Tyner will guide the audience on a journey of tidying messy data using the tidyverse suite of R packages. This will be a bring your own data (BYOD) event! In the last half-hour, we will be applying the principles and functions from the first hour to our own data, so try to come with some data you're currently striving to tidy. Light refreshments will be provided. 

Thanks to Marie Kondo, the author of "The Life-Changing Magic of Tidying Up" for the inspiration for the title of this workshop.

name: R-Ladies Ames Social: New YeaR's Resolutions
description:
• What we'll do
In our first event of 2018, we will socialize at Torrent Brewing company, drink some beer, cider, and root beer, and talk about setting some resolutions for getting to know more about R! Have you always wanted to learn how to make better plots? Maybe you want to learn how to webscrape? Perhaps generalized linear modeling tickles your fancy? We all have that one (or two, or ten...) thing we want to learn how to do in R, so we'll help each other set some SMART R-centered goals to achieve in 2018!

• What to bring
A computer and something to write with. (Torrent has WiFi.) You can also bring food, since Torrent doesn't serve food.

name: A Galentine's Day Special Event: Plotting your data with ggplot2
description:
• What we'll do
Dr. Heike Hofmann* will lead a workshop on how to plot your data using the ggplot2 package (part of the tidyverse, and authored by ISU Stat PhD Alum Hadley Wickham). Light galentine's day themed refreshments will be provided. * - Dr. Hofmann was Hadley's PhD advisor, so she's pretty much the Leslie Knope to Hadley's April Ludgate

• What to bring
Your computer (the lab also has computers)

• Important to know
This Galentine's Day, make Leslie Knope proud by celebrating this should-be holiday with your fellow R-Ladies!

name: Stats, Machine Learning & the Data Science Career - Gabriela de Queiroz
description:
• What we'll do
Gabriela de Queiroz is visiting Ames! Gabriela is the founder of R-Ladies Global and a data scientist by profession. She'll talk about her journey from majoring in statistics to a career in Data Science. Specifically, she'll talk about her past positions and how statistics played a crucial role in them.

• Important to know
Read more about Gabriela on her website, http://k-roz.com/!

name: Community & Leadership in R
description:
• What we'll do
Gabriela de Queiroz is visiting Ames! Gabriela is the founder of R-Ladies Global and a data scientist by profession. She will share her experience being an R user and becoming part of the R open source community, as well has how how her desire to share her experiences with others and to develop a more inclusive community led to the creation of R-Ladies. This talk is an International Women's Day event. The theme this year is #PressforProgress, and the R-Ladies organization is committed to increasing the participation of women in the R user community to parity. • Important to know
To learn more about Gabriela, visit her website! http://k-roz.com/ To learn more about International Women's Day, visit https://www.internationalwomensday.com.

name: September Social
description: Welcome back! After a summer break, R-Ladies Ames is back with our first social event of the year! Bring your R-loving friends and your ideas for fun R things you want to learn this year. All are welcome! Please read our code of conduct (https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct) before attending. This will be a casual social with baked goods provided. If you want to bring food along, that is more than welcome at Alluvial. They also usually have the Mac-u-bana or other food trucks outside.

name: Tidy Tuesdays with R-Ladies Ames
description: Come join R-Ladies Ames and flex your R skills working on the weekly Tidy Tuesday dataset. This is a weekly event hosted by R for Data Science that emphasizes learning how to clean, tidy, and visualize data "from the wild". Bring your lunch and hack away with us! https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday

name: Primer Meetup de RLadies Montevideo!
description:
Hola a tod@s!

Estamos muy contentas de anunciar nuestro primer evento en Montevideo! 

Nuestras speakers:

Carolina Crisci es bióloga de formación. Fue Ayudante por algunos años en el Laboratorio de Probabilidad y Estadística del Instituto de Matemática en la Facultad de Ingeniería donde comenzó a trabajar en la aplicación de modelización estadística a problemas biológicos. Siempre con la perspectiva de combinar la Biología y la Estadística, se formó como Doctora en Oceanografía en la Université de la Méditerranée (Francia) y al volver a Uruguay realizó un postdoc en el área de Ecología Acuática. Actualmente es Profesora Adjunta en el Centro Universitario Regional del Este (Rocha), donde forma parte del grupo Modelización y Análisis de Recursos Naturales.

María Eugenia Riaño es docente del Departamento de Métodos Cuantitativos de la Facultad de Ciencias Económicas. Trabaja en el área de Muestreo, y ha participado de varios proyectos vinculados al área. También trabajó en el Instituto Nacional de Estadística, encargándose del muestra de la Encuesta Continua de Hogares. Sus intereses son muestreo y estadística espacial.

Natalia Berberian y Alejandra Borges. Natalia es Licenciada en Estadística y Magíster en Ciencias Agrarias, Opción Bioestadística. Trabaja en el Departamento de Biometría, Estadística y Computación de la Facultad de Agronomía desde 2010. Se involucró en el uso de modelos espaciales en el contexto de diseño de experimentos en su tesis de Maestría. Alejandra es Ingeniera Agrónoma y Magíster en Ciencias Agrarias, Opción Ciencias Vegetales. Actualmente está realizando un Doctorado en Ciencias Agrarias. Trabaja en el Departamento de Biometría, Estadística y Computación de la Facultad de Agronomía desde 2006. Se involucró en el uso de modelos espaciales en el contexto de diseño de experimentos en su tesis de Doctorado y en diversos proyectos de investigación. Actualmente dictan un curso de posgrado en la Maestría en Ciencias Agrarias de Introducción a la Geoestadística que se ofrece cada dos años en Facultad de Agronomía.

Agenda:

19:00 - 19:20 networking 

19:20 – 19:40 Natalia y Daniela (organizadoras) presentan “Qué es R-Ladies y por qué existe?”

19:45 – 20:00 Carolina presenta “Modelando en Ecología: aplicaciones usando R”

20:05 – 20:20 María Eugenia presenta "Análisis de Muestras complejas en R"

20:25 – 20:40 Natalia y Alejandra presentan “Modelos espaciales en el contexto de diseño de experimentos”

20:40 en Adelante, networking

Agradecemos a Sophilabs que proactivamente ofreció recibirnos y brindarnos su apoyo.

Sophilabs (<a>https://sophilabs.co)</a>; es una agencia de desarrollo y diseño de software con más de 5 años de experiencia ayudando a startups y corporaciones a construir soluciones innovadoras para usuarios exigentes. Desarrolla software de alta calidad utilizando tecnologías tales como python & django, elixir & phoenix, react,y angular, apoyándose en principios Lean y prácticas ágiles

name: Visualización de datos con ggplot2
description:
Hola a tod@s!

Estamos muy contentas de anunciar nuestro segundo evento en Montevideo!

 Natalia da Silva una de nuestras organizadoras presentará "Visualización de datos con ggplot2"

Traé tu computadora porque parte de aprender junt@s es trabaj@ar junt@as!!

name: Último encuentro del 2017!!
description:
Hola a tod@as, estamos contentas de anunciar nuestro último encuentro del año y agradecerles por ser parte de esta iniciativa!

Esta vez nos juntamos en Pyxis, Br España 2323 a las 19:00 hs.

Para este encuentro tenemos dos invitadas que nos van a contar cosas muy interesantes!!

Maine Fariello: "Visualización de datos genómicos"

Daniela Vázquez: "Cómo me metí en la tecnología por la ventana y en la NASA por la banderola"

Si te interesa anotarte a NASAdatanauts (https://open.nasa.gov/blog/nasa-datanauts-apply-spring-2018-class/) hasta el 22 de Diciembre estás a tiempo y Dani te va a contar sobre su experiencia.

La idea en este último encuentro es hacer una despedida lluvia, así que si podés traé algo para compartir (bebida o comida).

Nos vemos pronto!

name: Primer encuentro del 2018!
description: Hola a tod@as, estamos contentas de anunciar nuestro primer encuentro del año! Te esperamos el jueves 12 de Abril a las 19 hs en @sophilabs (Prudencia de Pena 2517) . Florencia Díaz Vazquez (@fdiazviraque) y Fiorella Cavalleri presentarán, Análisis y visualización de secuencias biológicas y Modelos mixtos en R. No faltes y acordare de RSVP:http://rladies.uy/meetup

name: ¡Segundo meetup: taller de R markdown!
description:
¡Contentas de anunciar nuestro segundo meetup el 7 de junio a las 19 horas en @ingsoftworks! Taller de #rmarkdown: informes dinámicos y reproducibles en R por Paula Pereda (@paubgood).
RSVP: rladies.uy/meetup #rladies #rladieslatam

name: Violencia de género: Diseño de estándares y análisis de datos
description:
Estamos muy felices de invitarte al primer cumpleaños de R-Ladies Montevideo!

Nuestras invitadas

Silvana Fumega nos contará sobre el trabajo que está llevando adelante ILDA (Iniciativa Latinoamericana por los Datos Abiertos, idatosabiertos.org) sobre Estandarización de Datos de Femicidios en Latinoamérica.

Gabriela Mathieu nos mostrará la aplicación que desarrolló usando Shiny: Cartografía digital de feminicidios en Uruguay.

Elina Gomez nos va a estar contando sobre el análisis cualitativo que hizo usando R sobre el acoso sexual callejero.

TENEMOS NOVEDADES! Vamos a estar inaugurando un espacio para el cuidado de niñes! Si querés traer a tu peque no te olvides de incluir su(s) edad(es) cuando confirmes asistencia, así podemos calcular la cantidad de personas que necesitamos.

También cuando confirmes incluí si tenés alguna restricción alimenticia!

Agradecemos a Pyxis que nos recibe una vez más, nos invita con algunas delicias y nos proporciona un lugar para que podamos traer a los R-babies y R-kids para no perdernos el encuentro :)

name: Taller de tidyverse: manipulación y transformación de datos en R. Nivel inicial.
description:
¡Contentas de anunciar el segundo taller del año!

El 23 de octubre a las 19 horas Scanntech (scanntech.com) nos abre las puertas para que tengamos nuestra próxima reunión.

En este taller vamos a ver con Lucía Coudet las herramientas del tidyverse para manipular y transformar datos principalmente usando el paquete dplyr. A su vez, vamos a introducir algunas herramientas del paquete tidyr para reestructurar los datos a un formato limpio. El ejemplo de aplicación será utilizando datos del estudio longitudinal de bienestar del Institituto de Economía (IECON).

Lucía Coudet es estudiante de la Licenciatura en Estadística y Licenciatura en Economía cursando su último semestre. Tiene experiencia como analista de datos y actualmente lo hace aplicado a problemas de seguros.

¡Te esperamos!

name: Evento de fin de año junto con  GURU::mvd
description:
Tendremos varias charlas relámpago (lightning talks) para enterarnos más sobre lo que se puede hacer en R y la comunidad.

Programa:
- Joselina Davyt: Uso de APIs con R
- Gabriel Illa: Visualización de bases de datos
- Alexandra Cravino: Mamíferos y forestación
- Matías Muñoz: R con datos de salud
- Amelia Fabre: R en una institución pública
- Pablo Alfaro: Geoestadística para datos Meteorológicos usando R
- Pablo Soto (Tryolabs): Optimizando procesos con ML

Después despedimos el año todo juntos, ¡te esperamos!

Agradecemos a Tryolabs que nos recibe una vez más.

name: Watch party: RStudio::conf 2020
description:
Si no podés ir a la rstudio::conf(2020), ¡te la traemos a Montevideo!

Con el apoyo de RStudio, nos juntamos a ver el streaming de conferencia junto al Grupo de Usuarios de R.

La watch party comenzará con un evento previo a la conferencia a las 13:00. Este pre-evento contará con entrevistas cortas con personas de RStudio, así como de la comunidad R en general. Durante este evento, los asistentes a las watch parties tendrán la oportunidad de interactuar con los oradores y los invitados en tiempo real.

Agenda:

13:00 Pre-evento con contenido exclusivo para las watch parties

14:00 J.J. Allaire keynote: "Open Source Software For Data Science"

15:00 Fernanda Viegas, Martin Wattenberg keynote: "Data, visualization, and designing with AI"

16:00 Coffee Break

16:30 Katie Masiello: "Case Studies in Customer Success"

16:53 Sean Murphy: "How Vibrant Emotional Health Connected Siloed Data Sources and Streamlined Reporting Using R"

17:16 George Kastrinakis: "Building a new data science pipeline for the FT with RStudio Connect"

17:39 Colin Gillespie: "How to win an AI Hackathon, without using AI"

Por más detalles pueden mirar acá: https://emilhvitfeldt.github.io/rstudioconf-agenda/

¡Le agradecemos a la Facultad de Ingeniería de la Universidad de la República por el espacio, y a RStudio por la oportunidad, la comida, los stickers y las sorpresas!

name: Primera Reunión de R-Ladies Córdoba
description:
Invitamos a la primera reunión de R-Ladies Córdoba

"Taller introductorio a R", para quienes quieran empezar a aprender R o formalizar un poco más los conocimientos sobre este lenguaje.

Las que puedan, traigan sus compus. Si nunca usaste R no hay problema, podemos instalar el software en la reunión.

Este encuentro será en la Incubadora de Empresas de la UNC, Haya de la Torre casi esquina Vélez Sarsfield - Ciudad Universitaria

Por favor, contestá el RSVP! Nos vemos !

name: Taller de visualización de datos
description:
Te invitamos al segundo encuentro de R-Ladies Córdoba , el martes 28 de agosto a las 14 hs.

El tema principal será el uso de ggplot2 para visualizacion de datos. La principal fuente del Taller será el libro R for Data Science (http://r4ds.had.co.nz/) (Grolemund & Wickham, 2017).

Es necesario traer laptop con R y RStudio instalado, y los siguientes paquetes instalados: ggplot2, GGally, ggsci, ggfortify
install.packages("tidyverse")
install.packages(" GGally ")
install.packages(" ggsci ")
install.packages(" ggfortify")

Es muy importante que des RSVP únicamente si podés asistir porque los lugares son limitados. Si confirmás asistencia pero luego no podés asistir, te pedimos por favor que dejes tu lugar disponible para otra persona. Tenés tiempo de confirmar tu asistencia hasta dos horas antes del comienzo del meetup.

Este encuentro será en la Sala de Reuniones del CICTERRA, Av. Velez Sarsfield 1611 - Ciudad Universitaria

¡Te esperamos!

name: El Faro - Un programa de Ciencia
description:
Desde las 20.00 horas, estaremos en El Faro - un programa de Ciencia contando de que va R-Ladies y como pueden hacer todos los que quieran para poder participar, unirse al grupo y organizar actividades.
Para los que no sepa que es R, también contaremos un poquitito porqué este tipo de herramientas son tan importantes en esta época de muchos datos disponibles.

Los esperamos por Radio Noticias FM 99.5.

name: Presentación de R-Ladies y Aplicaciones de R en Santa Rosa
description:
El ITES nos invitó a dar una charla para los estudiantes de la Tecnicatura Superior en Desarrollo de Software y al público en general este jueves 22 de junio a partir de las 21:30 hs.

Las disertantes son la Magister en Explotación de Datos y Gestión de Conocimiento, Investigadora del INTA, Yanina Bellini Saibene y la Estudiante de Doctorado en Ciencias Agrarias de la UBA Marina Cook ambas organizadoras de RLadies Santa Rosa. En primer lugar se expondrá sobre Agro Minería de Datos: en un mundo que necesita cada vez mas alimentos, producir más y mejor, cuidando la salud y el medio ambiente, es uno de los desafíos del sector agropecuario. La minería de datos es una de las herramientas que puede ayudar en este objetivo al permitir analizar y modelar los sistemas productivos. Se informará sobre el uso de Data Mining en INTA y como R les ayuda en esa tarea.

En la segunda parte se referirán a Modelos Mixtos: los avances en informática permitieron desarrollar modelos más complejos y realistas para el análisis de datos. Nos mostrarán qué modelos usan y por qué; por qué usar R y que ventajas ofrece.

Finalmente se hablará sobre RLadies: presentaremos el capitulo Santa Rosa de esta organización mundial que busca disminuir la brecha de género en las personas que usan R.

Los espermos!!!

name: Setup R Day
description:
• Lo que haremos
Estaremos esperandote en oficinas de la agencia del INTA en Santa Rosa, con tu computadora para ayudarte a instalar las herramientas necesarias para dejar R funcionando y listo para usar. Estas herramientas las usaremos en los futuros encuentros de R-Ladies.

Si no podés venir, avisanos a [masked] que te podemos enviar las instrucciones por mail y ayudarte si te encontrás con algún inconveniente.

• Lo que hay que traer
La computadora a la que quieran instalarle las herramientas de R.

• Información importante

name: Charlando sobre brecha de género en STEM: AgroInformática y R-Ladies
description:
La AgroInformática es una disciplina que aporta soluciones informáticas para el sector agropecuario y agroindustrial. El mundo técnico, científico y académico no escapa a la realidad que hay menos mujeres que hombres en las actividades de STEM (Ciencia, Tecnología, Ingeniería y Matemáticas, según su siglas en inglés), y la agroinformática no es la excepción. A su vez, existen más de 5.000 puestos de trabajo en TICs que no se cubren cada año en Argentina. En esta charla repasaremos esta problemática y las iniciativas que se llevan adelante para revertir esta situación.
También podrás concoer más sobre la iniciativa de R-Ladies y cómo participar.
Se realizará en la EEA Anguil del INTA: Ruta Nacional Nº 5 km 580.

name: La comunidad del lenguaje R en Santa Rosa
description:
El último meetup del año lo realizaremos en la 10º PampaSeg, vamos a presentar R-Ladies y que podemos hacer con R.

Tenemeos planificado estar durante todo el 23 para ayudarte a configurar tu computadora con R, RStudio y los paquetes que necesites para usar R en tu trabajo/studio.

También tendremos un tutorial de RMarkdown para que puedas hacer reportes con R.

En la web de PampaSeg te podés registrar y ver el resto de las charlas.
Como siempre es libre y gratuito!!!

Te esperamos!

Sobre PampaSeg: PampaSeg es una jornada que se encuentra en su 10° edición, donde profesionales en el tema podrán brindar sus conocimientos y experiencia, a todos los jóvenes y adultos interesados; ya sea porque estudian o trabajan en áreas relacionadas con las tecnologías de la información y las comunicaciones, o simplemente desean ingresar a este mundo que sigue sumando adeptos, para enriquecer sus conocimientos y aplicarlos en la actividad diaria.

name: R desde Cero (primera parte)
description:
Durante cuatro encuentros repasaremos R desde Cero, con el siguiente programa temático:

1.Introducción a R y RStudio
¿Qué tiene de diferente RStudio con Excel?
¿Cómo orientarse en RStudio?
¿Cómo interactuar con R?
¿Cómo administrar tu entorno?
¿Cómo instalar paquetes?

2.Gestión de proyectos con RStudio
¿Cómo pudo gestionar mis proyectos en R?

3. Buscando ayuda
¿Cómo puedo obtener ayuda en R?

4. Estructura de datos
¿Cómo puedo leer datos en R?
¿Cómo son los datos ordenados?
¿Cómo son los datos limpios?

5. Creando gráficos
¿Cómo puedo crear gráficos con calidad para publicación en R?
¿Cómo puedo guardar gráficos y datos creados en R?

6. Manipulación de datos
¿Cómo puedo hacer diferentes cálculos sobre diferentes conjuntos de datos?
¿Cómo puedo trabajar con subconjuntos de datos en R?

7. Produciendo informes
¿Cómo puedo generar reportes?
¿Cómo puedo integrar programas e informes?

A quien le interese por favor, haga RSVP y complete este formulario: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScvcZn5D8gU-8anhtGOAIJKdT2GsrNoj7Zv6FjReQZ-dHwiXA/viewform?usp=sf_link

Les estaremos avisando por los lugares.
