name: Come join our kick-off R-Ladies #LdnOnt event, featuring an R-Markdown tutorial!
venue_address_1: University of Western Ontario Faculty of Health Science, 1151 Richmond St, London, ON N6A 5B9
description:
R-Ladies #LdnOnt Kick-Off Event!

Come join us at our first R-Ladies #LdnOnt event! This event will feature a tutorial on RMarkdown</a>, led by Cortney Hanna (PhD candidate in HRS). All experience levels welcome to attend!

Our kick-off event will be held on March 4, which coincides with <a href="http://opendataday.org/#what">Open Data Day - an annual celebration of open data all over the world. Drinks downtown at Milos' will follow the event for those interested.

When: Saturday, March 4 @ 4 - 6pm

Where: Health Sciences Building (room 11), Western University

What: Kick-off event of R-Ladies, London, Ontario Chapter

Tentative schedule:

4:00-4:15: Welcome & intro to the group

4:15-5:00: Tutorial on RMarkdown, a phenomenally useful tool in R that allows you to generate sharable reports from your data

5:00-5:15: Scrum session! Group members introduce themselves and state any learning goals/projects they have related to R. 

5:15-6:00: Informal co-working time for attendees to tinker with their new skills, ask questions, and network.

6:00 +: Drinks downtown @ Milos' for all those who are interested!

What to bring:

Laptop with R & R Studio installed

Get excited! Looking forward to seeing you all there!

name: Data Visualization and Graphics!
venue_address_1: Perth Drive, just north of University Drive
description:
We are super stoked to have Sinthiya Thavam, who will be presenting on data visualization and creating graphics in R! Come with your laptop (with R andR Studio installed). Drinks at the Grad Club to follow!

Tentative schedule:

4:00-4:15 Welcome intro and sign-up for DataCamp

4:15-5:00 Sinthiya's tutorial on ggplot and ggplot2, a plotting system for R based on the grammar of graphics. It is built for making professional looking plots quickly with minimal code.

5:00-5:15 Monthly check-in, members can introduce themselves and discuss any current R learning goals and projects.

5:15-5:45 DataCamp - Data visualization, practice together

5:45-6:00+ Wrap up and head to Grad club for drinks!

Getting there: North Campus Building is tucked away on Perth Drive, just north of University Drive near the bridge on UWO campus. If you're coming from Richmond Street to the University, you take a right on Perth just after crossing the bridge on University Drive. North Campus Building is not too far up. There is a pay parking lot just a bit further up (entrance on the left side of Perth). Free parking is also available after 4:00 at Elborn College, which is a bit of a hike (20 minute walk?), but any of the University buses will also get you pretty close (get off at Middlesex/Perth Drive and walk about 4 minutes.

name: Intro to R & Github
description:
Hello again!

We are incredibly excited to now be able to host our meet ups at UnLondon's community building downtown, which provides us a more accessible space beyond the walls of the university, as well as access to their awesome community. Our next meet up will be there on May 1st from 3:30 to 5:30 pm. 

We have two topics to present to you this time, led by two awesomewomen:

1) Intro to R: Rachael Smyth will be walking us through some basic introductory material in R and best practices of writing your R scripts.

2) Intro to version control with GitHub: Pauline Barmby will then demonstrate the ins and outs of version control using GitHub, which can be an incredibly useful way of keeping track of changes you make to your scripts (or other documents).

We'll head out for beers somewhere nearby after we've wrapped up (potentially Milo's? TBD!).

Please RSVP if you plan on attending so we have an idea of how many to expect. 

See you all soon! Feel free to post on the discussion board if you have any questions!

name: 2D and 3D Graphics in R!
description:
Olivia Daub will be presenting some fun tricks you'll need to know in order to make awesome 3D graphics in R! The session will begin with an review/overview of more basic plots in ggplot, then get into more advanced plots. 

What do I need to bring? 

• Ensure you have an updated version of XQuartz downloaded (you'll need this for the R packages used to generate the 3D plots)

• Install the following R packages by running this code in your R console: 

• install.packages(c("car","psych","scatterplot3d","Rcmdr","rgl","gvlma"))

As usual, we'll make our way to a nearby pub for some beer and food after the session.

See you then!

name: Data manipulation & multivariate analyses!
description:
R-Ladies of London! We are excited to announce our next R-Ladies meet up happening this coming Monday, June 19, hosted by Monica Granados. Monica will be presenting a workshop on data manipulation and multivariate analyses in R. We are SUPER stoked to have her on board as a featured R-Lady, as she brings a wealth of experience and enthusiasm to the table. 

Check her out!

Website | Twitter | Previous R Workshops

As usual, we'll be meeting in the upstairs space at UnLondon from 4 to 6, and will be headed for beers (probably Milos) afterwards. All are welcome to join! 

For this meet up, make sure to have the following installed if you don't already:

• R

• RStudio

• RMarkdown by entering the following into your console: install.packages("rmarkdown") 

• MacTex (for Mac users to render PDFs)

See you then!

name: Co-work drop in session at the London Public Library!
description:
We have been striving to find a way to not only host official events, but also schedule casual co-work drop-in times. We have partnered with the London Public Library to provide regular evening workspace. Come with your work (it can be R-specific or not!) and settle in to plow through a couple hours of focused work time in the company of other R-Ladies. This is our first co-working session and will be the last for the summer, but we are looking to hold more in the fall. While we won't provide specific tutoring sessions at this point, if you do have questions this setting will also provide opportunity to ask others and brainstorm as a group.

Hope to see you there!

name: SPSS to R
description:
Do you want an open source route to statistical methodology? Are you wanting to make the switch from SPSS to R? Join R-ladies #LdnOnt on Friday July 7 from 1-3!!

We are super excited to feature R-lady, Daryn Cushnie-Sparrow as she walks us through the SPSS ---> R switch. Daryn has made the switch for her own research in the Speech and Language field. 

For this meet up, make sure to have the following installed if you don't already:

• R

• RStudio

• RMarkdown by entering the following into your console: install.packages("rmarkdown")  

• Packrat - install.packages("packrat")

Head upstairs to 121 Studios of UnLondon for the tutorial and afterwards we'll try to find a patio!

See you then!

name: R & R Studio Basics
description:
Welcome back, R-Ladies and allies! We will be kicking off the fall session of R-Ladies #LdnOnt with an Introduction to R & R Studio Basics. 

We are thrilled to have local R-Lady and developmental psychologist, Pierina Cheung leading us through a tutorial on navigating R and R Studio interfaces, loading datasets into R, and what your next steps should be. 

This meet up will be held at the London Public Library (central location, right downtown) from 5 - 7 pm. Stay tuned for room location.

If you'd like to follow along during the tutorial, bring a laptop with R and R Studio installed. 

As before, following the meet up we will head to Milos' for snacks and drinks - anyone is welcome to join!

Hurrah! Welcome back everyone, and welcome to those who are just starting out with us!

name: Intro to writing scripts in R and RStudio
description:
At the next R-Ladies #LdnOnt session we'll be delving into the basics of analyses and scripting in R and RStudio. Make sure to have R and RStudio downloaded on your computer!

This event is appropriate for both individuals with and without R experience. Rachael Smyth will be walking us through basic considerations when writing a script to analyze data in R, and demonstrating best practices and techniques. 

Come with R and RStudio installed if you'd like to follow along interactively, or just come to watch and listen. 

As usual, we will head to Milo's afterwards for food and drinks. All are invited to join!

name: Linear, Logistic, and Cox Regression: When and How to Run in RStudio
description:
Join us to learn about regression in RStudio. This month's meet up will be led by Jacqueline Kueper, PhD candidate in Epidemiology and Biostatistics at Western.

No previous experience with regression or RStudio is required; all abilities are welcome. The main portion of the session will involve step-by-step instructions on how to set up, run, and interpret results from regression models that include one and more than one independent variable. We will also cover some background on three types of regression—linear, logistic, and Cox—including when and why you might want to run each of these models. Sample code and data will be made available so that you can follow along on a personal laptop; sitting back to absorb the conversation in a more hands-off way is also an option.

Get excited! See you in December!

name: Lightning Talks
description:
Come join the R-Ladies in our first ever Lightning Talks event. In this fun, informal setting, participants have approximately 3 to 5 minutes to speak about their research, work, or a puzzle they're trying to solve - anything goes! R-related presentations are a bonus but not necessary! Our goal is to 1) provide a space to learn about the others in our community and 2) exchange ideas about methodologies, interests, and the tools we all are using.

IMPORTANT FOR PRESENTERS:

In addition to RSVPing on our MeetUp page, please ALSO complete this form (https://goo.gl/forms/LeoSGYLzdgrXthks2) by December 23 to help us with scheduling and to let us know important pieces of information.

This is not meant to be a high-stakes presentation event - just a chance to share our projects with each other and learn a little about the questions each of us are asking in our own work and the tools we're using to answer them. As usual, we will head out for food and drinks following the event (drinks and apps for presenters are on us!)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

NB: Please note that, in keeping with the global R-Ladies mission, R-Ladies London, Ontario will prioritize female leadership and participation. All interested people (regardless of gender) are welcome to RSVP to our events. However, in the event that we receive a greater amount of presenter interest than we feel is manageable for the space/time, we will prioritize female presenters.

name: Use RMarkdown to generate summary reports and journal articles!
description:
• What we'll do
We will go through a viable workflow for bringing your data into R, generating a summary report, and turning your findings into a full journal article.

At this meetup we will also touch on:
- Reference management integration with R Studio
- Integrating raw .R documents into multiple projects
- Generating informal summary reports of data to share with colleagues, supervisors
- Generating publication-ready manuscript drafts

• What to bring
Laptop with R and RStudio installed

• Important to know
- While all levels are welcome to attend, some knowledge of R and RStudio may be helpful

name: Use R-Shiny to perform interactive data analysis and visualization!
description:
Join the R-Ladies group for another tutorial on April 3, led by Rhiannon Rose. Rhiannon will show us all about using R-Shiny.

R-Shiny provides a handy interface for performing interactive data analysis and visualization, and automating analysis tasks that are boring and repetitive. Once you have the hang of the added layer of syntax, Shiny is easy and versatile - however, the learning curve can be steep in the beginning. This session covers Shiny basics: what your file setup should look like (UI, server and helper files), different types of reactive variables and when to use them, and basic debugging. Examples of simple and complex Shiny applications will be demonstrated. The "shiny" package is required to participate and code a basic Shiny application.

name: R in Industry
description:
Vicki Cocco will be presenting a whole new perspective for us - using R in industry! Vicki is the founder of 10in6 Inc, a London, Ontario based company that helps businesses improve their productivity and efficiency through data analysis. Vicki is also a long-time R-Ladies, #LdnOnt member, and we are thrilled to have her share her insights with our group!

Come join us at this R-Ladies session if you...
... want to start or keep learning about R for your own work/research
... are curious about a career in industry/data science
... are interested in meeting like-minded people interested in tech, coding, and learning!

This meet up will be Tuesday, May 29 at 5:00pm in the Wellington Room of the London Public Library (downtown branch). We will finish by 7:00 and head to Milo's as usual.

See you then!

name: Making science open with R!
description:
Join us for our last meet up until the fall! We are thrilled to have Monica Granados back with us again to close out our second year! Monica comes with a wealth of experience using R and teaching others to use it. She's led numerous tutorials, many of which you can check out via the links below.

This meet up will focus on Open Science:

Founded on the principle science should not be limited by your occupation, race, nationality or economic status, working in the open makes science more accessible by making methods, code, results and knowledge available to anyone, anywhere in the world. Imagine if every analysis you ever conduct from now on could be reproduced by anyone around the world. Or a method that gives you the power to integrate new data seamlessly complete with figures. In this workshop, we will be covering how to work in the open using R, R Markdown and Google Sheets. These three platforms allow us to host data, analyze, visualize data in one reproducible workflow. At the end of the workshop we will also discuss the wider movement of open science, how it is helping breakdown economic barriers in science and how you can contribute.

Learn more about Monica by checking out her...
Website: http://descienceblog.tumblr.com/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/monsauce
R tutorials: http://qcbs.ca/wiki/r

As per usual, we will head to Milo's afterwards to celebrate, chat, and all in all just enjoy each other's company.

-----
(open science word cloud from here: https://www.um.edu.mt/library/departments/openscience)

name: Intro to R programming and RStudio
description:
Welcome back for another season of R-Ladies, London ON (#LdnOnt)! Our kickoff event this fall is an introductory crash course to R (i.e., using the R programming language) and RStudio (the integrated developing environment (IDE)/handy user interface for using R). All are welcome, be you a total newbie to R or even if you are a well-seasoned programmer looking to get a refresher on the basics.

We are extraordinarily excited to welcome back Cortney Hanna-Benson as our workshop leader. Cortney led our very first R-Ladies #LdnOnt workshop back in January 2017, and we have been looking forward to having her again ever since.

If you can, come with R and RStudio already installed, but if you have trouble or are unable to, don't let that hold you back. The workshop will be a mix of presentation and hands-on exercises. You are welcome to follow along actively or passively.

Helpful links:
- R-Ladies #LdnOnt website: https://rladiesldnont.netlify.com/

- R download: https://www.r-project.org/
- RStudio download: https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/

# FAQs

Do I need to be an R expert?
- No! While some familiarity helps, all levels are welcome! If you want to follow along, come with your laptop and have R and RStudio installed.

I already know R, what's in it for me?
- Awesome! Come join a community of people interested in STEM research, meet new pals, learn new skills or sharpen old ones, or talk to us about leading a workshop on a topic you're passionate about!

I don't identify as a lady, but I still want to learn R - can I join?
- Yes! While we prioritize underrepresented genders in leadership positions (including but not limited to cis/trans women, trans men, non-binary, genderqueer, agender), our general membership is fully inclusive. Read more about the global initiative at https://rladies.org/about-us/.

I'm interested in leading a workshop in the future! How do I get in touch?
- Great! You don't even need to be a full fledged "expert" to lead a workshop... this is a group for skill swapping. If you're interested, send us an email at [masked].

name: Figuring out figures in R with ggplot!
description:
This workshop, led by Thea Knowles, will focus on learning to make lovely graphics using the ggplot package. We will cover the basics as well as delve into more advanced options for customizing your figures.

We will also touch on:

- using RProjects for a reproducible workflow
- reading in and manipulating data
- saving plots to certain specifications

Come with R and RStudio installed. We will need the package ggplot2 for this workshop, so if you don't have it already, go ahead and install it in R using the line:

install.packages("ggplot2")

If you have trouble, feel free to reach out to us at [masked].

See you then! As usual, those who want to head with us to Milos' afterwards are welcome!

name: Transitioning from SPSS to R
description: Join us for the return of the popular workshop, "Transitioning from SPSS to R, " led by Daryn Cushnie-Sparrow. The first time Daryn gave this talk back in summer 2017, she walked us through considerations for using R as an SPSS user from the perspective of a relatively new R user (as she was at the time!). She has since updated the presentation and will be leading it anew on Thursday, November 29th at 6pm. The workshop will involve learning how to think about your data in R as an SPSS user and to use commands for running statistical tests in both programs. She will also walk us through how to manipulate your data in R and output it in a ready-for-SPSS format for those who don't like data wrangling in Excel, but work with supervisors or colleagues who prefer to work with SPSS. Daryn is also a tidyverse fiend, and has a way of sprinkling helpful nuggets of useful tidy syntax throughout. Bottom line: there will be lots to learn, whether you're an SPSS user or not!

name: Heatmaps and Pointmaps using ggmap
description:
This workshop, led by Rebecca Henderson, will focus on learning to produce heatmaps and pointmaps using the Google maps platform. Heatmaps can be used to represent population density, per-capita income, social views, and many other geographically important measurements.

There is some prep work to do beforehand if you'd like to actively follow along at the workshop:

This workshop requires an API console key. Using Google Maps to a certain degree is free, but you must enable billing.
Medium wrote a good article explaining the process to help you: https://medium.com/superkoders/ultimate-guide-to-google-maps-d86ad945636a

You'll also need to install the following packages if you don't have them already. You can do this by running the line

install.packages(c("gdata", "tidyverse", "ggmap", "viridis"))

If you have trouble, feel free to reach out to us at [masked].

See you then! As usual, those who want to head with us to Milos' afterwards are welcome!

name: RMarkdown and Bookdown for Dissertating
description:
This month's meet up, led by Thea Knowles, will be an interactive tutorial on preparing to write a dissertation using RMarkdown and Bookdown.

RMarkdown allows you to seamlessly integrate R code and narrative text as well as specify formatting options across multiple document output types (docx, pdf, html). Bookdown serves as a means to combining multiple RMarkdown files into a final book*.

This workshop will feature a crash course on RMarkdown and will cover the following: reference management in RMarkdown, tips for a modular workflow, integrating templates (like Western's thesis templates) into RMarkdown/bookdown documents, and more.

And yes, yes this can totally count as writing time.

*"Despite the package name containing the word “book”, bookdown is not only for books. The “book” can be anything that consists of multiple R Markdown documents meant to be read in a linear sequence, such as course handouts, study notes, a software manual, a thesis, or even a diary." - Yihui Xie https://bookdown.org/yihui/bookdown/

name: Data Cleaning and Exploration in R
description:
Join us for our last R-Ladies #LdnOnt meet up of the season!

This meetup will be all about sitting down with new data! Jaky Kueper will walk us through common practices and procedures for data cleaning and exploration—essentially how to get data into a ‘usable’ form and start looking at what they contain. We will touch on working with multiple datasets (joins) and strategies for when you need to learn more about your data or where they come from. Previous experience with R is not required.

There will be time for the group to skill-share and practice/troubleshoot; if you have new data that you are or will be working with this summer, bring it!

Join us for snacks and drinks at Milos' down the street after the meet up. As always, all are welcome.

Please note that there will be no summer R-Ladies sessions. Stay tuned for more details to come about future sessions.

name: Intro to R programming and R Studio
description:
We're back for another season of R-ladies in London, Ontario (#LdnOnt)! We’re very excited to have Dr. Cortney Hanna-Benson back to take us through some helpful introductory info! These workshops are always helpful for novice and experience users alike, as you sometimes come across tips you wish you had heard ages ago.

In this step-by-step workshop, we will go over the basics of R and R Studio. This workshop is geared towards new R users, but there will also be opportunities to explore R beyond the basics at your own pace. It’s a good idea to come prepared with your technology and with R and R Studio downloaded on your device:

- R download: https://www.r-project.org/
- RStudio download: https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/

Helpful links:
- R-Ladies LdnOnt website: https://rladiesldnont.netlify.com/
- R-Ladies LdnOnt Twitter: https://twitter.com/RLadiesLdnOnt

name: Data Visualization
description:
Join us on Tuesday, November 12 at 6 pm to learn more about data viz. They say a picture's worth a thousand words... Does that apply to figures?

Well, we think it does. Olivia Daub will be giving us a crash course in the Grammar of Graphics, taking us from the basics of ggplot2 to some fancy vizmagic with 3D graphics. Newbies and veterans alike will come away with new tricks, so don't miss it!

Come with R and R Studio installed, as well as the following packages: ggplot2, scatterplot3d, gvlma, rgl, car, rcmdr, and psych. Mac users may need to have xQuartz installed to render 3D graphics.

We'll be in Room 2510 again at Elborn College (1201 Western Road). Parking is free after 4! This is our last meetup at Western, as we'll be back in our regular home at London Public Library starting next month (December 3rd)!!! We'll have signs up to guide you, just like last time. Detailed directions are on our website! (https://rladiesldnont.netlify.com/2019/10/17/2019-10-17-data-visualization-basics-to-3d/)

Please RSVP here, and tweet (https://twitter.com/RLadiesLdnOnt) us if you've got any questions or things you're dying to know that Olivia could try to touch on.

name: Data Cleaning and Exploration
description:
On Tuesday, December 3rd at 6 pm, the wonderful Jaky Kueper will be enlightening us on how to go on a data adventure.

Jaky has taken us through a cleaning and exploration workshop before, and she’s awesome! Come and join us to learn some common practices and procedures for data cleaning and exploration — how to get data into a ‘usable’ form and start looking at what they can tell you. We will touch on working with multiple datasets (joins) and strategies for when you need to learn more about your data or where they come from. This workshop is appropriate for all skill levels!

There will be time for the group to skill-share and practice/troubleshoot; if you have new data that you are or will be working with this summer, bring it! Important to remember is that we are back at our home at the London Public Library Central Branch! We’ll be in the Stevenson and Hunt A Room - we’ll have signs! Parking is free if you park in the Citi Plaza lot - entrance on King. Bring your parking pass to the library’s main service desk and tell them you’re with R-Ladies to get your parking validated.

London Public Library - Central 251 Dundas St London, Ontario Canada N6A 6H9

After we’ve filled our heads with cleaning and exploration knowledge, we’ll explore our way right over to our favourite Milos’ for great beer and better company. See you all very soon!

name: RMarkdown and Bookdown for Dissertating
description:
This month's meet up, Thea Knowles will return to lead us through an interactive tutorial on preparing to write a dissertation using RMarkdown and Bookdown. This month also marks 3 awesome years of R-Ladies London!

RMarkdown allows you to seamlessly integrate R code and narrative text as well as specify formatting options across multiple document output types (docx, pdf, html). Bookdown serves as a means to combining multiple RMarkdown files into a final book*.

This workshop will feature a crash course on RMarkdown and will cover the following: reference management in RMarkdown, tips for a modular workflow, integrating templates (like Western's thesis templates) into RMarkdown/bookdown documents, and more.

*"Despite the package name containing the word “book”, bookdown is not only for books. The “book” can be anything that consists of multiple R Markdown documents meant to be read in a linear sequence, such as course handouts, study notes, a software manual, a thesis, or even a diary." - Yihui Xie https://bookdown.org/yihui/bookdown/

name: Intro to Shiny for interactive graphics and data visualization
description:
Join us on Feb. 11th as Emma Smith introduces us to Shiny.

Tired of presenting your research using the same old boring tables and figures? Shiny is a powerful R package that allows you to create interactive applications ranging from infographics and maps to business dashboards. This workshop will start by providing a walkthrough of the basic framework of Shiny applications, including the creation of interactive plots and tables. This will be followed by some tips on how to kick your apps up a notch using only one or two lines of code thanks to libraries such as shinyWidgets, shinydashboard, and plotly. Resources will be provided for those interested in creating more advanced dashboards or making their Shiny creations available online.

name: Lightning Talks
description:
Lightning Talks are quick 5-minute presentations on whatever you like. Really - anything. All levels of R proficiency are welcome! All topics are welcome! You can present on something you know well, something you’re in the midst of learning, or something you’d like to do and are just getting started with. These talks are a great way to get to know each other and get to know the work we all do, as well as get advice, support, and validation from your fellow R users. Please present! It’s a lot of fun in a safe space.

You can choose to have slides (e.g. PowerPoint) or live code in R or talk off the dome if you really want to! We use HDMI to connect to the library computer, and you can choose to send us slides in advance, bring materials on a USB, or connect your own device.

Come! Talk! It’s fun!

If you’re interested in presenting, please fill out this survey (https://forms.gle/TQWiRGVbj2YxpUd89) so we have a sense of who is presenting and what we’ll hear. If you’re thinking about it but aren’t sure, reach out to us to chat about it! We’re easiest to contact on Twitter or via email.

For presenters and non-presenters alike, please RSVP on our Meetup. See you there!

name: R-Ladies Tbilisi Launch
description:
8 დეკემბერს, 19:00 საათზე, ეკონომიკის სკოლა აისეტის (ISET) საკონფერენციო დარბაზში (ზანდუკელის ქ. #16, I სართული) ჩატარდება R-Ladies Tbilisi-ის გასაცნობი სახის შეხვედრა. ჩვენ დეტალურად გაგაცნობთ R-Ladies ინიციატივასა და მის ფარგლებში დადეგმილ აქტივობებს;  ასევე, თქვენთან ერთად გადმოვწერთ R-სა და R-Studio-ს, გავეცნობით R-ის საწყისებსა და მის რამდენიმე ბრძანებას.

გთხოვთ, თუ შესაძლებელია, თან იქონიოთ თქვენი ლეპტოპი. შეხვედრა წარიმართება ინგლისურ ენაზე, თუმცა საჭიროების შემთხვევაში, ხელმისაწვდომი იქნება ქართული თარგმანიც.

===================================================================

R-Ladies Tbilisi launch meeting will take place on December 8 in ISET (conference hall, 1st floor) at 16 Zandukeli str. It will last between[masked] PM. We will introduce the background of R-Ladies initiative, discuss the activities of R-Ladies with you, download and install R and R-Studio together, and go through first basic commands in R. Please bring your laptops, if possible. The event will be in English, but Georgian translation will be provided for those who need it.

name: Reading and handling data
description:
შემდეგი შეხვედრა გაიმართება 13 დეკემბერს ISET-ში (ოთახი #5.2) საღამოს 7-დან 9 საათამდე. გავივლით R-ის სხვადასხვა ტიპის ბრძანებებს და ვისწავლით, როგორ წავიკითხოთ, შევქმნათ და ვმართოთ მონაცემები.

ვინც ვერ მოახერხეთ მოსვლა, პირველი შეხვედრის მასალები შეგიძლიათ იხილოთ მოცემულ ბმულზე:

https://github.com/rladies/meetup-presentations_tbilisi

გთხოვთ, შემდეგ შეხვედრამდე გადმოწეროთ და დააყენოთ R და RStudio თქვენს ლეპტოპებში. 

R-ის გადმოსაწერად (Windows-ისთვის) გამოიყენეთ ეს ბმული: https://cran.r-project.org/bin/windows/base/

R-ის გადმოსაწერად (Mac-ისთვის) გამოიყენეთ ეს ბმული: https://cran.r-project.org/bin/macosx/

RStudio-ს გადმოსაწერად გამოიყენეთ ეს ბმული: https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/

ასევე, შეგიძლიათ გაეცნოთ R-ის საბაზისო ფუნქციებს (თავი I) მოცემულ ბმულზე: 

http://tryr.codeschool.com/levels/1/challenges/2

==============================================================

The next meeting will take place on December 13, in ISET (room 5.2, 5th floor), between 7 - 9 PM. We will go through commands on how to read in, create and handle data in R.

Materials from the last meeting are here: https://github.com/rladies/meetup-presentations_tbilisi 

Please download and install R and RStudio on your laptops before the meeting starts. 

You can download R here (for Windows): https://cran.r-project.org/bin/windows/base/

Or here (for Mac): https://cran.r-project.org/bin/macosx/

You also need to download RStudio from here: https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/

Please familiarize yourself with the basic R expressions from chapter 1 of codeschool: http://tryr.codeschool.com/levels/1/challenges/2 .

name: Data handling and matrices
description:
შეგახსენებთ, რომ შემდეგი 2 შეხვედრა გაიმართება 22 და 27 დეკემბერს 

ISET-ში (ზანდუკელის ქ. #16) 5.2 აუდიტორიაში საღამოს 7 საათზე.

22-ში გავაგრძელებთ მონაცემთა მართვისთვის საჭირო ბრძანებების შესწავლას და შევეხებით მატრიცებს.

გასული შეხვედრების მასალები შეგიძლიათ იხილოთ შემდეგ ბმულზე:

https://github.com/rladies/meetup-presentations_tbilisi

გთხოვთ, გაეცნოთ მეორე თავს:

http://tryr.codeschool.com/levels/1/challenges/2

======================================================

The next meetings will take place on December 22 and 27, at ISET (16 Zandukeli str), room 5.2. We will go through some data handling commands and work with matrices on December 22. The meeting starts at 7 PM.

You can access the materials from the previous sessions here: https://github.com/rladies/meetup-presentations_tbilisi.

Please familiarise yourself with the R expressions from chapter 2 of codeschool: http://tryr.codeschool.com/levels/1/challenges/2 .

name: Exploring Caucasus Barometer 2015 using R
description:
Eric Barrett will host our next meetup.

We will use the haven library from RStudio to import an SPSS or STATA dataset. We will review what we have learnt of data types, dataframes, factors/levels, and more to explore the 2015 Caucasus Barometer by asking it questions. We might, should time permit, use ggplot2's basic quick plot syntax to visual some results and export the images.

Packages to install:

haven

ggplot2

Datasets to download:

2015 Caucasus Barometer and its codebook from

http://caucasusbarometer.org/en/downloads/

name: Different uses of ggplot
description:
შემდეგი შეხვედრა იგეგმება 26 იანვარის. 19:00-დან 21:00 საათამდე (ოთახში 5.2, ISET-ში - ზანდუკელის ქ. #16). ჩვენ გავეცნობით ggplot პაკეტის მრავალფეროვან შესაძლებლობებს.

Next meetup is on January 26, at ISET (16 Zandukeli str), room 5.2 between 7-9 PM. We will explore different uses of the ggplot plotting package

name: Scraping, tidying and plotting html data
description:
ჩვენი შემდეგი შეხვედრა შედგება 9 თებერვალს, ეკონომიკის საერთაშორისო სკოლა ISET-ის 5.2 ოთახში 19:00 საათზე.სესიას გაუძღვება ბრაიან კუნსი სტოქჰოლმის უნივერსიტეტიდან. სესია შეეხება შემდეგ საკითხებს:1. Rvest-მონაცემთა დაყოფა2. Dplyr და Lubridate - მონაცემთა დალაგება, ცვლილება, რეკონსტრუქცია3. ggplot2 - მონაცემთა ვიზუალიზაცია.

=====================================================

We will meet again next Thursday, February 9 in room 5.2 at ISET starting from 7PM. Brian Kuns from the University of Stockholm will go through the following topics: 1) Rvest – scraping (html) data, 2) Dplyr and Lubridate – tidying and rearranging data, 3) ggplot2 – plotting data.

name: T-test!
description:
მოგესალმებით!ჩვენი მომდევნო სესია შედგება 23 თებერვალს ეკონომიკის საერთაშორისო სკოლა ISET- ის 5.2 ოთახში 19:00 ზე.

ამ სესიის განმავლობაში გავივლით t ტესტს და მისი გამოყენების რამდენიმე გზას R-ში, ასევე ვისწავლით ფუნქიცის წერის საწყისებს და უკვე დაწერილი ფუნქციების გამოყენებას საჯაროდ წვდომადი მონაცემთა ბაზების მაგალითზე. 

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Our next session is on February 23. In this session, we’ll go over how to write a student’s test in R, and in the process learn the basics of writing a function in R. In addition, we’ll go over a few types of t-tests for different circumstances, using already written t-test functions which R has. Moving from the formulas and a brief beer involved history of the t-test, we’ll go over a few applications in R using publicly available data sets.

We meet again at ISET in room 5.2 from 7pm.

name: Linear regression in R
description:
Alessandra Carioli (WorldPop & University of Southampton) will host our next three R-Ladies meetups (ISET, room 5.2). On March 9 (Thursday) Alessandra will talk about the basics of linear regression analysis and how to do it in R.

Feel free to drop in even if you haven't attended all the meetups previously.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

ალესსანდრა კარიოლი (WorldPop & University of Southampton) უმასპინძლებს  შემდეგ შეხვედრას (ISET- ის 5.2 ოთახში 19:15 ზე).

9 მარტი (ხუთშაბათი) - წრფივი რეგრესია

name: Data visualisation: bar charts, pie charts, pyramid charts
description:
Alessandra Carioli (WorldPop & University of Southampton) will host this R-Ladies meetup. 

On March 14 (Tuesday) Alessandra will show how to do data visualisation (ggplot2). We will visualise bar charts, pie charts and pyramid charts, using different indicators of Georgia.

Feel free to drop in even if you haven't attended all the previous meetups.

--------------------------------------------------------------------

ალესსანდრა კარიოლი (WorldPop & University of Southampton) უმასპინძლებს  შემდეგ შეხვედრას (ISET- ის 5.2 ოთახში 19:15 ზე).

14 მარტი (სამშაბათი) - მონაცემთა ვიზუალიზაცია (ggplot2): ბარი გრაფიკი, ტორტი ჩატში, პირამიდას .

name: Mapping Georgia
description:
Alessandra Carioli (WorldPop & University of Southampton) will host this R-Ladies meetup. 

On March 16 (Thursday) Alessandra will cover the basics of creating maps in R. We will create different maps of Georgia.

Feel free to drop in even if you haven't attended all the previous meetups.

-------------------------------------------------------------

ალესსანდრა კარიოლი (WorldPop & University of Southampton) უმასპინძლებს შემდეგ შეხვედრას.

16 მარტი (ხუთშაბათი) - რუქების შექმნა, საქართველოს სხვადასხვა რუქები.

name: Beginners' Drop - In
description:
We will have another batch of beginners' meetups starting on April 6! This is a good chance to take up R learning again. On April 6 we will download and install R and RStudio together, and have an introduction to basic commands in R and RStudio. Please bring your laptops. This will be a hands-on session. The meetup will be held in English.
==================================
თქვენთან ერთად გადმოვწერთ R-სა და R-Studio-ს, გავეცნობით R-ის საწყისებსა და მის რამდენიმე ბრძანებას.

გთხოვთ, თუ შესაძლებელია, თან იქონიოთ თქვენი ლეპტოპი. შეხვედრა წარიმართება ინგლისურ ენაზე

name: Creating and reading R objects and data
description:
You can access the materials from the previous session here:
Code: https://github.com/rladies/meetup-presentations_tbilisi/commit/1dedb893e2214e48be6b2f8764633f9a10376229

Slides: https://github.com/rladies/meetup-presentations_tbilisi/blob/master/R-Ladies%20Tbilisi%2006042017.pdf

You can familiarize yourself with basic R commands here: http://tryr.codeschool.com.

Do join us even if you missed the intro session! If you need help with installing the programme, come a few minutes earlier.
======================================
ვინც ვერ მოახერხეთ მოსვლა, პირველი შეხვედრის მასალები შეგიძლიათ იხილოთ მოცემულ ბმულზე:
https://github.com/rladies/meetup-presentations_tbilisi/commit/1dedb893e2214e48be6b2f8764633f9a10376229

https://github.com/rladies/meetup-presentations_tbilisi/blob/master/R-Ladies%20Tbilisi%2006042017.pdf  

R-ის გადმოსაწერად (Windows-ისთვის) გამოიყენეთ ეს ბმული: https://cran.r-project.org/bin/windows/base/

RStudio-ს გადმოსაწერად გამოიყენეთ ეს ბმული: https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/

ასევე, შეგიძლიათ გაეცნოთ R-ის საბაზისო ფუნქციებს (თავი I) მოცემულ ბმულზე:
http://tryr.codeschool.com.

გელოდებით ყველას, შეხვედრა საინტერესოა მათთვისაც ვინც ვერ შეძლო წინა ლექციებზე დასწრება.

name: Data preparation and manipulation in R
description: Basic commands to prepare and manipulate data in R

name: Introduction to Shiny
description:
Tedo Gogoladze will host this meetup on Shiny (https://shiny.rstudio.com/) for creating web applications with R. 

==========================================

გავეცნობით Shiny - ს (https://shiny.rstudio.com/) ვებ აპლიკაციის შესაქმენლად.

name: Informal R-Ladies Tbilisi meetup
description:
Did you miss the previous beginners' meetups or have any questions about R? This is your chance to come and ask or to come and help others find answers before we continue with our regular meetups in May.

Let's meet at Biblusi on Chavchavadze str 7.

Please RSVP if you plan to join.

name: Regression models in R
description: Basic introduction to linear and logistic regression models using R and Caucasus Barometer data. Do join even if you have missed some meetups or you are a beginner (in R or regressions).

name: Open-theme meetup
description: This is an open-theme meetup. There will be members joining this meetup that can explain data management (data arranging, reshaping, cleaning, indexing, etc), R markdown, regression models as well as what constitutes a function and a package, for example. Join this meetup to ask questions, share experiences or discuss your project.

name: Looping through data
description:
Looping is automating a multi-step process by organizing sequences of actions or ‘batch’ processes and by grouping the parts that need to be repeated. 

During this meetup Brian Kuns will cover looping (base-R) and "data-wrangling" using dplyr and tidyr. If there's time, we will make a graph or two using ggplot2. The data we will be using is farm yield data at a country level from FAOSTAT. We will go through the procedure of downloading CSV data, looking at this raw data to see how it should be "wrangled" or cleaned (which columns are unnecessary? do the columns need to be transposed? etc...).

name: Data visualisation and scraping data from the web
description: Brian Kuns will introduce data visualisation and scraping techniques: 1) Rvest – scraping (html) data, 2) Dplyr and Lubridate – tidying and rearranging data, 3) ggplot2 – plotting data

name: Looping, Scraping, Data Visualisation Vol. 2
description:
We will go through the looping and scraping code shown in the previous two meetups. Check the codes on our github page to prepare for tomorrow:

https://github.com/rladies/meetup-presentations_tbilisi/tree/master/2017_05_22_looping

and

https://github.com/rladies/meetup-presentations_tbilisi/tree/master/2017_05_24_Scraping

name: String manipulation in R
description:
ამ შეხვედრაზე ჩვენ შევეხებით R-ში ტექსტურ მონაცემებთან მუშაობის ძირითად ასპექტებს. ჩვენ ყურადღებას გავამახვილებთ stringr პაკეტზე, რომელიც გამოიყენება ტექსტის თანამიმდევრულად და ეფექტურად დასამუშავებლად კოდირების გათვალისწინებით.

საჩვენებლად განვიხილავთ babynames პაკეტს, რომელიც მოიცავს ამერიკელი ბავშვების სახელებს 1880 წლიდან 2015 წლამდე. ჩვენ დავადგენთ სახელების ყველაზე პოპულარულ პირველ ასოს და სიდიდეს წლის მიხედვით. დამხმარე პაკეტებად გამოვიყენებთ dplyr-ს მონაცემებთან სამუშაოდ და ggplot2-ს ვიზუალიზაციისთვის. 

===========================================

In this session we will go through basics of string manipulation in R. We will concentrate on stringr package, which provides consistent, efficient and encoding-aware tools to work with character strings.

As a demonstration, we will deal with babynames package, which contains US children names from 1880 to 2015. We will find the most popular first letter and length of name for each year. As supportive packages we will rely on dplyr for data manipulation and on ggplot2 for visualization.

name: არჩევნების შედეგების პროგნოზირება/ Predicting Election Outcomes
description:
წინამდებარე შეხვედრის მიმდინარეობისას, ჩვენ ყურადღებას დავუთმობთ სხვადასხვა მეთოდებით საქართველოს 2012 და 2016 წლის საპარლამენტო არჩევნების შედეგების პროგნოზირებას. განვიხილავთ როგორც დეტერმინისტულ (ე.წ. გამოკითხვათა საშუალოების, მოძრავი საშუალოს და შეწონილი საშუალოს), ასევე ისეთ მიდგომებს, რომლებიც საშუალებას იძლევა, შევაფასოთ გაურკვევლობა (მაგ. ინტეგრირებული ავტორეგრესიული მოძრავი საშუალოს და დინამიურ ბაიესურ მოდელებს).
სამუშაოდ იქონიეთ შემდეგი ბიბლიოთეკები: curl, dplyr, DT, ggplot2, ggrepel, knitr, lubridate, mapproj, maps, mvtnorm, purrr, reshape2, rmarkdown, rstan, shinystan, stringr, tidyr, zoo, forecast. მონაცემები და რეპლიკაციის სკრიპტი განთავსდება შეხვედრის შესაბამის github-გვერდზე: https://github.com/rladies/meetup-presentations_tbilisi/tree/master/2017_06_05_election_polling
=============================
During this meeting, we will focus on predicting election results for 2012 and 2016 parliamentary elections. We will go through both deterministic (polling average, weighted and moving average) and those methods which take into consideration uncertainty (e.g. autoregressive integrated models and dynamic Bayesian models).
Please install following libraries on your machine: curl, dplyr, DT, ggplot2, ggrepel, knitr, lubridate, mapproj, maps, mvtnorm, purrr, reshape2, rmarkdown, rstan, shinystan, stringr, tidyr, zoo, forecast. Data and replication scripts will be uploaded to the corresponding Github page: During this meeting, we will focus on predicting election results for 2012 and 2016 parliamentary elections. We will go through both deterministic (polling average, weighted and moving average) and those methods which take into consideration uncertainty (e.g. autoregressive integrated models and dynamic Bayesian models).
Please install following libraries on your machine: curl, dplyr, DT, ggplot2, ggrepel, knitr, lubridate, mapproj, maps, mvtnorm, purrr, reshape2, rmarkdown, rstan, shinystan, stringr, tidyr, zoo, forecast. Data and replication scripts will be uploaded to the corresponding Github page: https://github.com/rladies/meetup-presentations_tbilisi/tree/master/2017_06_05_election_polling

name: Extracting information from Facebook
description:
ლევან ბჟალავა ისაუბრებს თუ როგორ გადმოვწეროთ ინფორმაცია ფეისბუქის საჯარო გვერდებიდან, განვსაზღვროთ გვერდის ყველაზე პოპულარული პოსტი (მოწონებები, კომენტარები, გაზიარებები), შევამოწმოთ ვინ მოიწონა ეს პოსტი და განვსაზღვროთ ტრენდი-რომელ პოსტებს აქვს უკეთესი შედეგი. ჩვენ ასევე ვისაუბრებთ როგორ მოვძებნოთ ფეისბუქის ჯგუფები და როგორ გადმოვწეროთ ჯგუფიდან პოსტების მონაცემები.
=======================
Levan Bzhalava will talk about how to extract information from Facebook public pages, identify the most popular post of the page (likes, comments, shares), check who liked the post, and implement trend analysis - which posts are doing well. He will show how to search Facebook group page and extract group page post data.

name: Time-series in R
description:
შეხვედრა შეეხება დროით მწკრივეს. დავიწყებთ საბაზო ოპერაციების გაკეთებით პროგრამაში. შემდეგ როგორც ტექნიკური ისე თეორიული განხილვებით უფრო ღრმად შევეხებით სტაციონარული მწკრივების ორ ძირითად ტიპს: ავტორეგრესიულ (AR) და მცურავი საშუალოს (MA) პროცესებს. ასევე, განვიხილავთ ჰოდრიკ-პრესკოტის ფილტრს, რომლის მეშვეობით ერთმანეთისგან გამოვყობთ დროითი მწკრივის ციკლურ და ტრენდულ კომპონენტებს. ვიმუშავებთ  R-სტუდიო-ს პროგრამაში. შეხვედრის პრაქტიკული ნაწილისთვის ძირითადად გამოვიყენებთ სიმულაციურ მონაცემებს. შეხვედრა საინტერესო იქნება დამწყებთათვისაც. დაგვჭირდება “mFilter”-ის დაინსტალირება R-სტუდიო-ში. 

შეხვედრას წარმართავს ნინო მელითაური, სამუშაო ენა იქნება ქართული.

==============================================

The meet-up will be about time series. We will begin by basic operations on time series in R-studio.  Then by technical as well as by theoretical discussion we will go further and (1) we will analyze the basic types of stationary time series: autoregressive (AR) and moving average (MA) processes and (2) we will discuss Hodrick-prescott filter, by which we will show how we can separate trend and cyclical components of the time series. We will use R-studio. As practical side, mainly we will work on simulated data. The meet-up will be suitable also for beginners.

We will need “mFilter” package to install.

This meetup is hosted by Nino Melitauri and it will be held in Georgian.

name: R-Ladies თბილისის ახალი სეზონი
description:
გაცნობითი ხასიათის შესავალი სემინარები სექტემბერსა და ოქტომბერში, შაბათ–კვირას ჩატარდება. ამ შეხვედრებზე გავეცნობით R-ს საფუძვლებს (პროგრამის ინსტალაცია, მონაცემთა ობიექტები და სტრუქტურა, სტატისტიკა, ვიზუალიზაცია). პრაქტიკული ნაწილისთვის თან იქონიეთ თქვენი ან საზიარო ლეპტოპი მეგობართან ერთად. გთხოვთ, მიუთითოთ, რომელ შაბათ–კვირას შეძლებთ სემინარზე დასწრებას (ორივე შეხვედრა იგივე პროგრამას მოიცავს, ასე რომ, გთხოვთ, მხოლოდ ერთისთვის გაიაროთ რეგისტრაცია).

რეგისტრაცია: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSd6jZBQDdt35Hg2MgsanSjgBUFxrY4ZOxwULKuWMIgXOGhMJQ/viewform

===================================
Introductory workshops for real beginners will be organised on two weekends in September and October. These meetups will introduce the basics of R (installing, data objects and structures, statistics, visualisation). Please bring a laptop or share one with a friend for practical sessions. Please choose which weekend you will be able to participate (both contain the same information so you should sign up only for one).

Information and registration: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSd6jZBQDdt35Hg2MgsanSjgBUFxrY4ZOxwULKuWMIgXOGhMJQ/viewform

name: rmarkdown for beginners
description:
ჩვენი მომდევნო შეხვედრა გაიმართება 4 ოქტომბერს, 2017. შეხვედრის მთავარი თემა არის rmarkdown-ის გამოყენება. შევქმნით ახალ პროექტს. მარტივი მაგალითების გამოყენებით ავაგებთ rmarkdown-ის ფაილებს Rstudio-ს პროგრამაში. შევქმნით ახალ notebook-ს და ვისწავლით მის გამოყენებას. knit ბრძანებით ვნახავთ როგორ უნდა შევქმნათ ახალი ვორდის დოკუმენტი და ახალი პრეზენტაცია, რომლებშიც მოსახერხებელი გზით იქნება წარმოჩენილი ჩვენს მიერ ჩატარებული მარტივი ანალიზის სრული სურათი. შედეგების PDFფორმატში გამოსატანად შესაძლოა დაგვჭირდეს Latex-ის პროგრამა. (Latex-ის საინსტალაციო ლინკი: http://latex-project.org/ftp.html).

===================================

Our next meet-up will take place on October 4, 2017. The topic will be rmarkdown. We will begin by creating a new project, then using simple examples we will see how to build rmarkdown files in Rstudio. We will create a new notebook and see how it works. By using knit order we will produce a new word document and we will create a new presentation, showing conducted analysis in a convenient way. Also we will be able to have our output in PDF format, for this purpose you may need a Latex program (LaTeX installation link: http://latex-project.org/ftp.html).

The meetup will be hosted by Nino Melitauri in Georgian.

name: R-Ladies თბილისის ახალი სეზონი (2)
description:
გაცნობითი ხასიათის შესავალი სემინარები სექტემბერსა და ოქტომბერში, შაბათ–კვირას ჩატარდება. ამ შეხვედრებზე გავეცნობით R-ს საფუძვლებს (პროგრამის ინსტალაცია, მონაცემთა ობიექტები და სტრუქტურა, სტატისტიკა, ვიზუალიზაცია). პრაქტიკული ნაწილისთვის თან იქონიეთ თქვენი ან საზიარო ლეპტოპი მეგობართან ერთად. გთხოვთ, მიუთითოთ, რომელ შაბათ–კვირას შეძლებთ სემინარზე დასწრებას (ორივე შეხვედრა იგივე პროგრამას მოიცავს, ასე რომ, გთხოვთ, მხოლოდ ერთისთვის გაიაროთ რეგისტრაცია).

რეგისტრაცია: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSd6jZBQDdt35Hg2MgsanSjgBUFxrY4ZOxwULKuWMIgXOGhMJQ/viewform

===================================
Introductory workshops for real beginners will be organised on two weekends in September and October. These meetups will introduce the basics of R (installing, data objects and structures, statistics, visualisation). Please bring a laptop or share one with a friend for practical sessions. Please choose which weekend you will be able to participate (both contain the same information so you should sign up only for one).

Information and registration: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSd6jZBQDdt35Hg2MgsanSjgBUFxrY4ZOxwULKuWMIgXOGhMJQ/viewform

name: Shiny!
description:
Shiny არის პაკეტი რომელიც შესაძლებელია გამოვიყენოთ ინტერაქტიული ვებ გვერდების შესაქმნელად R studio-ში. სოფო რუხაძე გაგაცნობთ Shiny ფუნქციას და როგორ ხდება მისი გამოყენება R studio-ში გარკვეულ მონაცემებზე დაყრდნობით. შეხვედრა ჩატარდება ქართულ ენაზე.

==================================

Shiny is a package that can be used to build interactive web pages with R and RStudio. Sopho Rukhadze will introduce basic Shiny functions and how to build a Shiny app, using in-built data from R. The meetup will be in Georgian language.

name: Basics of machine learning with R
description:
The meetup is hosted by Vincenzo Lagani, post-doc researcher at the University of Crete and co-founder of Gnosis Data Analysis. His main research interest is devising machine learning and statistical algorithms, and their applications on a variety of fields, including biology, clinical and business data.
The meetup will focus on predictive analytics (classification), decision tree learners and neural networks (deep learning).
The talk will last ~90 minutes, during which Vincenzo will also show how to analyze a dataset in R.
After that the attendees should have ~30 minutes to repeat the analysis on a second dataset.
Approximate outline of the meetup:
1) Data mining, machine learning and statistics: putting concepts into context
2) Overview of machine learning tasks: classification, clustering, feature selection, association rules, etc.
3) Focus on classification: decision trees and neural networks
4) The importance of being honest: avoid overfitting at all costs!
5) Analyzing the MNIST dataset with decision trees and neural networks in R
6) Hands-on: analyzing the Iris dataset

================================

შეხვედრას უმასპინძლებს ვინჩენცო ლაგანი, რომელიც ისაუბრებს Machine learning-ზე. შეხვედრა ჩატარდება ინგლისურ ენაზე.

name: სტატისტიკური ანალიზი
description:
27 ოქტომბრის შეხვედრა კვლავ დაეთმობა სტატისტიკურ ანალიზს. კერძოდ, გავაგრძელებთ საუბარს ფიქტიურ ცვლადებსა და ინტერაქციულ წევრებზე წრფივ რეგრესიულ მოდელში. ზოგადი მიმოხილვის შემდეგ, ვიმუშავებთ პრაქტიკულ მაგალითზე, რომლის ფარგლებში გვექნება წინა შეხვედრის სტატისტიკური თემების გახსენებაც. შეხვედრის სამუშაო ენა იქნება ქართული.

====================================

This meetup will be a continuation of beginners' workshop's statistical analysis presentation. In particular, we will discuss dummy variables in linear models and interaction terms. After the general discussion we will work on a practical example. In addition, during the practical part, we will have a revision of the previous meetup's statistical topics. The meetup will be in Georgian.

name: Creating an R package
description:
The possibility of organizing code in packages is one of the main advantages of R. Packages can also be made publicly available so that everybody can benefit from them. This talk will show step-by-step how to create an R package from scratch, using a hands-on example.

Read about R packages here: https://www.statmethods.net/interface/packages.html

Vincenzo Lagani is hosting this meetup, in English.

===========================
R-ს ერთ-ერთი მთავარი უპირატესობა არის კოდების ორგანიზება პაკეტებში.  ეს პაკეტები შესაძლოა ასევე გახდეს საჯარო, რაც მათ ყველასთვის ხელმისაწვდომსა და სარგებლის მომტანს გახდის. ამ შეხვედრაზე გავიგებთ თუ როგორ შევქმნათ პაკეტები R-ში საწყისი დონიდან, პრაქტიკული მაგალითების საშუალებით.

დამატებით ინფორმაციას R-ს პაკეტებზე გაეცანით შემდეგ ბმულზე: https://www.statmethods.net/interface/packages.html

name: Data types, indexing, cleaning and preparation - for beginners!
description:
The next meetup is on December 14. This is suitable for beginners - it is a good continuation of the beginners' workshop this fall.

During the session we solidify our knowledge of fundamental data structures in R and then learn efficient approaches of preparing data sets for analysis. First topic is very important for beginners: we must clearly understand how data are stored in R.
Here we will discuss basic data types (vectors of logical, integer, numeric, character values) and more advanced types (lists and data frames). Also we will touch element indexing in R (e.g. why there are three ways to extract elements from a list: dollar sign, square brackets and double square brackets).

Second part is useful to get more efficient and faster at data cleaning and preparation. It's a common problem for data scientists: we spend about 80% of our time moving cells, rows and columns around to get them ready for a specific analytical procedure. So to get more job done we must be efficient in data management. We will look at two modern R packages: dplyr and tidyr. They are like a Swiss Army knife for a data scientist, and we have low chances to survive in R community without them. These packages allow us to produce more elegant code that leads to faster development and reduces risk of errors. 30 minutes of Excel spreadsheet tasks can be completed with 3 lines of R code with these packages.

The meetup will be hosted by Alexander Matrunich, in English.

================================================

შემდეგი შეხვედრა გაიმართება 14 დეკემბერს. ეს შეხვედრა, რომელიც კარგი გაგრძელებაა შემოდგომის სემინარებისა, ორიენტირებული იქნება დამწყებებზე. ამ სესიაზე გავამყარებთ ჩვენს ცოდნას მონაცემთა სტრუქტურაზე და ვისწავლით სასარგებლო გზებს მონაცემების მოსამზადებლად ანალიზისთვის. პირველი თემა ძალიან მნიშვნელოვანია დამწყბეთათვის: ჩვენ კარგად უნდა გავიგოთ, თუ როგორაა მონაცემები დახარისხებული R-ში. განვიხილავთ მონაცემთა საბაზისო და უფრო რთულ ტიპებს. ასევე შევეხებით ინდექსირებას. მეორე ნაწილი შეეხება მონაცემების სწრაფ გაწმენდასა და მომზადებას. ეს მონაცემთა მეცნიერებისთვის ცნობილი პრობლემაა: ჩვენ ჩვენი დროის 80%–ს სწორედ მონაცემთა მომზადებაში ვხარჯავთ კონკრეტული ანალიზისთვის. ჩვენ გამოვიყენებთ ორ თანამედროვე პაკეტს: dplyr და tidyr. ისინი ძანიალ მნიშვნელოვანია მონაცემთა ანალიზისთვის და მათ გარეშე ძნელი იქნება R-ში მუშაობა. ეს პაკეტები საშუალებას გვაძლევს დავწეროთ დახვეწილი კოდები, რომლებიც შეამცირებს მომავალი ხარვეზების არსებობის ალბათობას. ექსელის სამუშაო, რომელსაც სჭირდება 30 წუთი, R-ში შეიძლება გაკეთდეს 3 ხაზით, ამ პაკეტების კოდების საშუალებით. შეხვედრა გაიმართება ინგლისურ ენაზე და მას უმასპინძლებს ალექსანდრე მატრუნიხი.

name: Operators and loops in R - for beginners (ქართულ ენაზე)
description:
• What we'll do
მომდევნო შეხვედრა გაიმართება 21 დეკემბერს. იგი გათვლილია დამწყებთათვის. შერჩეული თემა ფუნდამენტური და მნიშვნელოვანია, რადგან შეეხება R-ში ჩადებულ ლოგიკას. კონკრეტულად, დავიწყებთ კავშირის ოპერატორების - და, ან, არა - განხილვით, შემდეგ ვისაუბრებთ ლოგიკურ ოპერატორებზე. ამის შემდეგ გადავალთ "თუ-მაშინ" პირობით წინადადებებზე.
შეხვედრას დავასრულებთ "while loop"-ით. ვნახავთ, როგორ მარტივად და სასარგებლოდ შეიძლება მისი გამოყენება, მაგალითად, მანქანაში, მძღოლის დამხმარის მოწყობილობაში.

შეხვედრა გაიმართება ქართულ ენაზე და მას უმასპინძლებს ნინო მელითაური.

==============================
The next meetup is on December 21. It is suitable for beginners. The topic is about the logic of R. We will discuss relational operators like "and", "or", "not", and logical operators, followed by "if-else" conditional statements. We will end with "while loops" and try out an example.

The meetup is hosted by Nino Melitauri, in Georgian.

• What to bring

• Important to know

name: Loops, if-else and apply functions
description:
• What we'll do
ამ ლექციაში ვისწავლით რამოდენიმე საბაზისო პროგრმულ ინსტრუმენტს, როგორიც არის loop ფუნქცია (ასევე როგორ არის შესაძლებელი იგვე ოპერაციების ჩატარება უფრო მარტივად სხვადასხვა ფუნქციების გამოყენებით) . სოფო რუხაძე გვანახებს როგორ არის შესაძლებელი სიცოცხლის მოსალოდნელი ხანგრძლივობის გამოთვლა იაპონელ ქალებში მოცემული ფუნქციების საშუალებით. ასევე პროგრამაში შევქმნით მონაცემებს რომ მარტივად იყოს გასაგები არსებული ფუნქციების გამოყენების მიზანი. გავეცნობით if, if-else, for loop, while-loop, ლოგიკურ ბრძანებებს როგორიც არის and და or, ასევე გამოივყენებთ apply, lapply, sapply, tapply ფუნქციებს. ზემოთ აღნიშნული ფუნქციები საკმაოდ გავრცელებულია და სასარგებლოა იმათთვის ვინს ვმუშაობს სხვადსხვა ტიპის მქონე ცვლადების მონაცემეთა ბაზებთან.

This meetup is about programming tools such as loops (as well as tips how to avoid them). Sopo Rukhadze will show how to use if, if-else, for loop, while-loop, logical commands (and, or -functions), and apply, lapply, sapply, tapply functions to avoid for-loop . This meetup will be in Georgian.

• What to bring

• Important to know

name: Caucasus Barometer 2017
description: დავით სიჭინავა ისაუბრებს, თუ როგორ უნდა ვიმუშაოთ R გარემოში მასობრივი გამოკითხვის მონაცემებზე. ლექციის მსვლელობისას შევისწავლით ისეთი ბიბლიოთეკების გამოყენებას, როგორიცაა survey, readstata13, haven და foreign. 2017 წლის "კავკასიის ბარომეტრის" მონაცემების მაგალითზე, დათო გვაჩვენებს, თუ როგორ უნდა ჩავატაროთ გამოკითხვის მონაცემების მარტივი ანალიზი და ვიზუალიზაცია.

name: RMarkdown - Creating Documents in R (beginners)
description:
შეხვედრის მთავარი თემა არის rmarkdown-ის გამოყენება. შევქმნით ახალ პროექტს. მარტივი მაგალითების გამოყენებით ავაგებთ rmarkdown-ის ფაილებს Rstudio-ს პროგრამაში. knit ბრძანებით ვნახავთ როგორ უნდა შევქმნათ ახალი ვორდის დოკუმენტი და ახალი პრეზენტაცია, რომლებშიც მოსახერხებელი გზით იქნება წარმოჩენილი ჩვენს მიერ ჩატარებული მარტივი ანალიზის სრული სურათი.
===================================

The topic of the meetup is RMarkdown. We will begin by creating a new project, then using simple examples we will see how to build RMarkdown files (Word document, presentation, PDF) in Rstudio.

The meetup will be hosted by Nino Melitauri in Georgian.

name: Creating a website/ blog
description:
• What we'll do
We will create a website in R using blogdown (https://bookdown.org/yihui/blogdown/) and Hugo (https://gohugo.io/).
We will view the website on our local browser. This meetup is suitable for beginners. It will be in English.

• What to bring

• Important to know

name: Machine learning with R
description:
თბილისი რ-ქალბატონების მომავალი შეხვედრის საგანი არის მანქანური სწავლება, რომელიც დღესდღეობით დიდი პოპულარულობით სარგებლობს და კერძოდ random forest-ის მეთოდი. გავეცნობით მეთოდის არსს, თუ როგორ მუშაობს ის და რა არის გადაწყვეტილებათა ხე. გავაანალიზებთ მეთოდის უპირატესობებს, როგორიცაა რეგრესიისა და კლასიფიკაციის პრობლემების გადაწყვეტა, რობასტულობა, ათასობით input ცვლადის გადამუშავება მათი გადარჩევის გარეშე, ცვლადების რანჟირება მათი მნიშვნელოვნების მიხედვით, გამოტოვებული ცვლადების ეფექტური შიდა კონტროლი. მეთოდს პრაქტიკულად გამოვიყენებთ მომხმარებელთა ბრუნვის (დაკარგვა) მაგალითზე. შეხვედრას წარმართავს ნინო მელითაური, სამუშაო ენა იქნება ქართული.
============================
The next R-ladies Tbilisi meetup is about machine learning, and in particular, random forest method. We will introduce the main idea of it, how it works, and what is a decision tree. We will realize the advantages of the random forest, which are:
- robustness to correlated predictors,
- solving both regression and classification problems,
- handling thousands of input variables without variable selection,
- feature selection tool using its variable importance plot,
- taking care of missing data internally in an effective manner.

We will implement the method using customer churn example.

The meetup will be hosted by Nino Melitauri, the working language will be Georgian.

name: Data wrangling
description:
მომდევლო შეხვედრა, რომელიც ჩატარდება 11 აპრილს, ეხება Data Wrangling -ის თემას სადაც გავეცნობით ‘dplyr’ სა და ‘tidyr’ პაკეტების გამოყენებას. Data Wrangling საშუალებას იძლევა, მონაცემთა ბაზებზე მოვახდინოთ სხვადასხვა სახის მანიპულაცია, რაც ამარიტივებს მონაცემთა ვიზუალიზაციას და საშუალებას გვაძლევს, მონაცემთა ბაზებზე ჩავატაროთ სხვადასხვა მოქმედება. მოცემული სესიის მიზანია, მსმენელს გააცნოს სხვადასხვა სახის ბრძანება, ისეთი როგორიც არის შეჯამება, ახალი ცვლადის შექმნა, მონაცემთა სორტირება, მონაცემთა გავრცელება, დაჯგუფება და შერწყმა, რაც მუდმივად გამოსადეგია მონაცემთა ბაზებთან მუშაობისას. სესია ჩატარდება ქართულ ენაზე.

Next meetup will take place on 11th April, where we discuss data wrangling and how to use ‘dplyr’ and ‘tidyr’ packages. Data wrangling gives the possibility to manipulate data, and make data visualization more flexible and give us possibility to do different operations on data. This workshop introduces commands such as summarise, create, sort variable for a dataframe; spread, gather data and merge datasets - all very useful tools when working on big data. The session will be in Georgian language.

name: Impromptu beginners' meetup
description:
This impromptu beginners' meetup has been organised due to popular request. It is a short version of our regular beginner workshops, and covers the following:
19.00 - 20.00 Intro to R data objects, structures and indexing
20.00 - 21.00 Basic statistics

Please have R and RStudio downloaded and installed on your laptops. You can download R here: https://cran.r-project.org/bin/windows/base/. You will also need RStudio: https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/.

This meetup is hosted by Nino Melitauri (EMTG), and is given in English. Everyone is welcome to attend.

name: Survival analysis, news and organisational issues
description:
The meetup will focus on the following three topics:

1. Survival analysis of timing of death using the “survival” package. Visualising the data using the “ggplot2” and “survminer” packages.
2. News from the eRum conference.
3. Future activities and R-Ladies Tbilisi organisational issues.

There will be R-Ladies hex-stickers for participants to grab. This meetup is not a hands-on workshop. The meetup will be held in English.

name: Hosting Isabella Gollini & Omayma Said
description:
We are hosting two international r-ladies: Isabella Gollini and Omayma Said.

Isabella's talk is titled "Exploring network data with latentnet and lvm4net". In this talk she will perform real network data analysis, using latentnet and lvm4net R packages. These packages provide a rich source for performing probabilistic visualisation and clustering of heterogenous network structures.

Omayma's talk's title will be confirmed soon as well.

About speakers:
Isabella is an Assistant Professor in statistics at the University College Dublin.
Omayma has experience in engineering and working in a tech company.
Both ladies are in town for the DataFest Tbilisi.

The event is held in English, and it starts at 6.45! So please be there on time.

name: R პაკეტის შექმნა კომპანიის შიდა გამოყენებისთვის
description:
შეხვედრის მთავარი თემა იქნება  კომპანიის შიდა გამოყენებისთვის R პაკეტის შექმნა. ვისაუბრებთ სამ ძირითად თემაზე: 

1. რა ტიპის კომპანიას შეიძლება დასჭირდეს საკუთარი R პაკეტი და რა არის მთავარი ასეთი პაკეტის შექმნისას. განვიხილავთ კონკრეტულ შემთხვევას, მსოფლიოში ერთ-ერთი უმსხვილესი მარკეტინგული კვლევების კომპანიის "კანტარ"-ის მაგალითზე. 

2. განვიხილავთ სტატისტიკურ მეთოდს რომლის მიხედვითაც შეიქმნა კონკრეტული R პაკეტი ამ კომპანიისთვის. აღნიშნული მეთოდის მიზანია დიდი კითხვარების მოდულარიზაცია (დაყოფა) მონაცემების ხარისხის გაუმჯობესების და არარსებული მონაცემების რაოდენობის შემცირების მიზნით. აღნიშნული მეთოდის საჭიროებას განვიხილავთ სხვადასხვა საუკეთესო გამოცდილებების მაგალითზე.

3. კონკრეტული მონაცემების და კითხვარის მაგალითზე გამოვიყენებთ აღნიშნულ R პაკეტს და ვისაუბრებთ მის ძირითად ფუნქციებზე.

შეხვედრას ჩაატარებს ნუცა აბაზაძე. ნუცამ ახლახანს დაამთავრა სამაგისტრო პროგრამა Survey Statistics გერმანიაში, ბამბერგის უნივერსიტეტში. სამაგისტრო ნაშრომის ფარგლებში მან შექმნა R პაკეტი ერთ-ერთი უმსხვილესი საერთაშორისო კვლევითი კომპანიისთვის. ამასთანავე მას აქვს 2 წლიანი გამოცდილება კვლევითი და საკონსულტაციო მიმართულებით.

The meetup will be hosted by Nutsa Abazadze, the working language will be Georgian.

name: ვებ-მონაცემთა მოპოვება R-ით
description:
დღეს უამრავი რესურსი არსებობს მონაცემთა მოსაპოვებლად. არის ვებ გვერდები სადაც ღიად აზიარებენ მზა მონაცემთა ბაზებს. ასევე, ბევრი დიდი კომპანია უადვილებს მომხმარებელს მონაცემთა გამოყენებას მოსახერხებელი API-ებით. თუმცა, ვებ სივრცის დიდი ნაწილის მონაცემთა მადანი მაინც რჩება შედარებით ნაკლებად ხელმისაწვდომი. შეხვედრაზე ვისაუბრებთ R-ის rvest პაკეტის გამოყენებაზე ასეთ მონაცემთა მოსაპოვებლად. განვიხილავთ ამ პროცესის კომპონენტებს კონკრეტულ მაგალითზე.

შეხვედრა გაიმართება ქართულ ენაზე და მას უმასპინძლებს ანა მამათელაშვილი. ანა არის მათემატიკოსი, მუშაობს მელბურნის უნივერსიტეტში და ძალიან უყვარს R, პითონი, ველოსიპედით სიარული და ბუნებრივი ენის დამუშავება.

name: დამწყებთა სემინარი (1)
description:
R-ს შეხვედრები გრძელდება! ამჯერად დამწყებთა სემინარები ჩატარდება 28 მარტს, 11 და 18 აპრილს.

28 მარტი - ნუცა აბაზაძე გაგაცნობთ R-ს საფუძვლებს
11 აპრილი- ნატო ხალაძე ისაუბრებს რეგრესიულ ანალიზზე R-ს საშუალებით
18 აპრილი- ნუცა აბაზაძე გაუძღვება შეხვედრას მონაცემთა ვიზუალიზაციაზე

შეხვედრის ადგილი ჯეოლაბი, დასაწყისი 19:00 საათზე.
შეხვედრებზე დასასწრებად R-ს ცოდნა არ არის აუცილებელი.

name: დამწყებთა სემინარი (2)
description:
R-ს შეხვედრები გრძელდება! ამჯერად დამწყებთა სემინარები ჩატარდება 28 მარტს, 11 და 18 აპრილს.

28 მარტი - ნუცა აბაზაძე გაგაცნობთ R-ს საფუძვლებს
11 აპრილი- ნატო ხალაძე ისაუბრებს რეგრესიულ ანალიზზე R-ს საშუალებით
18 აპრილი- ნუცა აბაზაძე გაუძღვება შეხვედრას მონაცემთა ვიზუალიზაციაზე

შეხვედრის ადგილი ჯეოლაბი, დასაწყისი 19:00 საათზე.
შეხვედრებზე დასასწრებად R-ს ცოდნა არ არის აუცილებელი.

name: Working with sheets (hosting Ildi Czeller)
description:
First, Ildi Czeller will introduce her daily work: how does a typical project look like, what she uses R for, what kind of internal R packages they build and use. The second part will be more interactive: you will learn about packages to work with sheets: the readxl, googledrive and googlesheets(4) packages are useful to read and write data for collaboration with others who do not necessarily use R. It will be useful to bring your own laptop with R installed but you will be able to follow and learn without that as well.

About Ildi: Ildi uses R for more than 4 years now in her work as a Data Scientist at Emarsys. She graduated as a mathematician and mostly learned programming on the job. She uses a lot of {shiny} and {data.table} and has experience in developing R packages for internal use. She finds it exciting to collaborate with people with different backgrounds. Ildi is a regular presenter at meetups and conferences and also teaches software engineering to high-school students in her free time.

Ildi is in town for the upcoming DataFest Tbilisi conference where she will give a talk and a workshop.

name: დამწყებთა სემინარი (1)
description:
გაცნობითი ხასიათის შესავალი სემინარები თებერვალ-მარტში, შაბათ–კვირას ჩატარდება. ამ შეხვედრებზე გავეცნობით R-ის საფუძვლებს.

ინფორმაცია და რეგისტრაცია: https://bit.ly/3bpdyiH

=======================
Introductory workshops for beginners will be organised on two weekends in February and March. These meetups will introduce the basics of R.
Info & registration: https://bit.ly/3bpdyiH

name: Meet & Scheme
description:
***Note the change of venue from the original seaport location!***

Thank you to the Vitek Lab at Northeastern for securing us a great spot in our time of need! The room, 020, is in the basement of West Village F, which is right at Ruggles Station - The closest T stops are Ruggles (orange) and Northeastern (green E). The CT2 and 47 buses are good options from Cambridge.

The Inaugural RLadies Boston Meetup! Loosely structured agenda as follows:

1) Network/Schmooze

2) Call for brief announcements (jobs, R-related events)

3) Open discussion about goals/mission/direction for the group

4) Probably some raised-hands style voting on some of the ideas from the discussion

Pizza sponsor acquired!

name: Getting Started with R
description:
Thank you to Hollister Staffing for buying our pizza this month!

Everyone's clamoring for a beginner's tutorial, so here it is! We'll start from "Hello, World!", cover some programming basics and some R basics, and then jump into dplyr if we have time (dplyr is an R package that makes it very intuitive to sort/filter/transform your data. For folks who want to work on data right away, it's a great introduction to R.)

Please come with a laptop that has R installed. The presentation will be shown in RStudio (an R-Ladies sponsor!) so you might want to install that too!

name: Social Hour
description:
December is hectic! Everyone's busy! So we're not going to have a regular, overachieving, educational Meetup, we're just going to get together for (pressure free!) drinks. Pop in if you can!

If we get massive interest, the location may change, but I promise it will stay on the red line.

name: Lightning talks!
description:
Come see and do lightning talks! Please get in touch ASAP if you'd like to give a 5-10 minute talk and this date works for you! EDIT: This location needs a list of attendees 24 hours ahead of the event - if you don't use your full name for your Meetup/R-Ladies account, please either update it with first and last name, or send me a message through the "contact organizers" button and let me know privately. I also need names for your guests! Thanks!

😍 Potential Roster (so far!):

• Amy - Gender issues in CS/Math

• Marianna - knitr and/or RMarkdown

• Janelle (from Metrum!) - ???

• Charmaine - "Rolling in The Deep: Deep Learning 101"

• Svetlana(?) - ?bioinformatic things? 

• YOU???

name: Project Night
description:
Pizza will be sponsored by DataCamp! THANK YOU! R-Ladies feel free to request pizza flavors of interest

We're back at Pivotal in March for Project Night! Bring an R project to work on (a personal project you're working on, or a tutorial, or even homework or a professional project) and we'll help each other out and/or cheer each other on!

If folks want to get started with Shiny, this is a good tutorial, and there will be at least one other Shiny user to help you out :) 

If you want, post a comment about your anticipated topic and see if you can rustle up some co-conspirators.

name: Shiny with Wendy Chen
description:
Wendy Chen is a Manager on the Advanced Analytics and Data Science team at DigitasLBI, responsible for delivering effective data-driven marketing strategies for clients. She was formerly an analyst on the Data Science team at EnerNOC and a statistician at the International Energy Agency. She is an expert in using R for data mining, developing predictive algorithms, and visualization.

She has generously agreed to be our first speaker and will be talking about SHINY!

We'll have some thai food for dinner, courtesy of our sponsor (and makers of Shiny!) RStudio.

name: RStudio::conf screening & discussion!
description:
We're gonna get the projector going and watch some talks from this year's RStudio::conf! In between talks, we'll have a chance to discuss our experience with the methods mentioned, and even better, folks will be able to ask each other questions if they are confused or want to know more!

Link to conference site: https://www.rstudio.com/conference/

I personally want to see these:

Putting square pegs in round holes: Using list-cols in your dataframe – Jenny Bryan

Text Mining the tidy Way – Julia Silge

Writing Readable Code with Pipes – Bob Rudis

But others are invited to suggest some too! And we don't have to watch those three either! (Keep in mind that not all the talks are the same length, and the plan for this event is to just watch a few that are under half an hour.)

name: Ice Cream Social!
description:
NOTICE DATE CHANGE (due to Bioconductor Conference)

No venue, no sponsor, no problem! Meet other R-Ladies, eat ice cream, and just hang out! If the weather is predicted to be bad, we'll either reschedule or go to a bar instead!

(Because this is not a sponsored event, bring $$ to pay for your ice cream/coffee/whatevs. If finances are a barrier to attending, get in touch. Also you don't technically have to buy anything.)

Store Website: https://www.tosci.com/

name: dplyr 0.7.0 - tidyeval / programming with dplyr
description:
Dplyr is a super popular R package that is great for exploration and transformation of tabular data (think data frames), is awesomely readable, and is perfect for beginners to get productive fast. Unfortunately, some of the things that make it great for productivity and interactivity make it less great for programming - i.e. using variables to make code more flexible and reusable. This major release of dplyr has some updates that begin to address these issues. 

I will give a speedy intro to dplyr then we'll go through some of the new goodies! There will be pizza!

NOTE: This venue requires full names for visitors a few days in advance. Contact me through the link on the left if this poses an issue.

name: Project Night!
description:
Bring a project and help others or get the help you need! Projects can be anything - work assignment, hobby project, homework, or tutorial (or anything else - or nothing if you'd like to help others or just hang out). Pizza and beverages will be generously provided by Klaviyo.

Feel free to use the comments to coordinate with others or share ideas!

name: October Meetup & Pre-EARL Boston social event
description:
NOTE DATE CHANGE: Hi all! I was feeling silly for misreading the calendar and scheduling this a day too early for EARL arrivals not taking workshops, but am now MORTIFIED (MORTIFIED!) that it didn't occur to me that the whole Halloween thing would affect people with children. I am so sorry everyone, carer duties, even fun ones, are among the reasons that women often have less time to advance their careers! To those who have already RSVP'd yes: if desired, I will still have a beer/beverage with you, on the 31st, or another date!

October's meetup will be a SOCIAL one, which we haven't had for a few months! In honor of R-Ladies foreign and domestic being in town for EARL Boston, we're doing it the night before EARL starts. Please bring $$ for your own drinks (or find me a sponsor!)

name: Writing reports with knitr
description:
I just taught a workshop at Penn that ended with knitr and all the feedback was "we want more knitr!" so I'm expanding it for the Boston crowd. The target audience for the seminar section is more toward beginners who have not experimented with knitr, but I hope folks who already use it might learn a trick or a better way to do something, either from me or another attendee.

We'll go over the anatomy of a knitr report (YAML header, Markdown, chunks, output options) and I'll demo a few reports - a very simple one and an envelope-pushing one.

I intend to leave time at the end for folks to work on a knitr project in a friendly & knowledgeable environment. SERIOUSLY: Bring your data!

Pizza and drinks will be provided by our awesome hosts!

Again I'm requesting that you share a full name through the RSVP (only goes to organizers) so we can accommodate our host's security practices.

name: Holiday Exodus Pub Night
description:
Nobody's in town! Let's do a no-stress thing! Input welcome for a no-prep, no-laptops [required] event :)

Final location decided: Flat Top Johnny's - in that plaza (upper level) with Friendly Toast & Bon Me & Smoke House & State Park

name: purrr with Phoebe Wong
description:
• What we'll do
Phoebe will walk through the purrr package, a complete and consistent functional programming toolkit for R. It will be a hands-on workshop focusing on map() functions that help to perform iterative tasks with more readable code. It is especially helpful when working with nested list, for example, JSON objects, a common data format from web scraping outputs and databases.

The workshop is designed to be beginner friendly that no prior experience with purrr is required. However, some experience with data manipulation in lists and data frames in R will be helpful to understand the content. We recommend you to bring your personal laptop with R and RStudio installed, however, it is not a requirement. More setup details to follow closer to the date.

About the speaker

Phoebe Wong is a research analyst in the analytics group of a Hollywood movie production company. She uses R at her day job, while outside of work, she uses R to wrangle interesting public data and build Shiny applications. She presented at useR! 2017 on her personal project, a Shiny application to visualize Microsoft Outlook calendar history. She holds a Bachelor degree in Psychology at University of California, Berkeley.

• What to bring
A laptop with R and RStudio installed, and cat puns/jokes if you've got 'em ;)

• Important to know
Please include your full name (if not displayed) and the full names of your guest(s) when you RSVP, it's a condition of the generosity of our hosts

name: Channeling Curiosity into R Data Visualization Projects - with Alex Albright
description:
• What we'll do
How can R users learn to visualize data? While there are many incredible courses and resources, nothing is as effective as finding an intriguing question and challenging oneself to create an original visual answer. Generating visualizations can be astonishingly satisfying and can drive deep dives into R workflow, libraries, and community resources. I will present snippets of scripts and notebooks written to visually answer the following questions, running the gamut from quirky and light to serious and weighty: How often do female athletes grace the cover of Sports Illustrated?
