name: R-Ladies Code-llaboration Hangout
venue_name: AT&T NYC Data Science Research Center
description:
We'll kick off the year with a hands-on working session where we'll work together on our own projects or tutorials.

Come in curious about a subject or looking to make progress on a project you're working on!

We'll divide ourselves into groups who'll be working on similar topics, and we'll have prompts and tutorials at hand for those who don't have a particular project in mind.

We believe that by collaborating with other R-Ladies who share your curiosity you’ll get much further than you would at home with google, and that even if you don’t have a set goal you’ll learn through sharing and receiving tips and tricks.

All experience levels welcome!

We'll have five groups, for those working on projects related to:
1 - Making your website with R and blogdown
2 - Building a package
3 - Tidy Tuesday
4 - Forecasting with time series data
5 - Everything else!

Thank you to AT&T for hosting us and the R Conference and Lander Analytics for sponsoring pizza.

name: timetrackR and gtsummary
description:
**Meeting location: LMHQ 150 Broadway 20th floor, New York, NY 10038**

Our speakers for the night will be Jessica Lavery and Margie Hannum from Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center. Jessica will be talking about the timetrackR app. Margie will be discussing the gtsummary package.

Agenda:
6:30-6:55 pm Introductions and Social Time
6:55-7 pm R-Ladies New York Announcements
7-7:10 Sponsor Message from IBM Developer New York
7:10-7:40 It's Time to Shine with timetrackR App, Jessica Lavery
7:40-8:10 Creating publication-ready and reproducible analytical tables with gtsummary, Margie Hannum
8:10-8:30 Networking

Title: It’s Time to Shine with the timetrackR App
Presenter: Jessica Lavery

Abstract: While tracking time may seem like a mundane task that in and of itself consumes your time, if monitored and assessed regularly it can be useful to create a record of your work and to identify potential areas for improving efficiency. The timetrackR Shiny app provides a high-level summary of active, inactive and upcoming projects, as well as visualizations for the percentage of time spent by project or project investigator, number of hours spent on each project, and a timeline framing each project’s trajectory from planning through analysis and manuscript preparation. With the option to filter by year, investigator and analyst, the app is versatile enough to use for an individual or for an entire team as well as for use on a regular basis and for year-end or longer-term reviews of how time was spent. I will highlight the key features of the app and demonstrate how to integrate into your current workflow.

Bio: Jessica Lavery is a Biostatistician in the Department of Epidemiology and Biostatistics at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center. She has an MS in Biostatistics from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill (2014) and as of Fall 2019 is also pursuing a doctorate in public health (DrPH) in Biostatistics at Columbia University. Her research focuses primarily on retrospective analyses using institutional and claims data sources. She also serves as the[masked] Volunteer Coordinator for the Caucus for Women in Statistics. Follow her on Twitter @jessicalavs

Title: Creating publication-ready and reproducible analytical tables with gtsummary
Presenter: Margie Hannum

Abstract: A critical aspect of many data analysis projects is presenting tables of summary statistics and regression model results. However, summarizing results into publication-ready tables often requires a lot of extra code to customize (e.g. create reference line for categorical variables, format p-values a certain way, bold variable labels, merge multiple model results into one table, etc.). The {gtsummary} package provides an elegant and flexible way to make summary and analytic tables in R. Written as a companion to the {gt} package from RStudio, the {gtsummary} package summarizes data sets, regression models, and more, using sensible defaults with highly customizable capabilities. It also allows you to pull values straight from these tables for use in inline text so that every portion of your R markdown analysis report is reproducible. This talk will go over the functionality of the {gtsummary} package, and how you can use it to create beautifully formatted, ready-to-share summary and result tables in a single line of R code.

Bio: Margie Hannum is a Biostatistician at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in the Department of Epidemiology and Biostatistics. Her research collaborations largely involve using multi-modal genomic and single cell data to characterize cancer subpopulations. She contributes to the {gtsummary} package and uses it every day in her analysis pipelines. Twitter: @Margaret_Hannum

name: Kickoff Meet
description:
This will be the kickoff meet for R-Ladies Pune chapter. We will be discussing the motive of this group, the way ahead, announce up-coming sessions and gauge the community requirements.
** The logo for this kickoff meet is created using the R package "wordcloud"

name: Meetup 1: Using trees and networks in R
description:
Note : This event will be live streamed. The link for live streaming : http://webcast.unipune.ac.in

Dr. Susan Holmes (Statistics Department, Stanford University) will be joining us for this meetup. She will talk on "Using trees and networks in R"

Abstract:
Networks and trees are often used to represent both biological data
and knowledge about a system with nodes and interactions such as social communities.
Phylogenetic trees were used to represent family relationships between species even before Darwin's famous notebook sketch.
Networks are often used to schematize complex interactions between proteins involved in diseases, between community members or between neurons in the brain.

She will show examples of making effective maps and testing network and tree data using the R packages phyloseq,igraph, ggplot, ggnetwork and ggraph.

name: Meetup 2: Vectors and Subsetting in R
description:
Discussion on a family of datatypes in R: Vectors, and also on how subsetting operators work in R.

Reference material: https://adv-r.hadley.nz/index.html

This is a beginner level session with hands-on practise. Please carry your laptops along.

name: Code and Coffee: A collaboration with PyData Pune
description:
R-Ladies Pune collaborates with PyData Pune to host a Code and Coffee event!

Ready to show your R skills ladies ?

The concept is simple, bring a laptop and code. Here's how it works:

1. At 09:45 am, everyone introduces themselves.
2. At 10:00 am, We will share and discuss the problem statements and necessary stuff.
3. For the rest of the day, folks work in the communal space on their code providing one another help and conversation as needed. Oh, and they usually drink coffee too!.
---------------------------------------------
What to bring??
-- Laptop with charged batteries
-- Adaptor and cord

Others
-- Install RStudio
----------------------------

name: Meetup 3: Introduction to Git
description:
Speaker: Ragini Jain

Ragini is a DevOps automation specialist at Strikr.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Talk description:

Git is a distributed version control system used extensively in Free or Open Source Software (FOSS) projects. It provides remarkable speed, efficiency and support for non-linear workflows.

In the introductory Git session, the attendees will learn capabilities of Git. Working with a new repo, dealing with staging and commits, addressing new requirements in branches, sharing the work and multiple models of merging. We will also discuss about 'fetch and merge' vs 'pull'.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Please bring a fully-charged laptop and a setup will be provided to the attendees to explore git concepts and capabilities.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
To attend, please RSVP. It would be good to keep your RSVP up to date. Please unRSVP, if you realize you can't make it.

name: Kick-off meeting
description:
Welcome to the Kick-off meeting of R-Ladies Bergen!

The plan for the evening is informal and fun. Let´s get to know each other and discover how the Bergen chapter can best serve your needs. We will introduce the background of the R-Ladies community and its mission to promote and support inclusivity and diversity in the R community. We will discuss topics for themed meetings so please feel free to bring ideas. We look forward to your contributions.

Come and take part in creating a vibrant local chapter of R-Ladies Global!

@RLadiesBergen

name: Intro to Tidyverse
venue_name: High Technology Center - University of Bergen
description:
We will give an overview of the tidyverse-way of data handling giving you hands-on examples on how to read in, manipulate, and plot data. @Jonelle will be giving us special fresh tips, as she will be attending Hadley Wickham's tutorial at the rstudio:conf 2020 a few days before the meeting!

To get a quick overview of Hadley's way of thinking, read: https://joss.theoj.org/papers/10.21105/joss.01686

Please bring your laptop with RStudio (https://rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/) and Tidyverse (https://www.tidyverse.org/) installed. We will provide coffee, tea, and some snacks.

[Photo credit: Pattern by ameliamn (http://www.amelia.mn, www.redbubble.com)]

name: R-Ladies Ottawa Launch Event
description:
R-Ladies Ottawa is pleased to announce that we'll be hosting our official launch event! Come enjoy an evening of R-related discussion, and a chance to network with other R-users from across the city on Thursday March 28th, 2019 at SurveyMonkey (200 Laurier Avenue West, main floor).

Feel free to share the event invite with all those who may be interested!

name: R-Ladies June Event
description:
Come join R-Ladies Ottawa for our second event of the year! Topics for the night include:

- An introduction to the tidyverse (https://www.tidyverse.org/)

- Navigating memory limitations in R & tips to help speed up performance

- Some useful resources for those seeking to learn/improve their R skills

- An example of how R is used in practical research (given by Josie Hughes, who will be presenting her work: "Projecting the cumulative effect of harvest, fire and roads on forest and boreal caribou: a northwestern Ontario example")

Feel free to share with all those who you think may be interested. We hope to see you there!

name: R-Ladies Ottawa - Fall Event
description:
Come join R-Ladies Ottawa for a fun, interactive mini-coding session! For this event, we will be using data from the National Health Interview Survey (NHIS: https://www.cdc.gov/nchs/nhis/nhis_2017_data_release.htm) to demonstrate how to analyze "real" data. The data we're required to use in our day-to-day work are often messy, hard to read, and may contain missing values. The goal of this exercise is to demonstrate how to overcome these difficulties in order to find meaningful relationships in the data.

Note: Please bring your laptops in order to be able to participate in this session! We will leave 20-30 minutes at the end for those of you who wish to share your results.

P.S. We put up some starter code to help you load the data in case you need a bit of help to get you started. It's on our GitHub page: https://github.com/R-LadiesOtt/meetup_Oct02_2019

name: R-Ladies Lexington Park Launch
description: We'll begin with pizza, introductions, and planning for future meetings. All are welcome! The second half of the meeting will offer a tutorial in R and programming basics; this portion of the meeting will be most interesting to those who want to get started in programming and R; however, experienced users are also welcome to stay and participate. Bring your laptop to install R and follow along.

name: Introduction to the tidyverse and Github
description: Cassie will offer an introduction to the tidyverse and Github. Computers will be available but you are welcome to bring your laptop. Pizza, tea, and snacks will be available.

name: Primer meetup de R-Ladies Cuernavaca: Introducción a R y RStudio
description:
Nuestro primer encuentro de R-Ladies Cuernavaca tiene como finalidad dar a conocer la comunidad de R-Ladies e introducir al ambiente de R y RStudio, con un enfoque en el uso de R en la investigación.

El taller será nivel básico, no se requieren conocimientos previos sobre R, y se impartirá en español.

En esta ocasión las ponentes serán:

Verónica Jiménez Jacinto es Licenciada en Matemáticas Aplicadas y Computación, cuenta con un posgrado en la especialidad de Reconocimiento de Patrones. Su producción científica ha incluido creación de algoritmos de selección de variables en problemas de reconocimiento de patrones y ha desarrollado sitios web para el análisis de expresión diferencial en genes y transcriptomas de Novo. Administró la base de datos regulonDB (regulondb.ccg.unam.mx) y participó en el proyecto de secuenciación del genoma de Rhizobium etli. Actualmente, forma parte de la Unidad Universitaria de Secuenciación Masiva y Bioinformática de la UNAM, se ha especializado en el análisis de expresión diferencial de genes y análisis primario de datos NGS (Next Generation Sequencing). Adicionalmente, cuenta con la certificación de Software Carpentry y el grado de master en DB otorgado por ORACLE. Actualmente es co-organizadora y co-fundadora del capítulo R-Ladies Cuernavaca y forma parte del directorio de ponentes de RLadies global.

Leticia Vega Alvarado es Licenciada en Matemáticas Aplicadas y Computación, Maestra en Ciencias en el área de Ingeniería Electrica con especialidad en computación y Doctora en Ciencias e Ingeniería de la Computación. Ha impartido cursos de lenguaje C, Python, R y Bioconductor en los posgrados de la UNAM y UAEM (Morelos). Es instructora certificada de Software Carpentry y ha participado en diversos talleres en el área de prgramación en R y análisis de Expresión Diferencial. Es autora de diversas publicaciones científicas. Ha sido galardonada con la medalla al mérito “Alfonso Caso” y la distinción “Sor Juana Inés de la Cruz”, otorgadas por la UNAM. Actualmente trabaja en el Instituto de Ciencias Aplicadas y Tecnología de la UNAM y sus intereses académicos se centran en las áreas de Bioinformática, Reconocimiento de Patrones y Visión por Computadora. Actualmente es co-organizadora y co-fundadora del capítulo R-Ladies Cuernavaca.

Joselyn Chávez Fuentes es Ingeniero Biotecnólogo del IPN, realizó sus estudios de Maestría en Ciencias Bioquímicas en el IBT y actualmente es estudiante de Doctorado en el laboratorio de Genómica Computacional del Instituto de Biotecnología, UNAM. Recientemente comenzó a desarrollar paquetes de R/Bioconductor enfocados en el análisis de reguladores transcripcionales y actualmente colabora en el desarrollo de un paquete para el uso de la base de datos regulonDB dentro de R. Este año fue becada para presentar su contribución en el Bioconductor Conference 2019 en NYC. Actualmente es co-organizadora de la CDSB México y miembro de la RMB, también es co-organizadora y co-fundadora del capítulo R-Ladies Cuernavaca y forma parte del directorio de ponentes de RLadies global.

Programa:
15:45 Registro
16:00 Qué es R-Ladies?.
16:20 Por qué R?.
17:00 Ambiente de trabajo: R y RStudio.
17:45 Coffee Break
18:00 Introducción a R: variables y ayuda.

Requisitos:
Traer tu computadora personal
Tener instalado R (https://cran.r-project.org) y RStudio (https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download)
Leer y atender el código de Conducta (rladies.org/code-of-conduct)

Cupo limitado: 40 personas.
Es necesario que te registres y traer una identificación oficial para entrar al evento. Si realizaste el registro pero no te es posible asistir, por favor elimina tu reservación para permitir que otra persona pueda atender al evento.

Agradecemos al Instituto de Biotecnología (http://www.ibt.unam.mx) y al Centro de Ciencias Genómicas (http://www.ccg.unam.mx) de la UNAM por su apoyo para la realización de este evento.

name: Segundo Meetup R-Ladies Cuernavaca: Estructuras de datos en R
description:
Nuestro segundo Meetup de R-Ladies Cuernavaca constará de dos sesiones prácticas de nivel básico. Aprenderemos cuáles son las características de las Listas y Data frames, cómo se estructuran y cuáles son algunos casos poco comunes con los que nos hemos encontrado durante su uso.

Este Meetup será impartido por dos integrantes de R-Ladies Cuernavaca:
- Joselyn Chávez (Listas).
- Leticia Vega Alvarado (Data frames).

Fecha: Viernes 28 de Febrero de 2020.
Lugar: Auditorio del Centro de Ciencias Genómicas de la UNAM Campus Morelos.

PROGRAMA
16:15 Bienvenida.
16:30 Conociendo las Listas en R.
17:30 Coffee Break.
18:00 Trabajando con Data frames.

Importante: TRAE TU TAZA para el coffee break!! Estamos comprometidas con el Programa Basura Cero de la UNAM, por lo que NO tendremos vasos desechables.

REQUISITOS:
- Leer y atender el código de conducta disponible (https://rladies.org/code-of-conduct/)
- Traer tu computadora personal.
- Instalar R última versión.
- Instalar RStudio última versión.

Si no te es posible asistir al evento, por favor cancela tu inscripción al menos 24 horas antes del evento para darle oportunidad a las personas en lista de espera.

En este evento tendremos una sala de actividades para niños, cuéntanos durante tu registro cuántos pequeñines te acompañarán al evento y sus edades para diseñar las actividades más divertidas para ellos.

Agradecemos a nuestros patrocinadores: R Consortium (https://www.r-consortium.org) y Centro de Ciencias Genómicas de la UNAM (https://www.ccg.unam.mx).

name: Tercer  Meetup R-Ladies Cuernavaca: Generación de gráficas con ggplot2
description:
En nuestro Tercer Meetup de R-Ladies Cuernavaca tendremos una invitada especial, la Dra. Ernestina Godoy Lozano del Instituto Nacional de Salud Pública nos hablará sobre cómo generar gráficas con el paquete ggplot2.

Conocimientos necesarios:
- Manejo de Data frames
- Lectura y escritura de archivos en R.

Fecha: Viernes 20 de Marzo de 2020.
Lugar: Aula 3 de la Licenciatura en Ciencias Genómicas dentro del Centro de Ciencias Genómicas de la UNAM

PROGRAMA
16:15 Bienvenida.
16:30 Introducción a ggplot2
17:30 Coffee Break.
18:00 Generación de gráficas.

Importante: TRAE TU TAZA para el coffee break!! Estamos comprometidas con el Programa Basura Cero de la UNAM, por lo que NO tendremos vasos desechables.

REQUISITOS:
- Leer y atender el código de conducta disponible (https://rladies.org/code-of-conduct/)
- Traer tu computadora personal.
- Instalar R y RStudio última versión.
- Instalar el paquete ggplot2 con install.packages("ggplot2").

Si no te es posible asistir al evento, por favor cancela tu inscripción al menos 24 horas antes del evento para darle oportunidad a las personas en lista de espera.

En este evento tendremos una sala de actividades para niños, cuéntanos durante tu registro cuántos pequeñines te acompañarán al evento y sus edades para diseñar las actividades más divertidas para ellos.

Agradecemos a nuestros patrocinadores: R Consortium (https://www.r-consortium.org), el Centro de Ciencias Genómicas y el Instituto de Biotecnología de la UNAM.

name: Meet and Greet
description: This will be a very informal event.  This initial meet up is meant to meet each other and find out a little bit about where everyone envisions this group going.  We want to know how much background you have in R and what topics are of interest.  We chose Spot Coffee on Hertel right now but based on who comes we can chose a more central location for future events.  We will also be curious as to what days/times work best for everyone to try and meet the needs of the group for scheduling other events.

name: Light chat
description: Informal gathering to discuss current projects.

name: BuffaloR and R-LadiesBuffalo Combo Meeting
description:
It has been awhile since we have tried to do some consistent meetups. With the launch of the new BuffaloR meetup group we thought it would be nice to get the ball rolling with a few joint meetup to get all those interested in R together in one spot. We hope you can join us!

Tentative schedule:
- Meet & great
- Presentation by Scott Jackson on Shiny Apps for interactive plotting/graphing
(back-up presentation by Lori Shepherd on Bioconductor)
- Feedback for future events
Location: Farber Hall UB South Campus Room G26

name: R-Ladies Buffalo and BuffaloR Combo meeting
description:
This is the second combo meeting between BuffaloR and RLadies!

Current agenda:

6:00-6:30 - Networking, introductions
6:30-7:30 - Tentative: “Using R and Python Together Effectively”, Scott Jackson
7:30-8:00 - Feedback, Q&A

name: Primer Meetup de RLadiesCDMX
description:
Estamos muy emocionadas de anunciar nuestro primer encuentro de chicas interesadas en el lenguaje de programación R (#rstats). Nuestro objetivo principal es crear comunidad, así que no te preocupes si tienes muchísima o muy poca experiencia, la onda es conocernos y buscar formas de apoyarnos mutuamente para aprender más.

Gracias a Google México (y el contacto vía TheDataPub), la cita será en Centraal, el jueves 31 de agosto a partir de las 19:00.

Orden del día

• 7:30 - 7:45: Bienvenida por Teresa Ortiz (https://twitter.com/TeresaOM) (CONABIO) y Silvia Gutiérrez (https://twitter.com/espejolento) (COLMEX) fundadoras de RLadiesCDMX

• 7:45 - 8:00: Mini charla sobre RLadies Global y RLadies

• 8:00 - 8:40: Ronda de presentaciones: las que quieran (¡ojalá que todas!) tendrán un espacio de 3 minutos al estilo "charla relámpago" o "PechaKucha" para presentarse. Pueden usar hasta 3 diapositivas (a veces las cosas se dicen mejor con imágenes) y las pueden añadir en esta pres colaborativa (https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1sI2PRP2M3SydegLd-CdwwN9Y7xzxTz9XylyA3dbDgcA/edit)

• 8:40 - 9:20: Lluvia de ideas para siguientes reuniones actividades

• 9:20 - ... : Networking con chelas y pizzas (¡tal vez consigamos sponsors!)

name: ¡Segunda reunión R-Ladies CDMX!
venue_address_1: Antonio caso #76, Col. San Rafael, 06470, Ciudad de México
description:
¡Ya llegó por fin! Nuestro segundo encuentro de RLadiesCDMX será el jueves 14 de diciembre a partir de las 19:30 en el generoso espacio que nos prestó Cardumen Co-Working (http://www.cardumen.mx/) (http://www.cardumen.mx)!

En esta reunión podrás escuchar sobre pronósticos probabilísticos con R, convivir con otrxs interesadxs en R mientras con pizzas y chelas ¡y aprender herramientas novedosas de visualización en R!

IMPORTANTE: La asistencia es gratuita; pero el espacio limitado a 50 participantes. Asegura tu lugar inscribiéndote al meetup y si sabes que no podrás ir, desinscríbete para que otrxs puedan ocupar tu lugar.

Orden del día

• 19:30 - 19:50: Plática por Diana Lucatero: Cómo un reverendo del siglo XVIII te está ayudando hoy a decidir si debes cargar tu sombrilla: Sobre el uso del Teorema de Bayes en meteorología, pronósticos probabilísticos, verificación y R!

• 19:50-20:10 Networking con pizza-chelas patrocinadas por el R Consortium.

• 20:10-21:00 Taller de visualización. Cómo contar una historia con datos (OJO: traigan sus laptops con R (https://cran.r-project.org/mirrors.html) y RStudio (https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/) instalados)

Y recuerda que nuestro objetivo principal es crear comunidad, así que no te preocupes si tienes muchísima o muy poca experiencia.

De nuevo, gracias a Cardumen Co-working y R Consortium por su apoyo para esta reunión.

name: Tercer Meetup en el encuentro de Usuarixs de R
description:
¡​Chichxs!

¡Ernesto J. Barrios, profesor de estadística del ITAM, nos invita a que nuestro tercer encuentro sea dentro del marco de la Reunión de Usuarixs de R el jueves 15 y viernes 16 de febrero en el ITAM de Santa Teresa!​

Si quieren presentar sus trabajos o dar talleres tenemos apartados los siguientes espacios apartados para nosotrxs el viernes 16 de febrero:​

​Sesión 5: 10:50-12:20 ​Presentación de RLadiesCDMX​
Sesión 6: 12:40-14:10 ​3 a 4 presentaciones de RLadies de entre 15 y 20 minutos

Taller ​3​: 16:00-16:55 - Taller RLadiesTaller ​4:​ 17:05-18:00 - Taller RLadies​¿Quién se apunta​?


Sólo tienen que registrarse en: https://encuentrousuariosr.wixsite.com/itam2018/events/encuentro-de-usuarios-de-r-2018-1/form


(¿si se apuntan nos mandan un correíto a cdmx (at) rladies.org sólo para estar enteradas y difundir su evento por nuestras redes?)

​Un abrazo,

Silvia y Tere​

name: Cuarto Meetup de RLadies: 20 funciones para perderle el miedo a R
description:
Este encuentro consistirá en un taller de R para principiantes: 20 funciones para perderle el miedo a R , será impartido por las R-Ladies Mariana Carmona y Mariana Godina.

No es necesario saber R pero sería conveniente instalar R (https://cran.r-project.org) y RStudio (https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/) antes del taller. Ambos son gratis y este es tu primer paso para aprender R!

Queremos agradecer a Yolanda Villavicencio por su indispensable ayuda en la organización de este Meetup, que será el jueves 12 de abril en WeWork (col. Juárez).

Tendremos pizza y cerveza gratis, las esperamos!

name: ¡Sexto Meetup de RLadies!
venue_address_1: Carretera México- Toluca 3655 Col. Lomas de Santa Fe 01210 México, D.F.
description:
El encuentro consistirá en un Taller Introductorio de R con Teresa Ortiz y una presentación por Katia Guzmán de su trabajo utilizando R.

Se llevará a cabo en la Planta baja del Laboratorio Nacional de Políticas Públicas (LNPP) del CIDE (http://lnpp.cide.edu/). Es necesario que te registres previamente y que lleves una identificación para el acceso.

Te recomendamos llevar tu computadora. No es necesario saber R pero sería conveniente instalar R (https://cran.r-project.org) y RStudio (https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/) antes del taller.

Queremos agradecer al CIDE, especialmente al LNPP, por su vital ayuda en la organización de este evento y quienes patrocinarán el coffee break.

Hay estacionamiento gratuito. Existen dos entradas al CIDE, por la carretera y por Santa Fe, aquí puedes consultarlas: https://t.co/M5vDUSfIas

name: ¡Séptimo Meetup/Taller de RLadies! Twitter y procesamiento de textos
description:
El encuentro consistirá en una presentación por Amalia Pulido de su trabajo utilizando R para minar Twitter y su uso en la campaña presidencial de 2018 en México + un taller también con Amalia y Silvia Gutiérrez sobre Procesamiento básico de textos en R :)

Se llevará a cabo en el salón PA11 de la Biblioteca Daniel Cosío Villegas (http://biblio.colmex.mx). Es necesario que te registres previamente y que lleves una identificación oficial para el acceso.

Te recomendamos llevar tu computadora. No es necesario saber R pero sería conveniente instalar R (https://cran.r-project.org) y RStudio (https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/) antes del taller.

Queremos agradecer a El Colegio de México, especialmente al Centro de Cómputo, la BiblioColmex y Presidencia, por su vital ayuda en la organización de este evento y patrocinio de pizzas y refrescos.

name: ¡Octavo Meetup/Taller de RLadies! Analizando una Encuesta Nacional con R
description:
El encuentro consistirá en una presentación y taller por Ana Escoto (profesora de la FCPYS de la UNAM; @aniuxa en Twitter).

Esta plática/taller se centrará en cómo se puede analizar la Encuesta Nacional de Ocupación y Empleo (ENOE) con R.

Se llevará a cabo en los nuevos salones de cómputo de la planta baja de la Biblioteca Daniel Cosío Villegas (http://biblio.colmex.mx). Es necesario que te registres previamente y que lleves una identificación oficial para el acceso.

Queremos agradecer a El Colegio de México, especialmente al Centro de Cómputo y la BiblioColmex, por su vital ayuda en la organización de este evento.

name: Ciencia de datos en CDMX: R meets Python
description:
Registro necesario por eventbrite:
https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/r-meets-python-ciencia-de-datos-en-cdmx-tickets-64422655898

Descripción del evento:

Rladies CDMX y Pyladies CDMX se unen para presentar: “Ciencia de Datos en CDMX: R meets Python”

Agenda para el día:
6:30 Bienvenida
6:30 -7:00 Networking
7:00-8:00 Charlas (Karen Estefanía González, Mariana Carmona, Dulce Ambrocio, Diana Elisa García Cortés)
8:00-8:30 Networking preparación para tutorial
8:00-9:00 Tutorial: Usando R y Python desde reticulate

Las pláticas serán enfocadas en el distinto uso de R y Python para ciencia de datos, desde investigación hasta producción.

Finalmente el tutorial presentado por Tania Allard y Varely Briz será enfocado en el uso de paquetes como reticulate y rpy2 para usar R en conjunto con Python en un solo código. Ideal para aquellos que trabajan en grupos de ciencia de datos multi-lingües.

Acerca de las ponentes:

Karen Estefanía González
Estudió Actuaría en la Universidad Autónoma del Estado De México. Cuenta con tres años de experiencia en el Análisis de Datos, con enfoque en ayudar a las empresas a mejorar sus estrategias de mercado.

Actualmente trabaja como Data Scientist para el equipo Global de Innovación en Kantar.

Mariana Carmona
Estudió la licenciatura conjunta en Matemáticas Aplicadas y Actuaría, y la maestría en Ciencia de Datos ambas en el ITAM.

Trabaja como Data Science Manager para el equipo Global de Innovación en Kantar y es organizadora de R-Ladies CDMX.

Dulce Ambrocio
Data scientist lead en True Home

Facultad de ciencias UNAM

Diana Elisa García Cortés.
Estudiante de Doctorado en Ciencias Biomédicas en el Instituto Nacional de Medicina Genómica, laboratorio de Genómica Computacional.

Tania Allard
Developer advocate en Microsoft UK. Se especializa en ciencia de datos a escala y DevOps aplicadas a Machine learning. Además es contribuidora y maintainer de un número de paquetes de código libre y la fundadora de PyLadies NorthWest UK.

Valery Calderon Briz
Software Engineer en Prescrypto. Ingeniera en Telecomunicaciones. Fundadora de la comunidad Python Guatemala y Co-organizadora de PyLadies CDMX.

Registro necesario por eventbrite:
https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/r-meets-python-ciencia-de-datos-en-cdmx-tickets-64422655898

name: Escribiendo funciones en R con Jenny Bryan
description:
En nuestro siguiente encuentro tendremos el gusto de contar con la presencia de Jenny Bryan, quien impartirá un taller sobre cómo escribir funciones.

Jenny Bryan (PhD, UC Berkeley) es Ingeniera de Software en RStudio. Jenny es referente internacional en la comunidad de R, dentro de la cual es integrante ordinaria de la R Foundation, parte del Comité de Liderazgo de rOpenSci y forma parte del consejo asesor cientifico de BioConductor.

El taller se impartirá en inglés, contando con ayudantes que pueden apoyar en español. Debes traer laptop con R (https://cran.r-project.org), RStudio (https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/) y el paquete tidyverse (https://www.tidyverse.org/packages/) instalado.

Es muy importante que des RSVP únicamente si puedes asistir ya que los lugares son limitados. Si confirmas asistencia pero luego no puedes asistir, te pedimos por favor que dejes tu lugar disponible para otra persona.

Agenda para el día:
6:30 Bienvenida
6:30-7:00 Networking
7:00-8:30 Taller

El evento será en las instalaciones de Kantar (donde está el edificio de Banregio), Kansas #20 col. Nápoles. También se puede entrar por Insurgentes Sur #863.

Agradecemos a Kantar y a la AME por hacer este evento posible!!

¡Nos vemos pronto!

name: Retos de Navidad en R
description:
Nuestro último encuentro del año será un convivio con retos, premios, comida y cerveza!!

- Este evento es para todxs, no importa si eres principiante, intermedio o avanzado.

- No olviden traer sus laptops con R instalado.

Muchas gracias a Bedu por apoyarnos en este evento!!!

name: [Education Series] 擁抱跨界力 – CS+X 的新方向 p.s. Working With JavaScript In R
venue_address_1: 台北市大安區光復南路102號11樓
description:
[Agenda]

• 19:15-19:30 R Basic

• 19:30-20:30 主議程: 擁抱跨界力 – CS+X 的新方向 p.s. Working With JavaScript In R @Pecu

• 20:30-20:50 閃電秀:  Power BI with R @Kristen

• 20:50 -  自由交流時間

[Talk Information]

• 擁抱跨界力 - CS+X 的新方向 p.s. Working With JavaScript In R
寫程式、訓練計算思維(Computational Thinking)全球都在瘋。程式語言儼然已成為全民必修的第二外語。我們想透過本次分享來探討， 程式語言在歷史、中文、新聞、生活與個人價值 到底發生了何種巨大的影響力？

本次分享目標在滿足三種需求：

1. 了解寫程式的重要，但是不知道如何開始？

2. 已經開始接觸一段時間卻遇到瓶頸，但不知道如何重拾熱情？

3. 已經是神人等級的高手，但卻不知道該如何觀察身邊的問題？

最後，用Working With JavaScript In R的 Living Coding來結尾，期待，共同創造更多擁有跨領域人才。

• Power BI with R
Power BI 是微軟推出非常好用的BI工具，也支援了多種的來源 Excel, Microsoft SQL, JSON, Microsoft Azure....
Power BI 也可以與R整合，來執行統計分析、建立出吸引人的視覺化圖表。

[Speaker Information]

• 蔡芸琤(Pecu)
目前為國立臺灣大學共同教育中心助理教授，曾於德國馬克斯普朗克科學史研究所擔任博士前研究員，亦曾於衍生品估值和風險管理計算跨資產分析服務提供商 Numerix  擔任軟體工程師。

• Kristen Chan  
喜歡學任何新鮮有趣的東西，看到 R-Ladies 大家無私地分享很多知識給大家，很期望也能貢獻一點自己學到的東西，並與大家一同成長。

[Host information]

• Yen
R-Ladies Taipei organizers 之一。

name: TW.R x HK.R 台港社群交流
venue_address_1: Lane 248, Section 3, Zhongxiao E Rd, Da’an District, Taipei City, 106
description:
•  講者將會以英文演講，聽眾用中文或英文發問都可以。The main talk will be delivered in English, but attendants are free to ask questions in Chinese. 

•  此活動與 Taiwan R User Group 合辦，報名請至 Taiwan R User Group 報名。This event is co-organized with Taiwan R User Group, please register via this webpage: https://www.meetup.com/Taiwan-R/events/236327688/

• Program 議程表

19:30-20:00 Lightening Talk 閃電秀
An (Short?) Introduction to Bioconda, UpSetR, and snakemake 
@亮亮 liang2

20:00-21:00 Main Session 主議程
Harnessing social media data with machine learning 
@Lucia

•Main Session 主議程

Title: Harnessing social media data with machine learning 

Abstract: Judging others' psychological traits is not only an essential skill in successful social living, but also an important factor in product development. Psychological traits are a key driver behind human interaction, behavior and emotions. Although accurate judgments stem from social-cognitive skills, developments in machine learning show that computer models can also make valid judgments. It is also possible that this technique can assist clinical diagnosis in the future.

Research by Lucia Chen (speaking), Tao Gong and Rob Davidson.
Directions: https://m-labs.hk/public_events.html 

• Speaker: Lucia, Lushi Chen

Master in Linguistics  The University of Hong KongMaster in Psychology City University of Hong Kong 
Lucia has just finished her master degree of psychology this December. She is going to pursue a doctoral degree in psychology in the coming year.Her major research area is to use social media data to predict psychological traits. Her previous works include using internet data to predict user’s satisfaction with life and depression symptoms.She is also interested in app development, especially a chat bot.
Programming language: R, Python, Javascript, HTML, Meteor Actual speaking language: Chinese, English and some broken Japanese

Interests: watch panda videos on ipanda, foodie, traveling

• Lightening Talk 閃電秀

Title: An (Short) Introduction to Bioconda, UpSetR, and snakemake

Abstract: This short talk will introduce a few interesting on-going R projects and packages in independent sections.  First section covers (Bio)conda, the package management system for both R and Python, where bioconda brings sepecific support for commonly used bioinformatic tools in both languages.  Second section introduces a R package, UpSetR, which implements a novel way to visualize intersections of sets, that is, to visualize how different groups of samples overlap with each other.  If time permits, lastly, an extended makefile-like build system, snakemake, will be demonstrated to construct a parallelized analysis pipeline involving both R and Python scripts.

Speaker: 亮亮 (or liang2), Liang-Bo Wang

亮亮 (or liang2) is a PhD student in Computational and Systems Biology at Washington University in St. Louis (WUSTL) with research interest in cancer genomics. Aside from academics, liang2 attends and speaks in Python and R open source communities, including Taipei.py and MLDM Monday. His recent project is the Chinese translation of the official Python documentation.

name: [Cloud Platform Series] Shiny on Azure
venue_address_1: 台北市大安區光復南路102號11樓
description:
[Agenda]

• 19:15-19:30 R Basic: R軟體小故事、安裝與環境介紹

• 19:30-20:30 主議程: Shiny on Azure @Kristen

• 20:30-20:50 閃電秀: 翻玩空氣盒子--監控空氣品質 @謝欣紘

• 20:50 - 自由交流時間

[Talk Information]

• Shiny apps on Azure

想把做好的圖表分享給其他人? 想要有個互動的網頁來呈現R跑出來的成果?利用Shiny和Azure可以快速的完成喔!這次會先簡單的介紹Shiny和Azure，並會用一個範例帶大家實作。

Do you want to share with others the analytic project you work on? Do you want to build an interactive web page to show the result? With Shiny and Azure, you can make it easily and quickly. This time we will introduce Shiny and Azure first, and then demo with an example.

• 翻玩空氣盒子--監控空氣品質

Location Aware Sensing System (LASS)社群，是由對環境感測有興趣的Makers, Contributors組成。目前主要專注在pm2.5的空氣污染監測。其使用低成本、體積小、高準確度的微型感測器, 達到可大量、高密度部署的目標。去年更結合政府、民間企業和社群力量，推出空氣盒子, 目前於台北市各小學校皆有部點, 下半年更推廣到5都, 希望喚醒群眾對空氣污染議題的關注。將介紹利用其open data目前做到的分析情形。希望越多人加入一起關心空汙的感測。

LASS Community, consisted of makers/contributors interested in environment sensing, focuses on air pollution issues. Last year they started to apply air boxs as micro sensors for pm 2.5. This time we will show the analysis of open data collected by the air boxes. Join us on the air pollution issues.

[Speaker Information]

• Kristen
喜歡學任何新鮮有趣的東西，看到 R Ladies 大家無私地分享很多知識給大家，很期望也能貢獻一點自己學到的東西，並與大家一同成長。

• 謝欣紘
目前任職於研究單位，熱於參加各種社群，從中學習互相交流，喜歡大家下班還能聚在一起學習的感覺，希望能將所學知識和大家分享。

[Host information]

• Lucy
經營企劃人員，帶著熱情加入了R-Ladies，從零程式基礎開始學習並應用R。希望與社群夥伴一起進步^-^

name: [Cloud Platform Series] Azure ML Case
description:
[Agenda]

• 19:15-19:30 R Basic 常用指令1

• 19:30-20:30 主議程: Azure ML  @Ning

• 20:30-20:50 閃電秀: Azure Machine Learning - Feature Engineering @懷文

• 20:50 - 自由交流時間

[Talk Information]

•  Azure ML  
不會寫程式是否也能預測新發單曲是否賣座[Azure及R的教學] 

每張新唱片問世，都需唱片公司投入大量預算，如何能預測單曲是否暢銷變成關鍵。透過MIT/edX Popularity of Music Records課程的資料集，收集了[masked]告示牌排行榜前十大及非前十大單曲，透過Logistic Regression來建立模型。

此次talk嘗試透過Azure讓不會寫程式的人也能建立自己的模型，也分享R + Azure有甚麼好用的小地方。

•Azure Machine Learning - Feature Engineering                   

被喻為是“Data scientist's Secret Sauce!”的Feature Engineering(特徵工程)，到底是有什麼樣的魔力，讓大家對他有這個稱號。

在資料分析和建模當中，要透過什麼方式，把現實生活當中的情境透過feature描述，轉化成model裡面相對應的數值？

如果你心中有些想要透過machine learning解決的問題，也對該問題有一些相對應的domain knowhow，卻不知道應該在哪裡把自己的知識加進去訓練模型的步驟裡，也許你會從這次的分享有一些收穫。

或是你已經嘗試了一些演算法，想知道在Data 跟 Model 之間的轉換到底是有哪些秘方讓自己的模型可以更fit 自己遇到的問題，也許你會從這次的分享帶給你一些新的靈感在你分析的流程上。

[Speaker Information]

• Ning
熱愛作資料解讀及分析，共同創立 TW R Ladies，曾經在網路公司做過分析師．希望能認識更多同好，一起做好玩且不一樣的事情。

• 懷文 
喜歡從資料當中找出一些現象，從中和現實生活當中的問題互動。在一些不同的新創專案當中擔任資料顧問，也是Azure Taiwan社群的共同創辦人，希望和大家多認識，聽聽大家對身邊資料集的不同想像。

[Host information]

昱璇 Dana 

具有研究精神的商業智慧分析人員，用過R、SPSS modeler和Tableau做數據分析，也接觸過各資料庫語法、跨平台資料介接及網頁前台語言。希望跟大家一起交流、成長。

venue_address_1: 台北市大安區光復南路102號11樓

• 20:50 -  自由交流時間


[Talk Information]

•  新聞視覺化

資料新聞及資料視覺化，一般是將各種數據作為新聞或者論述的作證，以表格、圖表，甚至更多元的互動方式，來達到讓讀者更快速、更深入理解議題的效果。這次會介紹國內外精彩的資料新聞案例，也簡單分享我製作中的一些思考。

•  ggplot2 - 如果你願意一層一層一層～的堆疊我的圖

小時候的美術課，老師總說畫圖要能做出「拼貼」的美感才是好圖。本議題將淺談ggplot2 使用圖層層層堆疊出美術老師拼貼的奧義（雖然結果可能看不出有拼貼過。）

•  生醫資料視覺化

[Speaker Information]

•  Claire
目前在電信業擔任商業智慧分析師，之前在 MIT Media Lab 做專案時，接觸並迷上了視覺化，喜歡嘗試各種的方法將資訊化繁為簡。創辦社群知了新聞 Cicadata，大概每兩個月會舉辦一次技術分享的聚會，希望能聚集喜歡資料新聞／視覺化的人們，一起探索其中的可能。

•  盧森
自詡為有志青年，初入社會不久，仍有許多要學習的地方。 R寫了近四年，還是很喜歡透過交流，在各個不同領域的運用中得到許多新知。簡單來說，我是來交朋友的啦～

甚麼是數位人文？我在德國的做的研究是甚麼？如何使用 R 於數位人文的領域上

•  媽，我交了個大象朋友

在這一場分享裡，聖佑試著回顧當初接觸 PHP 程式語言的過程，並透過擬人化的方式將 PHP 的吉祥物「大象」比擬成自己在小時候交的一位朋友。以介紹朋友的方式，期望能在 15 分鐘超短的時間內，讓完全不認識 PHP 這個程式語言的朋友能對它有初步的認識，並能試著開始撰寫自己的第一個 PHP 網頁

•  如何快速尋出有問題的入侵記錄
網站攻防已然是目前資訊安全領域的顯學，但對於一個服務提供者而言，最重要的是忠實的呈現客戶發生了什麼事情，因此在LOG的分析上是一個相當重要的工作，透過各種不同的方法快速的顯示出有問題的記錄，免除了過多的人為主觀，透過分析的過程找出切入點，及真的的根本原因才是最終的目標

[Speaker Information]

• 蔡芸琤(Pecu) 
目前在大學擔任菜鳥老師，負責 CS+X 推廣與教學工作，兩年前有機會到德國某研究中心工作，接觸到了數位人文的研究議題，深深喜歡上文理一家融合的思考方式，大大推翻台灣在高中就將文理組分家的教育方式，因此，想在台灣進行跨領域教育推廣工作，希望能聚集喜歡實踐想法的人們，一起改變世界

•  范聖佑 (Shengyou Fan)

現職為得寬科技研究員、Laravel 傳教士。2013 年在 Facebook 上成立 Laravel 台灣 社團及成立 Laravel 道場 教學站，並與多間學校、企業單位合作舉辦教育訓練工作坊，從此踏上 Laravel 傳教與導入之路。除此之外也在 Github 上發佈數項與 Laravel 開發相關的懶人包與外掛，每個月固定舉辦三場 PHP/Laravel 活動，以實現簡潔優雅開發為夢想。持續關注創新應用、網路技術、印刷出版及甜點烘焙等領域。目前抱著甜點書持續 Full Stack 的旅程！

• 黃建笙

登豐數位科技技術總監，專長為windows安全、web安全及資訊安全事件鑑識，具有CISSP-ISSMP, CEH, CHFI, ECSA, ISO27001LA,BS10012LA等資訊安全相關認證，我就是因為懶所以懂得如何讓工作自動化，也因為懶所以常用各種新的方法來讓工作更有效率，在入侵事件中最重要的一環是log分析，透過各種不同的方法快速的找出有問題的記錄，減少目前的工作負載，讓更多的時間可以用在維護世界和平上。

[Agenda]

[Talk Information]

• 如何以R做為事件蒐集及分析的利器

資訊安全事件層出不窮，在第一線的LOG蒐集即是一件需要大量投入資源的工作，而往後的事件分析及事件追縱是另一個管理問題。單就事件分析及關聯性，R是一個非常好的工具及平台。接承前一次閃電秀中說明的事件發生的始末，本次議程深入的探討如何以R來挖掘入侵事件，進而建置一個屬於自已的事件偵測機制。

• dplyr 介紹

如何迅速將資料調處到理想的樣子在資料進到模型進行分析之前有好長一段路要走，那就是-資料調處。我們將在20分鐘內體驗資料整理的辛酸，體驗資料分析90%的時間所做的事情吧!

•  R-Ladies Taipei Kaggle大賽小小心得分享

你有玩過Kaggle嗎？你想玩Kaggle但來不及參加R-Ladies Taipei 2017 Kaggle 大賽？沒關係！你可以來聽聽這次 R-Ladies Taipei 2017 Kaggle 大賽選定的題目、助教攤常見問題、以及為何參賽者們都需要 Azure 的幫助 ?! 或許聽完後你也會開始挑戰你的第一場Kaggle比賽。

[Speaker Information]

• 方丈
登豐數位科技技術總監，專長為windows安全、web安全及資訊安全事件鑑識，具有CISSP-ISSMP, CEH, CHFI, ECSA, ISO27001LA,BS10012LA等資訊安全相關認證，我就是因為懶所以懂得如何讓工作自動化，也因為懶所以常用各種新的方法來讓工作更有效率，在入侵事件中最重要的一環是log分析，透過各種不同的方法快速的找出有問題的記錄，減少目前的工作負載，讓更多的時間可以用在維護世界和平上。

•  王斯霈
王斯霈勤業眾信聯合會計師事務所風險管理部門數據分析，腦袋想不開從統計系轉到資訊管理所就讀，從此踏上STAT+IT的生活。是個剛出社會的新鮮人，期望能持續朝資料科學家邁進。 

•  Kristen Chan
目前在Wave-In擔任資料科學家，專長是電子商務數據挖掘和電信數據分析。她樂於與 R-Ladies Taipei 的夥伴分享經驗和知識，並希望透過 R-Ladies Taipei 讓更多女性朋友不再害怕 Coding，並了解數據分析其中的奧妙。現在也是 R-Ladies Taipei Officer 之一。現任微軟 MVP 最有價值專家。

description:
# 本活動由國泰金控贊助下午茶

# 本活動由台灣微軟贊助場地

# 本活動報名截止於 8/6, 上限 70 人，免費~
# R-Ladies/ PyLadies/ Girls in Tech 擇一報名就可以囉
# 只限女生報名喔

這是 R-Ladies, Girls in Tech, PyLadies 首次合辦的講座活動，議程將環繞著我們的主題「女力 x 資料科學 x 數據應用」！延續過去每個月的技術講座，除了一樣著重在資料應用案例分享外，這次跨社群的橫向交流也是一大重點。讓我們期待 3 個性質各異的女性社群可以激盪出什麼火花，也期待更多未來的合作！

Agenda

13:30 [社群介紹]
Girls in Tech、R-Ladies、PyLadies

13:45 [女力講座]
女性社群力量@Angie & Yi-chu (Girls in Tech)

14:15 [社群交流時間]

15:15 [下午茶茶歇]

15:30 [資料科學講座]
用 R 玩 Kaggle – 臉書打卡點預測 @Mia (R-Ladies)

16:00 [數據應用講座]
如何用數據打造最貼心的旅遊搜尋引擎@Mars (PyLadies)

16:30
Open Mic/擺攤

Abstract

• 女性社群力量
Angie將分享她如何從商管跨入數據分析領域，在男女比1:5的團隊遇到哪些困難，又從社群看到什麼學到什麼~

• 用Ｒ玩 Kaggle: 預測臉書打卡點
Kaggle是資料科學們最常出沒的線上資料競賽平台，在上面除了有open data 可以使用，也可以透過參加競賽練習自己的能力。這場分享將會快速帶大家用 R 玩Kaggle，挑戰2016年Facebook在網站上公開的資料，預測下一個熱門的打卡點會是在哪裡～學習如何思考問題跟解決問題！

• 如何用數據打造最貼心的旅遊搜尋引擎
旅行是一個非常有趣的議題，背後是由極為複雜資訊所組成的無實體商品，Mars 將分享平常在工作中，會搜集哪些數據，以及如何進行推薦，讓用戶跳脫只能比價的框架，能在Tripresso團體旅遊搜尋引擎找到最適合他們的旅程～

Speaker Information

• Angie
企業策略部門的商業數據分析師，經濟及企管背景出身，在公司內部以資料分析挖掘問題，並推行如流程改善等解決方案。喜歡參與社群活動與各領域朋友們交流經驗，學習從不同的角度看世界。

• Yi-Chu Chen
現職是鹿羊科技的專案經理，算是一個什麼都需要做一點的工程師，在大學唸電子工程，研究所唸影像處理和機器學習，不過畢業當時，還沒有相關需求的職缺，就進入網路業，開始不斷學習的過程（不斷轉換語言跟框架），最喜歡網路將大家連在一起的特性，平常除了學習新技術外，也喜歡和來自不同背景的人溝通，希望能讓大家使用科技的門檻降低。

• Mia
現於Linker Networks擔任資料科學家，過去擔任過資料分析顧問，透過演算法以及機器學習去解決生活中/商業中會遇到的問題。曾於R-Ladies 柏林、里斯本跟台北做社群分享，現在也是R-Ladies Taipei以及Azure Taiwan Community的核心成員。

• Mars Weng
現任職於 Tripresso，擔任資料工程師，工作內容是旅行資料的爬蟲抓取與資料清理，以及規劃各種可能的資料整合應用。解決問題是 Mars 的核心精神，不只寫程式可以達到這個目的，培養夥伴學習程式也是一個很好的解答，目前擔任 PyLadies Hosts之一，負責帶領初探Python或是對網路爬蟲有興趣的人。

description:
1. Agenda

• 19:15-19:30 R Basic: 給初心者的統計概念與小故事

• 19:30-20:30 主議程: Word cloud in R @莊舒媛

• 20:30-20:50 閃電秀: 從外國語言到程式語言 @Pei Lee

• 20:50 - 自由交流時間

2. Talk Information

• Word cloud in R

在R軟體裡先做分詞處理，最後將結果儲存到資料庫中。在分詞處理上我們使用Rwordseg、jiebaR做分詞，依據分詞後的結果計算出頻率即可繪製文字雲。

• 從外國語言到程式語言

先分享一個免費的資料來源：全世界最大的社會事件開放資料庫 GDELT，以及實際應用。再來談談用外國語言工作一陣子後，改以程式語言安身立命的歷程：怎麼會從日文系跑去當數據分析師？

3. Speaker Information

• 莊舒媛

目前是國立臺北商業大學 研究生，在學生時期透過R軟體進行購物籃分析、關聯規則分析、網路爬蟲、LDA分析與類神經網路預測等研究。

• Pei Lee

大學主修日文跟廣告企劃，指考數學不及格，沒修過統計學，在傳產做過兩年日韓線採購，現在在當自己說出來都會心虛的數據分析師。剛過試用期不久，過著每天寫程式的生活，目前比較熟悉的語言是中文、日文、英文跟Python。

4. Host information

• Kristen Chan

description:

2. Talk Information

• 如何用數據打造最貼心的旅遊搜尋引擎  
旅行是一個非常有趣的議題，背後是由極為複雜資訊所組成的無實體商品， Mars 將分享平常在工作中，會搜集哪些數據，以及如何進行推薦， 讓用戶跳脫只能比價的框架，能在Tripresso 團體旅遊搜尋引擎找到最適合他們的旅程～

• Microsoft Azure Cognitive Services
Microsoft Azure Cognitive Services 是一套集結合微軟研究成果的辨識 API，涵蓋內容十分廣泛，包含了表情與情緒偵測、視覺與語音辨識、語言理解、知識與搜尋等等，即使不懂 Machine Learning 也可以藉由輸入短短幾行程式碼，就建置出強大演算法的應用程式。 本次將介紹情緒偵測、視覺的部分，15 分鐘讓大家可以快速學會如何使用 Cognitive Service！

• 用 power BI 探索資料
懶得看密密麻麻的資料分布統計表格嗎？畫圖就對了！圖表可是速速看懂資料分布的超棒工具呢，要知道，畫圖治百病！（才怪）這次一起用 Power BI 來探索手上的資料吧！

3. Speaker Information

• Mars Weng 
現任職於 Tripresso，擔任資料工程師，工作內容是旅行資料的爬蟲抓取與資料清理，以及規劃各種可能的資料整合應用。解決問題是 Mars 的核心精神，不只寫程式可以達到這個目的，培養夥伴學習程式也是一個很好的解答，目前擔任 PyLadies Hosts 之一，負責帶領初探 Python 或是對網路爬蟲有興趣的人。

• 姿君
Beseye工程師，PyLadies 負責人之一，在公司負責影像處理與 Android 開發的部分，熱愛電腦科學，期待能夠跟大家一起追求神乎其技！

• Claire
知了新聞共同創辦人，〈互動地圖：雙北所得大解密〉作者。曾任 MIT Media Lab Changing Places Group 研究助理。沒有女朋友的少女心大叔魂死肥宅。意外的（？）pH值極低。最近喜歡乃木坂 46 的生田繪梨花跟 D3.js。夢想是減少這個世界上的資訊不對稱。

19:15~19:30 R basic: 遺漏值填補(Michelle)，資料型態轉換(Pepper)

19:30-20:15 如何打場黑客松@Luffy

2. Talk Information

• 如何打場黑客松-跨國OpenData的取得及使用

分享參加黑客松比賽的經驗，如何從題目發想到做出prototype可以demo，以及分享自己跨領域學程式的經驗。

• 透明足跡介紹-環保相關OpenData

「透明足跡」是一個追蹤企業污染數據與環境表現的專案，這個網站是專案中的一個工具，透過視覺化系統，使艱澀的數據更好理解，讓全民都有機會掌握環境問題，並參與監督、檢舉，找出真正的環境兇手。

https://www.zeczec.com/projects/thaubing

• 用人話寫程式的活文件

現代軟體開發講究從需求、測試、開發、文件一氣呵成，其中包含：
該怎麼將需求實例化的過程，用人話的方式描述出來該怎麼從人話來設計驗收測試該怎麼從測試來驅動開發該怎麼將人話變成活文件

四件事就是同一件事
確保沒有浪費絲毫力氣在跟需求不相干的事物上確保開發前對驗收方式的理解有共識確保隨著軟體產品功能越來越多，花費在測試的時間與成本能趨於固定

3. Speaker Information

• Luffy
背景是台大經濟所，學習程式一年，主要使用Ｒ語言，參加過三次黑客松，今年七月參加的台大黑客松，團隊獲得第三名。

• Joey
Joey，大家都叫我 91，是 TDD 的狂熱者，將敏捷精神融入到自己的生活與人生。目前在 Odd-e 擔任敏捷教練，也是台灣團隊的負責人。參加過我 TDD 培訓課程的學員已超過 500 位，也有成功協助許多開發團隊引入敏捷開發的經驗，將自己定位在催化劑的角色，擅長讓團隊無痛有感的改善痛點，優化軟體設計及各角色之間協同合作的流程。

4.Code of Conduct
基本上這是一個女性學習社群，因此若你不是女性，但出現在我們的實體聚會的話，你很可能被要求以下行為：

• 發言的機會請優先留給女生

• 座位請優先保留給女生

• 必須對 R-Ladies Taipei 有貢獻，例如：提供高品質的 3分鐘技術閃電秀

name: [語意分析] 語意角色標註(semantic role labeling)
venue_address_1: 台北市大安區光復南路102號11樓
description:
Agenda 

• 19:00-19:30 暖身活動: R Basic 

• 19:30-20:30 主議程: 語意角色標註(semantic role labeling) @Hao-Wei Her

• 20:30-20:50 閃電秀:  AIDS 年會分享 @PeiLee

• 20:50-21:10 閃電秀: Azure ML 與 Excel 搭配術 @Felaray 

• 21:10 -   自由交流時間

Talk Information

• 語意角色標註(semantic role labeling)
去年曾經在R ladies介紹過自然語言的語法套件、實作。今年要跟大家分享的主題是語意角色標註(semantic role labeling)的基礎概念、常用用來預測語意角色的數據格式介紹、語意與語法的不同之處等等。研究語意角色已經有一年多，希望能和大家分享這一年的心得。

• AIDS 年會分享
分享 2017 年人工智慧年會及資料科學年會中個人覺得有趣的部分，分別為：資料視覺化、爬蟲以及聊天機器人，共會提及八場演講的部分內容。只會簡單介紹每場演講在做的東西，點到為止，不會涉及技術部分，希望大家也會覺得有趣 ❤️

• Azure ML 與 Excel 搭配術
資料處理向來就不是新鮮的議題。不論是以往的資料探勘、或是大數據至機器學習，資料所呈現的智慧往往被視為人們處理各種事物的瑰寶。
Excel作為一款老牌的數據處理工具，如何透過Azure Machine Learning在現今潮流下站穩一席之地呢? 

Speaker Information

• Hao-Wei Her
大家好，我是Hao-Wei，在語意理解的實驗室工作，研發工程師一枚。

• PeiLee
資料分析師，大學主修日文跟廣告。比平日上班再早起一小時，連去了四天的年會，回來後在 Medium 寫了一萬多字的筆記加心得，把功德做好做滿，成為老闆心中最柔軟的那一塊。

• Felaray 
微軟2017 Office MVP,遊走於Azure/SharePoint等領域,喜歡嘗試使用非典型方法接觸各種新鮮技術.近年來較熱衷於ChatBot與Cortana的開發.

[Code of Conduct]
基本上這是一個女性學習社群，因此若你不是女性，但出現在我們的實體聚會的話，你很可能被要求以下行為：

• 發言的機會請優先留給女生

• 座位請優先保留給女生

• 必須對 R-Ladies Taipei 有貢獻，例如：提供高品質的 3分鐘技術閃電秀

[Note] 
這次其中一位講師會介紹一個已經包好的github來給大家玩，歡迎大家帶電腦一起來玩喔！

name: [Visualization Series]地理圖形類特殊檔案
venue_address_1: 台北市大安區光復南路102號11樓
description:
[Agenda]
• 19:15-19:30 暖身活動: R Basic (1)數據抽樣 @宜柔 (2)集成學習 @昱璇(Dana)&紹婷(Angie)
• 19:30-20:30 主議程: 地理圖形類特殊檔案 @謝包妹
• 20:30-20:50 閃電秀: 如何花5分鐘完成一個Line bot (Line對談機器人) @David
• 20:50-21:10 閃電秀: 學習R和又學習python如何上手 @Elias Chiu
• 21:10 - 自由交流時間

[Talk Information]
• 地理圖形類特殊檔案
因為平常氣象資料需要地圖展示，今天與大家分享，不用學D3.js程式，也能用R變出美美的台灣地理圖資，瞭解地理圖形特殊檔案shapefile怎麼用？讓你善用資料視覺化迅速說服老闆。

• 如何花5分鐘完成一個Line bot (Line對談機器人)
1.如何快速開發Line bot
2.整合NLP與自然語言對談
3.使用LUIS與QnA Services
4.關於Azure識別服務(Cognitive Services)

• 學習R和又學習python如何上手
因大數據的崛起，現今許多人開始學習各種資料處理的程式語言，像是今日與大家分享的R和Python等各種語言，而今日要來跟大家分享如何上手這兩種不同的語言，讓我們來懷抱這兩種強大的語言吧！

[Speaker Information]
• 謝包妹Jolin
現職於天氣風險公司，擔任資料分析師和天氣分析師，同時也是Yahoo一分鐘報氣象的主播，過去背景是大氣科出生，從完全不會寫程式，到現在使用R語言快3年，工作上負責資料清理及資料整合應用，讓同事和老闆秒懂資料。

• David
David打從 20 多年前 Apple II 時代起即投入程式設計領域，在資訊業界各領域均多有參與。2002年起加入資訊書籍寫作並投身教育訓練與顧問服務行列，在台灣與大陸均有多本著作出版。2006年至今，榮獲超過十次微軟最有價值專家(MVP)，並屢次受邀擔任微軟歷年TechED大型研討會講師。近年來浸研於Microsoft Azure 、DevOps、Chat bot對談機器人與人工智慧等領域。

• Elias Chiu
嗨大家好，我是Elias，目前在國立臺北商業大學資訊與決策研究所唸書，一名菜鳥研究生。

[Host Information]
• 紹婷Angie
電信業Business Data Analyst，經濟及企管背景出身，熱愛從資料中挖掘問題並解決問題。

name: [Special Case Series] 資料與新聞
venue_name: 資策會數位教育研究所 3樓
venue_address_1: 台北市大安區信義路三段153號
description:
[Agenda]
• 19:30-20:30 主議程: 資料與新聞 @HC
• 20:30-20:50 閃電秀: 非開發人員也會快速建立Web服務 - 使用Azure Function @Kyle
• 20:50 - 自由交流時間

[Talk Information]
• 資料與新聞
(1) 資料新聞是什麼
(2) 怎麼把資料應用在新聞上
(3) 資料耙梳與分析

資料視覺化與資料新聞是進來還算熱門的議題
透過資料來描繪更具體的新聞
但是資料的取得困難
政府的開放資料也不足
在這樣的情況下怎麼進行資料新聞呢？

• 非開發人員也會快速建立Web服務 - 使用Azure Function
Azure Function是一個(Serverless)技術，當有需要架設Web服務的需求，透過Azure Function幾乎不需要耗費心力去理解所需的環境設定，只要專心寫好自己的應用程式，即可上傳到雲端執行，本次將分享此服務的應用的情境，提供一個實務上參考。

[Speaker Information]
• HC

name: [Data Science Series] 當Julia遇上資料科學
venue_address_1: 台北市大安區光復南路102號11樓
description:
[Agenda]
• 19:30 ~ 20:30 (60 mins) 主議程: 當Julia遇上資料科學 @杜岳華
• 20:30 ~ 20:50 (20 mins) 閃電秀: Facebook Fake News Effect @Judy Liou
• 20:50 ~ 自由交流時間

[Talk Information]
• 當Julia遇上資料科學
Julia是個新興的數值與科學計算程式語言，比起常用的Python、R或MATLAB，他有像C一般的執行速度，也有像Python動態語言般的簡潔語法，這使得他成為科學運算以及資料科學領域相當適合的工具。想知道為什麼要用 Julia嗎? 想知道Julia的特色在哪裡? 想知道 Julia的社群能量嗎? 讓我們一起來探索Julia這個語言吧! 一起來看看Julia碰上資料科學會擦出怎樣的火花。

• Facebook Fake News Effect
使用Facebook於2016美國總統大選期間，相關粉絲專頁的用戶行為資料，透過計量經濟學與機器學習的分析方式，探討假新聞對於意識形態的影響。

[Speaker Information]
• 杜岳華
目前在台中疾病管制署擔任研發替代役，陽明大學生物醫學資訊所碩士畢業，大學為成功大學醫學檢驗生物技術學系及資訊工程學系雙主修，喜歡程式語言、軟體架構及資料分析，認為生物體如同程式一樣的運作著，就一頭鑽進了基因調控網路的研究當中，專業為系統生物學及計算生物學，希望成為生醫資料科學家。

• Judy Liou
經濟系學生，目前擔任台大行為與資料科學中心研究助理及Graphen Data Science Intern，曾接觸社群、零售、港口運籌、中文對答系統等專案，準備申請資料科學相關碩士中。

• 公投資料視覺化與選舉分析 @Claire Tsao
https://rfrd-tw.github.io/ 是我和朋友們合作，在今年 11/24 公投之後推出的公投得票概況網站，包含了十個公投案，在各鄉鎮市區的得票狀況，以及對照各區人口統計數值的分布。這次想跟大家聊聊，我們準備過程中，針對資料如何呈現的討論，對資料初步探索的結果，以及後續可能的研究方向。（大家有興趣的話，跟我們一起玩！）也聊聊市面上的選舉分析，常見的初統等級錯誤，比如區位謬誤，而目前學界提出了哪些方法解決、如何使用 R 來處理這些問題。

name: [GIS Series] 政府開放資料與地理資訊系統的串連應用 & 數位治理
description:
[地點] 社會創新實驗中心 (A-3教室)

[Agenda]
• 19:30 ~ 20:00 (30 mins) 閃電秀: 政府開放資料與地理資訊系統的串連應用 @蔡咏諭
• 20:00 ~ 20:20 (30 mins) 閃電秀: 數位國情調查資料庫的簡介與應用 @黃宗賢
• 20:50 ~ 自由交流時間

[Talk Information]
• 政府開放資料與地理資訊系統的串連應用 @蔡咏諭
分享使用臺北市的Taipei-Free熱點資料、各民間商家免費的熱點資訊以及各類政府公開資訊，應用地理資訊系統（GIS）進行分析的經驗。
事實上，我只是R的初學者，在處理這個議題時，都不是透過R進行。因此主要分享自己在使用這些資料時發現哪些有趣的議題或是值得進一步探討的方向，以及在資料使用上遇到的限制，希望能與大家交流討論。

• 數位國情調查資料庫的簡介與應用 @黃宗賢
針對臺灣電子治理研究中心2013～2017中所蒐集的調查資料進行運用，並分享數位治理當中幾個有趣的研究議題與值得關注的現象

[Speaker Information]
• 蔡咏諭
目前是政治大學公共行政學系的碩士生。對於資料處理與分析有莫名的熱情，因緣機會下接觸過許多不同的資料，包含研究調查、政府公開資訊、稅務行政資料，還有政府、公司與學校的會計財報資料等，喜歡串聯不同資料進行分析與應用。

• 黃宗賢
很擔心過年期間被詢問論文進度的政治大學公共行政所碩士生。
曾上山下海地進行勞力密集的調查研究工作，因此對於調查資料的運用與視覺化特別好奇。碩士班開始接觸R，有一段時間對於網頁爬蟲與文字探勘很感興趣，有空的時候喜歡畫好看但實際用途不明的圖。

name: [Special Series] 資料新聞 & 電信資料
description:
[Special Series] 資料新聞 & 電信資料

[地點] 社會創新實驗中心 (教室待定)

[Agenda]
• 19:30 ~ 20:20 (50 mins) 閃電秀: 資料新聞中的資料與新聞 @簡信昌 @李又如
• 20:20 ~ 21:10 (50 mins) 閃電秀: 在電信業做Data Science 的日常 @Kevin
• 21:10 ~ 自由交流時間

[Talk Information]
• 資料新聞中的資料與新聞 @簡信昌 @李又如
資料新聞近幾年在國外新聞媒體圈越來越受到重視，主要在於資料數位化的普及，以及電腦對於資料處理的能力越來越強。而且資料新聞的報導方向，可以作為新聞事件中整體環境的描述，盡量避免以偏概全的情況。不過，資料的來源可信度以及正確性都有可能影響新聞的內容，加上目前資料新聞的資料來源都是政府單位，如何驗證，是目前的一大挑戰。因此資料新聞要討論的不單單只是怎麼透過資料來完成新聞，也要探討資料的取得，清理跟統計分析

• 在電信業做Data Science 的日常 @Kevin
近來資料科學家、AI等buzzword喊的震天價響，但實際工作上資料科學(DS)是怎麼運作的，國內實際案例卻較為少見，我會以自身在電信業大數據部門兩年的體驗，說明團隊從初步階段到穩定成長及人員的組成，還有工作上日常運作與代表性專案，最後是未來可能出現的瓶頸，以及常見的職涯規劃。

[Speaker Information]
• 簡信昌，曾任台灣 Yahoo 工程師，「報導者」技術長，現任鏡傳媒技術長。2014 年加入新聞媒體後，開始嘗試結合技術與新聞，製作互動及數據新聞專題。2018 年開始另一個新聞媒體實驗—「READr」。

• 李又如，曾任新新聞周刊記者，2017 年開始跟工程師和設計師一起做新聞。作品曾獲亞洲卓越新聞獎（SOPA）、華文永續報導獎。

• Kevin
我是Kevin，在電信業做了兩年的資料分析，歷經用戶流失模型、離線推薦模型的完整流程，此外，資料處理(ETL)、爬蟲與視覺化等日常作業也沒少碰。從團隊的初期，到歷經不同主管的領導下，逐漸體會到技術作為業務上的輔佐，要時時刻刻注意分析的 「價值」，才能累積團隊的credit，有更大的影響力。平時會將一些ML、DL、NLP等學習心得放在medium(https://medium.com/@chungyizhen)。

[Host Information]
• Kristen Chan： 聯絡講者、活動場地
• Pei Lee： 活動主持人、聯絡講者、活動場地
• Ning Chen： 聯絡講者

name: R-Ladies Taipei x CNTUG Kubeflow 對於機器學習平台的願景 | R Basic 讀書會分享
venue_name: digiBlock Taipei台北數位產業園區
description:
[地點] DigiBlock C棟 (台北市大同區承德路三段287號C棟)
捷運圓山站2號出口步行約5分鐘

[Agenda]
• 19:30 ~ 20:30 (60 mins) 主議程: Kubeflow 對於機器學習平台的願景 @林義洋(@yylin1)
• 20:30 ~ 21:10 (40 mins) 閃電秀: R Basic 讀書會分享 - 實用的資料視覺化小技巧 @Lulu Kuo
• 21:10 ~ 自由交流時間

[Talk Information]
• Kubeflow 對於機器學習平台的願景 @林義洋(@yylin1)
Kubeflow 是由 Google 與相關公司共同發起的開源專案，其目標是利用 Kubernetes 容器平台上來簡化運維機器學習環境建置與工作負載的流程，使之更簡單、可攜帶性與擴展，並提供一套標準的雲原生 (Cloud Native) 機器學習解決方案，以幫助資料科學家在工作流中實現一套流水線。這次的分享將會透過實際應用案例與分享機器學習平台與相關組件所帶來的幫助，並且介紹 kubeflow 的基本概念與願景。

• R Basic 讀書會分享 - 實用的資料視覺化小技巧
@ Lulu Kuo

[Speaker Information]
• 林義洋(@yylin1)
目前在長庚AI中心兼任實習，並與碩論奮鬥中的研究生。由於實驗室GPU主機需要有效利用環境資源而接觸容器與分散式管理平台kubernetes，當時機器學習平台崛起，而接觸到 kubeflow 開源專案，現階段正進行研究深度學習進行分散式作業排程，並致力於推廣kubeflow平台與分享學習經驗。

• Lulu Kuo
現任於市場調查公司的資料處理部門, 主要將問卷資料統整成報表並以SPSS做統計分析 / 大學統計系畢業, 現任工作沒有用到很多R所以另覓新歡想在R Ladies精進學習, 第一次參加讀書會, 還在摸索中, 有任何建議請不吝指教!

name: [Data Series] 從網路封包看待資料科學的應用 | R Basic 讀書會分享
venue_name: digiBlock Taipei台北數位產業園區
description:
[Agenda]
• 19:30 ~ 20:30 (60 mins) 主議程: 從網路封包看待資料科學的應用 @邱宏瑋(@Hwchiu)
• 20:30 ~ 20:50 (20 mins) 閃電秀: R Basic 讀書會分享 - 關聯規則 @Angie Hsu
• 21:10 ~ 自由交流時間

[Talk Information]
• 從網路封包看待資料科學的應用
在網路封包的世界中，資料科學與分析能夠做到什麼樣的地步? 會從基本的網路概念介紹起，最後搭配一些分析的應用介紹

• R Basic 讀書會分享- 關聯規則的應用
談到關聯規則，大家很常聽到的都市傳說-啤酒與尿布就是一例，是個很容易理解分析邏輯的一種資料探勘方法，但然後呢?可以怎麼樣應用呢?
這次閃電秀將分享:
1. 關聯規則的演算法與R套件
2. 案例分享
3. 關聯規則限制與優勢

[Speaker Information]
• 邱宏瑋(Hwchiu)
• MST @ Open Networking Foundation (ONF)
• Linux/Network/Container/Kubernetes/Golang/DevOps

name: [ML Series] 平行化計算在電信資料的應用
venue_name: digiBlock Taipei台北數位產業園區

• 20:30 ~ 自由交流時間

[Talk Information]
• 平行化計算在電信資料的應用
將簡介幾種平行化方法，介紹在緬甸與台灣電信業的工作實例。行銷大數據注重的是與客戶的關係，但在基地台供應商下，著重的卻是利用基地台資料，給予客戶建站建議。R可以快速的幫助我解決遇到的問題，將分享R哪些套件幫助我從整理資料、分析建模甚至利用平行化運算結合電信知識幫助我在不同的團隊說服不同的人。

[Speaker Information]
• Jack Tsai
目前在軟體公司擔任資料科學家(資料分析師)，同時也是淡江統計的兼任講師，曾在台灣電信業與緬甸電信產業擔任資料分析師，很常在網路資料社群中潛水，最近被學姊出賣，短時間浮出水面兩次XD

name: [Special Series] R在野生動物族群估算方面的應用
venue_name: digiBlock Taipei台北數位產業園區
description:
[Agenda]
• 19:30 ~ 20:30 (60 mins) 主議程: R在野生動物族群估算方面的應用 @Trica
• 20:30 ~ 21:00 (30 mins) 閃電秀: Scrum 中毒者的經驗分享 @Tony Yang
• 21:00 ~ 自由交流時間

[Talk Information]
• R在野生動物族群估算方面的應用
動物族群量是野生動物與棲地經營管理不可或缺的基礎資訊，也是生態研究的重要依據。族群估算的方法從1930年代起演進至今，是許多生態學家與統計學家合作無間的成果，從21世紀初期，R在此領域方法學的提升扮演不可或缺的角色，講者將從R coding的視角分享族群估算方法的演進以及常應用的模型，主要以北美常見中小型哺乳動物的資料為例(ex. 白尾鹿、北美負子鼠、浣熊及一些萌鼠輩朋友們.....)。

• Scrum 中毒者的經驗分享

[Speaker Information]
• Trica
生態研究出身，長達十多年的山林野人經驗，因緣際會在coding的過程對統計及資料科學產生更大了的熱忱，毅然決然出山(誤!)，走出象牙塔，幸好筋很軟一腳跨進業界，現為某新創科技公司的資料科學家。

• Tony Yang
叡揚資訊雲端與巨資事業群 處長

name: [AI Series] 如何利用開源程式碼進行圖片去背
description:
[Agenda]
• 19:30 ~ 20:30 (60 mins) 主議程: 如何利用開源程式碼進行圖片去背 @蕭聖哲
• 20:30 ~ 自由交流時間

[Talk Information]
• 如何利用開源程式碼進行圖片去背
從小到大多少會用到圖片去背的功能，可能在做簡報的時候，點一下「設定透明色彩」。稍微複雜的圖像，可利用photoshop的「魔術棒工具」或「套索工具」，人工選取標的物，將背景去除，但即使是嫻熟的人可能仍需10分鐘尚能完成一張圖片的去背作業，如果只有一張圖片可能還好吧，倘若有百張圖片要進行去背的時候呢？
近年來隨著深度學習網絡的發展，影像的處理模式從「工人智慧」逐漸轉變為「人工智慧」。但何謂深度學習？打開維基百科中文版，相信很多人跟我一樣，即使都是中文，但......。所以本次的分享，並不會去探討各種深度學習網路的差異及建置的過程，而是如何透過網路上善心人士的開源程式碼，利用已經訓練好的模型，加以應用，來完成「AI」去背。

[Speaker Information]
• 蕭聖哲
畢業於國立台灣大學森林系。因工作緣故對於資料爬蟲、清理、建模與視覺化的呈現頗有心得。最近因參與AIGO計畫，開始研究如何利用AI進行自動化去背。

name: Launch Event R-Ladies Lisbon
description:
NEW EVENT DATE - Terça-feira, 13.Dezembro

We’re ready to announce our first event! This meeting will be to show you what R-Ladies project is all about and why we’re so passionate about R.

To better understand our members’ skill levels and interests, we’ve created a short survey. Please fill it out, even if you cannot attend the meeting, so we can meet your expectations.

_________________________________________________________________

NOVA DATA - Tuesday, 13.Dezembro 

Estamos prontos para anunciar o nosso primeiro evento! Este primeiro encontro servirá para dar a conhecer o projeto R-Ladies e o porquê de sermos tão apaixonadas por R.

Para melhor entendermos as capacidades e interesses dos nossos membros, criámos este pequeno questionário. É importante que o preenchas, mesmo que não possas estar presente nesta primeira data, para podermos ir de encontro às vossas expectativas.

name: Workshop de Visualização de Dados
description:
Vamos reunir-nos para um workshop de visualização de dados! 

Temos o prazer de anunciar a Elizabeth Cruz como R-Lady que irá dinamizar o Workshop de Visualização de dados com ggplot2.

A inscrição é gratuita, mas existe número limitado de participantes. Adquira o bilhete no Eventbrite.

Este workshop será bastante interactivo, dando a possibilidade de aprender ou relembrar conceitos básicos de R e "meter a mão na massa" para produzir gráficos e outras visualizações de dados.

Pedimos a cada participante que leve um computador portátil, com a versão mais recente do R e RStudio Desktop instalada. Instruções de instalação pré-workshop <a>aqui</a>. 

Mais uma vez, para irmos de encontro às vossas expectativas, agradecemos que preencham este pequeno formulário.

No Google Groups</a> já está disponível um tópico para sugestão de temas/dúvidas a serem discutidos neste ou em futuros workshops.

Programa:

9h - Recepção - Boas vindas
9h30 -  Iniciar R-Studio - Breve explicação
9h45 - Introdução à visualização de dados 
10h10 - Exercícios
11h - 11h20 - Cafézinho e Comida! 
11h20 - Exercícios 
12h00 - Apresentação de cada grupo (1-2 mins cada)
12h30 - Finalização do workshop e anunciar eventos futuros 

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

WORKSHOP - DATA VISUALIZATION

Lets all gather in a new R-Ladies Lisbon Workshop!

We are pleased to announce Elizabeth Cruz as the R-Lady that is going to held the Data Visualization Workshop with ggplot2.

This is a free event, but you need to get your ticket on <a href="https://www.eventbrite.pt/e/bilhetes-r-ladies-lisboa-workshop-de-visualizacao-de-dados-30886584606">Eventbrite. 

In this event we will have several interactive exercises, where you can learn or refresh R basic concepts and have a hands on programming to produce graphics and other types of data visualization. 

Each participant must take a laptop and have the most recent version of RStudio Desktop installed.

Please find on Google Groups</a> a discussion topic for suggestions and FAQ to be addressed in these or in future workshops.<a href="https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/r-ladies-lisboa">

name: Linguagem R para Iniciados
description:
Convidamo-vos para uma sessão prática para iniciados em R. Se quer aprender R ou consolidar as suas bases de R, esta sessão é para si!

Trata-se de um evento informal em que os participantes terão a oportunidade de aprender R em pequenos grupos, metendo as mãos na massa e interagindo com outros participantes.

Na sala estarão presentes Mentores que irão orientar e ajudar cada grupo de participantes durante a sessão. Se estiver interessado em ser Mentor, por favor inscreva-se aqui.

A inscrição é gratuita, mas existe número limitado de participantes. Adquira o seu bilhete no Eventbrite.

Pedimos mais uma vez a cada participante que leve um computador portátil, com a versão mais recente do R (para Windows ou para Mac OS) e RStudio Desktop instaladas. Instruções de instalação aqui. 

Programa:

9h - Recepção e Boas vindas

9h30 - Breve iniciação ao R Studio

9h40 - Introdução ao R

10h30 - Exercícios

11h - 11h20 - Coffee Break

11h20 - Exercícios

12h30 - Finalização da Sessão

---------------------------------------------------------------------------

R FOR BEGINNERS.

We invite you for a practical session for R beginners. If you want to learn R ou you want to consolidate your foundations of R, this session is for you!

The session is an informal event where you will have the opportunity to learn R within small groups, get your hands dirty and interact with other participants.

Mentors will be in the room all the time, and they will guide and help each group of participants. If you want to be a Mentor, please sign-up here.

The session if free but you must get your ticket at Eventbrite, as there is a limited number of participants.

Each participant must take a laptop, with the most recent version of R (for Windows or Mac OS) and RStudio Desktop installed. The installation instruction are here.

Program:

9h - Welcoming Reception

9h30 - Quick R Studio Initiation

9h40 - Introduction to R

10h30 - Exercises

11h - 11h20 - Coffee Break

11h20 - Exercises

12h30 - Ending of Session

name: Real-life examples of R & Machine Learning
description:
Come along for our 5th event! 

During this event we will share with you real-life stories of people working with Data Analysis and Machine Learning on a daily basis. 

We are pleased to introduce our special guest and keynote speaker, Mia Chang. Mia is one of the members of the group R-Ladies Taipei (Taiwan), and one of the organizers of Azure Taiwan Community and works as data consultant with various startup projects.  Her specialty fields are building analytics systems and models based on the issues reported by clients. She also provides B2B and B2C clients with training on Azure Machine Learning, Power BI, ETL and data visualisation with R. She will talk about data working processes and provide a demonstration on how to combine Azure Machine Learning with R. 

Event Program

9h15: R-Ladies Lisboa: Welcome everyone!

9h40: Meeting R in Azure Machine Learning - Mia Chang (R-Ladies Taipei)

10h30-11h: Coffee-break

11h: R & Machine Learning - Anny Muniz

11h30: Thinking as a "Data Scientist" - Saghir Bashir

12h: Networking

RSVP for free registration on this event. 

Join us! :)

***(a portuguese version follows)

Durante este evento queremos partilhar convosco histórias reais de pessoas que trabalham na área de Análise de Dados e Machine Learning. Temos o prazer de anunciar a nossa convidada especial Mia Chang.

A Mia pertence à organização do grupo R-Ladies da cidade de Taipei (Taiwan) e é uma das organizadoras da comunidade Azure Taiwan. Atualmente trabalha como consultora de dados em vários projetos de startups. Dedica-se à elaboração de sistemas analíticos e modelos baseados em questões reportadas pelos clientes. Fornece treino a clientes B2B e B2C, nas áreas relacionadas com Azure machine Learning, Power BI, ETL e visualização de dados em R. Irá comunicar sobre processos de trabalho com dados e fazer uma demonstração sobre como combinar o Azure Machine Learning com a linguagem R.

Programa do Evento

9h15: R-Ladies Lisboa: Bem-vindos!

9h40: Meeting R in Azure Machine Learning - Mia Chang (R-Ladies Taipei)

10h30-11h: Intervalo

11h: R & Machine Learning - Anny Muniz

11h30: Thinking as a "Data Scientist" - Saghir Bashir

12h: Networking

O registo é gratuito e deve ser feito através da opção RSVP do meetup.

Aviso: Informamos que este evento será dinamizado em inglês, dado termos dois convidados que não falam português. Esperamos ver-vos em breve! :)

name: Tidying data with R
description:
Presenter: Saghir Bashir

Languages:

Presentations: English

Facilitators: Portuguese and English

Valid REGISTRATIONS only on meetup!

Data usually arrives in a “messy” state requiring tidying. This workshop will teach you to organise and structure data in a consistent way for analysis and visualisation. The main focus will be on the dplyr and tidyr packages from the tidyverse (see <a>www.tidyverse.org).</a> The topics covered will include: creating new variables, re-ordering observations, selecting observations/variables, summarising data and restructuring data.

The workshop format will give participants the maximum time to practice R programming. Concepts, ideas and motivation will be presented in the simplest possible way before each exercise. Participants will be strongly encouraged to discuss and work together on the course exercises.

Prerequisites: Laptop with the latest version of R (https://cran.r-project.org), Rstudio (https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/) and the tidyverse package.

Target Audience: This is a beginner level course aimed at anyone who works with data or has to handle/process data (e.g. using spreadsheets).

Bio: Saghir Bashir is a statistician and founder of ilustat. He is a long time R (S) user with extensive experience in analysing various types of data.

Find us on twitter, facebook and Linkedin. Valid REGISTRATIONS only on MEETUP!

********************************************************************

Segue versão em português:

Vamos arrumar e organizar dados? :)

É comum depararmo-nos com dados que estão “desorganizados” e que precisam de ser tratados e organizados (tidying). Este workshop irá ajudar-vos a organizar e a estruturar os dados de forma consistente, para análise e visualização dos mesmos. O foco principal serão os packages dplyr e tidyr (package tidyverse, www.tidyverse.org). Serão incluídos os seguintes tópicos: criação de novas variáveis, re-ordenação de observações, selecção de observações/variáveis, análise descritiva simples e re-estruturação dos dados.  

Este workshop dará o máximo de tempo aos participantes para praticarem programação em R. Todos os conceitos, ideias e objetivos serão apresentados da forma mais simples possível antes de cada exercício. Os participantes serão bastante encorajados a comunicar e trabalhar juntos nos exercícios propostos.

Pré-requisitos: Computador portátil com a versão mais recente do R (https://cran.r-project.org), Rstudio (https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/)  e o package tidyverse instalado.

Público-alvo: Este curso é para iniciados em R e destinado a todos os que trabalham com dados ou têm que processar dados (p.e. folhas de cálculo)

Sobre o formador: O Saghir Bashir é estatistico e fundador da ilustat. Usa a linguagem R há algum tempo e tem uma vasta experiência em análise de vários tipos de dados.

INSCRIÇÕES são apenas válidas no MEETUP!

name: The Path to Data Science
venue_address_1: Rua do Fogo de Santelmo, Lote 2.07.02 1990 – 110 Lisboa (junto ao Oceanário)
description:
(English message follows)

Estamos de volta para uma nova temporada de eventos R-Ladies! Regressamos cheias de energia e criatividade, como podem ver pelo nosso novo logotipo =)

O evento de Setembro vai focar-se na partilha de experiências e dicas bem úteis por um conjunto de oradores convidados (data scientists e engenheiros informáticos).

Sobre os oradores:

Bernardo Caldas é Lead Data Scientist na Vodafone. O nosso convidado afirma no seu LinkedIn ser um DS que “tenta tornar o nosso planeta mais eficiente usando processos orientados para a análise de dados”. É formado em Engenharia Informática e de Computadores pelo Instituto Superior Técnico, tendo também um Mestrado em Advanced Computing - Machine Learning, pelo Imperial College, em Londres. Desempenhou ainda funções de investigador na Coreworks e de Consultor e Project Manager na IBM.

Manuela Almeida trabalha atualmente como Data Scientist na Talkdesk. É formada em Matemática Aplicada à Computação pelo Instituto Superior Técnico, tendo, no entanto, iniciado o seu percurso académico com uma breve passagem pela Faculdade de Ciências Sociais e Humanas (Universidade Nova de Lisboa). A sua experiência profissional nesta área iniciou-se com um estágio na Universidade do Texas (Institute for Computational Engineering and Sciences), tendo posteriormente trabalhado na Maksen como Consultora Junior, na Infosistema e na Morphing Portals desempenhando funções de Data Scientist.

Miguel Ventura é Lead Software Engineer na OutSystems. Tem um Mestrado em Engenharia Informática e de Computadores pelo Instituto Superior Técnico. Iniciou o seu percurso profissional como estagiário OutSystems, onde permanece até hoje.

Isabel Lafaia é Data Scientist na Feedzai. Possui um Mestrado em Engenharia Electrotécnica e Computadores pelo Instituto Superior Técnico e um Doutoramento pela Universidade de Montréal, no Canadá. Possui 3 publicações no jornal científico IEEE, para o qual continua a colaborar como revisora.

Susana Paço é Lead Data Scientist na Cycloid II, no entanto a sua formação de base é na área da Biologia, possuindo uma licenciatura nesta área pelo Instituto Superior de Agronomia. Posteriormente, realizou um mestrado em Ciências no ISCTE. Iniciou a sua actividade profissional como Estagiária na IT Clinical, passando depois para a Cycloid II, onde desempenhou várias funções, até atingir o cargo que hoje desempenha.  

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

We’re back for a new season of R-Ladies’ events! We’re full of energy and creativity, as you can see by our new logo =)

September’s event will focus on sharing experiences and useful tips by a group of invited speakers (data scientists and software engineers).

Event schedule

9h30: How to be a self-taught data scientist?

9h50: How can I prepare for a technical interview? - parte I

10h15: Networking

10h50: How can I prepare for a technical interview? - parte II

11h10: Employability in data science in Portugal

Registration is free, but you must RSVP.

About the speakers:

Bernardo Caldas is Lead Data Scientist at Vodafone and claims to be a “Data Scientist, trying to make our planet smarter using data-driven processes”. He has a Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Engineering, by Instituto Superior Técnico and a Master’s Degree in Advanced Computing - Machine Learning, by Imperial College of London. He worked before as a researcher at Coreworks and as a Consultant and Project Manager at IBM.

Manuela Almeida works as Data Scientist at Talkdesk. She Has a Master’s Degree in Mathematics and Applications by Instituto Superior Técnico, although her academic journey has started in Faculdade de Ciências Sociais e Humanas (Universidade Nova de Lisboa). Her professional experience began with an internship at Texas University (Institute for Computational Engineering and Sciences), and then started working in Maksen, as a Junior Consultant. Before her collaboration at Talkdesk, she worked at Infosistema and Morphing Portals as a Data Scientist.

Miguel Ventura, is a Lead Software Engineer at OutSystems. He has a Master’s Degree in Computer and Software Engineering, by Instituto Superior Técnico. He began his career as an Intern at OutSystems, where he remains ‘till today.

Isabel Lafaia is a Data Scientist at Feedzai. She has a Master’s Degree in Electrical and Computers Engineering by Instituto Superior Técnico and a PhD by University of Montréal, Canada. She has 3 IEEE papers and collaborates in the same journal as a reviewer.

Susana Paço is a Lead Data Scientist at Cycloid II. She began her academic career in Biology, at Instituto Superior de Agronomia. Later she took a Master in Science by ISCTE. She started her career as an Intern at IT Clinical, and after that she began her work at Cycloid II, where she developed several working roles, until she became Lead DS.

name: Present your work with Markdown and Shiny
description:
(mensagem em português a seguir)

Present your work with Markdown and Shiny

Speaker: Adrianna Napiórkowska

Summary:

The way to present a data analysis is of utmost importance to guide your audience through the important findings.

During this meeting,we’ll see how to do it using Markdown – a simple text editor, that will allow you to create reports straight from R code. It is a great tool for automated reporting and reproducible research.

And if static report is not enough, you can build interactive applications with Shiny. That will allow exploring data in the browser or even create dashboards.  

The presentation will be given in English.

Please, note that all materials will be shared after the meeting and there is no need to bring a laptop.

Agenda:

19h00 - presentation

19h50 - Q&A

20h00 - networking

Bio:

Adrianna Napiórkowska studies Advanced Analytics at Nova Information Management School and works in REBIS Consulting as a BI Consultant. She comes from Poland, where she was also organizing workshops for R-Ladies Warsaw.

==========================================================================

Sumário:

A maneira como se apresenta uma análise de dados é de extrema importância para conseguir transmitir à audiência as conclusões do estudo.

Neste encontro, veremos como fazê-lo utilizando Markdown -- um simples editor de texto que permite criar relatórios directamente de código em R. Esta é uma ferramenta muito útil para criar relatórios de maneira automática e reproduzível.

E se isto não fôr suficiente, é ainda possível criar aplicações interactivas com Shiny, que permitirá explorar os dados num browser web.

A apresentação será dada em Inglês.

Todos os materiais serão fornecidos após o evento e não é necessário trazer computador.

Agenda:

19h00 - apresentação

19h50 - questões

20h00 - networking

Bio:

Adrianna Napiórkowska estuda Advanced Analytics na Nova Information Management School e trabalha com consultora BI na Rebis. A Adrianna é natural da Polónia, onde participou como organizadora das R-Ladies Warsaw.

name: All about Data Science!
description:
Mais uma vez as R-Ladies Lisboa juntam-se à Nova IMS para organizar um meetup focado em Data Science e em R.

Teremos connosco dois oradores:
- Sofia Carvalho - Data Scientist at Nokia, PhD, MASt, Eng
- Jan-Benedikt Jagusch - Data Scientist | Teacher | Public Speaker

Todas as apresentações serão feitas em inglês.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Once more, R-Ladies Lisboa and Nova IMS get together to host a new meetup focused in Data Science and R programming language.

We'll have with us two speakers:
- Sofia Carvalho - Data Scientist at Nokia, PhD, MASt, Eng
- Jan-Benedikt Jagusch - Data Scientist | Teacher | Public Speaker

All presentations will be in english.

== Presentations and bio's ==

*1st presentation*: "Estimating customer satisfaction" by C. Sofia Carvalho - Data Scientist at Nokia, PhD, MASt, Eng

The speaker will present a basic, systematic formalism to estimate the satisfaction level of customers, given data on the used service and the corresponding reply to a customer survey. The formalism is tested with different levels of feature engineering, different variable selection methods and different sampling methods. The formalism also includes the derivation of the achievable target, which can be translated into business intelligence in support of target negotiations with customers.

Speaker's short bio:
Sofia is a physicist and data scientist at Nokia, having a PhD degree from Cambridge University and 12 years of postdoctoral experience. Her research activity has covered topics of both theoretical physics and applied mathematics, ranging from the construction of mathematical predictive models to signal processing and data analysis, from cosmology/astrophysics to genetics/proteomics. Sofia has also worked as a consultant and software designer.

*2nd presentation*: "The Untold Story of Prof. Oak's Research Intern - Bringing Powerful Data Visualization to the World of Pokémon" by Jan-Benedikt Jagusch - Data Scientist | Teacher | Public Speaker

No matter if you are a data scientist or a Pokémon researcher: powerful data visualization can tremendously help you in making your colleagues, supervisors and clients understand and acknowledge your work. In Jan's talk, we will travel to Prof. Oak's laboratory in Pallet Town, where he will apply ggplot2 visualization to the world of Pokémon. We will be guided through all steps involved in creating stunning plots, such as choosing palettes, customizing themes and exporting results.

Speaker's short bio:
Jan is a Master student in Information Management at Nova IMS as well as assisting teacher of Master-level courses in Text Analytics and Decision Support Systems. He's an active member of the Genetic Programming research group, where he develops evolutionary operators for Neural Network topologies. Jan serves as president of the Nova Analytics Group – a student association on campus – where he applies Data Science to public projects and student competitions.

name: Intro to R with DataCamp Part 1
description:
• LEARN:

If you've wanted to learn to code in R, THIS is your chance. R-Ladies STL will be hosting a 4-hour cRash course on R, using DataCamp introductory modules. DataCamp has agreed to provide FREE access for all our Meetup attendees to their entire course catalog for the Meetup (and for 30 days following the Meetup!). So, even if you are not a true beginner, please join us, meet some local R-Ladies, and try a couple DataCamp courses to improve your R skills for FREE.

There will be R-Ladies on hand to help answer questions and get you up and Running in R. We welcome all skill levels as those with some or more advanced skills can help those just getting started in R. We are hoping to have an Intro to R Part 2 at the next meeting to answer any questions from Part 1, and to continue the learning process.

https://www.google.com/search?q=video+how+to+install+R+&ie=utf-8&oe=utf-8&client=firefox-b-1#kpvalbx=1

name: Reproducible Research in R
description:
If you looked back at some R code you wrote last year (or even last week), would you be able to understand what you did and why you did it? If you suddenly left your current job, would your colleagues be able to find and follow your code?

Confusing code can cost you time, makes it harder to collaborate, and lowers the quality of work. Fortunately, there are promising practices for code formatting and other reproducible practices in R (and other coding languages) that are easy to use.

Join Bobbi Carothers for a hands-on workshop that will:

- Demonstrate 10 simple formatting tips to improve your R code
- Introduce an R package for automatically creating a codebook from your data
- Provide an introduction to GitHub and why it is useful for sharing and collaborating on code and documentation

You will leave with access to an online Reproducibility Toolkit with tips and instructions on code formatting, data documentation, and how to use GitHub that you can use and share.

A special THANK YOU to NetEffects for providing snacks for this Meetup and to Sense Corp for providing space! We appreciate your support for R-Ladies STL!

name: Plotting something great: Making graphs in R
description:
Come join us to learn more about all the options you have for making great graphs in R! In the first hour, St. Louis R-Lady Shelly Cooper will teach how to use the tidyverse for graphing. She will cover piping and common functions like long and wide formats, grouping, summarizing, etc. In the second hour she will explain some of the more advanced aspects of graphing in ggplot2 with R. This will include faceting, color pallets, themes, arranging multiple plots, etc.

A special THANK YOU to Stephanie Grimshaw with NetEffects for providing snacks for this Meetup and to Amy Hulse with Microsoft for hosting us in the Microsoft Cortex space! We appreciate your support for R-Ladies STL!

name: Git going with GitHub
description:
Join R-Ladies STL for an introduction to GitHub and using it with R by local R-Lady Laura Brugger.

We will meet in the Microsoft space on the 5th floor of the 4220 building at the Cortex (thank you Amy Hulse and Microsoft!) and will have a light breakfast sponsored by Net Effects (thank you Steph Grimshaw!). GitHub Octocat laptop stickers will be available for participants (thank you GitHub!). How can you possibly go wrong with free food, stickers, and learning!

There is lots of free parking near the building, especially since it is the weekend. The Cortex Metro stop is about a 1-2 minute walk to the door of the building as well.

Hope to see you there!

~ R-Ladies STL

Xiaoyan has been teaching R as part of the Brown School StatLab team and in her roles as teaching assistant for advanced epidemiology and biostatistics and instructor of the R skills course.

More details forthcoming!

name: Cleaning messy data in R
